478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   442) 			<h3>Base Concept</h3>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500   443) 			<p>Informative data about <a>objects</a> that are considered prototypes for the <a>role</a>. Base concept is similar to type, but without inheritance of limitations and properties. Base concepts are designed as a substitute for inheritance for external concepts. A base concept is like a <a href="#relatedConcept">related concept</a> except that the base concept is almost identical to the role definition.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700   444) 			<p>For example, the <rref>checkbox</rref> defined in this document has similar functionality and anticipated behavior to a <code>&lt;input[type="checkbox"]&gt;</code> defined in [[HTML]]. Therefore, a <rref>checkbox</rref> has an [[HTML]] <code>checkbox</code> as a <code>baseConcept</code>. However, if the original [[HTML]] checkbox baseConcept definition is modified, the definition of a <rref>checkbox</rref> in this document will not be affected, because there is no actual inheritance of the respective type.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   445) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   446) 	</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   447) 	<section id="Properties">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   448) 		<h2>Characteristics of Roles</h2>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   449) 		<p>Roles are defined and described by their characteristics. Characteristics define the structural function of a role, such as what a role is, concepts behind it, and what instances the role can or must contain. In the case of <a>widgets</a> this also includes how it interacts with the <a>user agent</a> based on mapping to <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> forms. States and properties from <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> that are supported by the role are also indicated.</p>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   450) 		<p>Roles define the following characteristics. </p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   451) 		<section id="isAbstract">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   452) 			<h3>Abstract Roles</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   453) 			<dl class="runin">
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   454) 					<dt>Values</dt>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   455) 					<dd>Boolean</dd>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   456) 				</dl>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500   457) 			<p>Abstract <a>roles</a> are the foundation upon which all other <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> roles are built. Content authors MUST NOT use abstract roles because they are not implemented in the <abbr title="application programing interface">API</abbr> binding. User agents MUST NOT map abstract roles to the standard role mechanism of the accessibility API. Abstract roles are provided to help with the following:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   458) 			<ol>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   459) 				<li>Organize the Roles Model and provide roles with a meaning in the context of known concepts.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   460) 				<li>Streamline the addition of roles that include necessary features.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   461) 			</ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   462) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   463) 		<section id="requiredState">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   464) 			<h3>Required States and Properties</h3>
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200   465) 			<p><a>States</a> and <a>properties</a> specifically required for the <a>role</a> and subclass roles. Content authors MUST provide a non-empty <span>value</span> for required states and properties. Content authors MUST NOT use the value <code>undefined</code> for required states and properties, unless <code>undefined</code> is an explicitly-supported value of that state or property.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   466) 			<p>When an <a>object</a> inherits from multiple ancestors and one ancestor indicates that property is supported while another ancestor indicates that it is required, the property is required in the inheriting object.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   467) 			<p class="note">A host language attribute with the appropriate <a href="#implicit_semantics">implicit WAI-ARIA semantic</a> fulfills this requirement.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   468) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   469) 		<section id="supportedState">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   470) 			<h3>Supported States and Properties</h3>
5eccf5f21 index.html     (Wilco Fiers         2020-04-04 01:52:07 +0200   471) 			<p><a>States</a> and <a>properties</a> specifically applicable to the <a>role</a> and child roles. Content authors MAY provide <span>values</span> for supported states and properties, but need not in cases where default values are sufficient. <a>User agents</a> MUST map all supported states and properties for the role to an accessibility API. If the state or property is undefined and it has a default value for the role, <a>user agents</a> SHOULD expose the default value.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   472) 			<p class="note">A host language attribute with the appropriate <a href="#implicit_semantics">implicit WAI-ARIA semantic</a> fulfills this requirement.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   473) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   474) 		<section id="inheritedattributes">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   475) 			<h3>Inherited States and Properties</h3>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   476) 			<p>Informative list of properties that are inherited by a <a>role</a> from superclass roles. <a>States</a> and <a>properties</a> are inherited from superclass roles in the Roles Model, not from ancestor <a>elements</a> in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> tree. These properties are not explicitly defined on the role, as the inheritance of properties is automatic. This information is provided to facilitate reading of the specification. The set of supported states and properties combined with inherited states and properties forms the full set of states and properties supported by the role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   477) 		</section>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   478) 		<section id="prohibitedattributes">
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   479) 				<h3>Prohibited States and Properties</h3>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   480) 				<p>List of states and properties that are prohibited on a <a>role</a>. Authors MUST NOT specify a prohibited state or property.</p>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   481) 				<p class="note">A host language attribute with the appropriate <a href="#implicit_semantics">implicit WAI-ARIA semantic</a> would also prohibit a state or property in this section. </p>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   482) 			</section>		
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   483) 		<section id="mustContain">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   484) 			<h3>Required Owned Elements</h3>
65c29f7af index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-11 22:50:20 -0400   485) 			<p>Any <a>element</a> that will be <a>owned</a> by the element with this <a>role</a>. For example, an element with the role <rref>list</rref> will own at least one element with the role <rref>listitem</rref>.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500   486) 			<p>When multiple roles are specified as <em>required owned elements</em> for a role, at least one instance of one required <a>owned</a> element is expected. This specification does <em>not</em> require an instance of each of the listed owned roles. For example, a <code>menu</code> should have at least one instance of a <code>menuitem</code>, <code>menuitemcheckbox</code>, <em>or</em> <code>menuitemradio</code>. The <code>menu</code> role does not require one instance of each. </p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500   487) 			<p>There may be times that required <a>owned</a> elements are missing, for example, while editing or while loading a data set. When a widget is missing <em>required owned elements</em> due to script execution or loading, authors MUST mark a containing element with <sref>aria-busy</sref> equal to <code>true</code>. For example, until a page is fully initialized and complete, an author could mark the document element as busy.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   488) 			<p class="note">A role that has 'required owned elements' does not imply the reverse relationship. While processing of a role may be incomplete without elements of given roles present as descendants, elements with roles in this list do not always have to be found within elements of the given role. See <a href="#scope">required context role</a> for requirements about the context where elements of a given role will be contained.</p>
2c06f336b index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-08-20 13:07:27 -0400   489) 			<p class="note">An element with a <a href="#subclassroles">subclass role</a> of the 'required owned element' does not fulfill this requirement. For example, the <rref>listbox</rref> role requires ownership of an element using the <rref>option</rref> or <rref>group</rref> role. Although the <rref>group</rref> role is the superclass of <rref>row</rref>, adding an <a>owned</a> element with a role of <rref>row</rref> will not fulfill the requirement that <rref>listbox</rref> owns an <rref>option</rref> or a <rref>group</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   490) 			<p class="note">An element with the appropriate <a href="#implicit_semantics">implicit WAI-ARIA semantic</a> fulfills this requirement.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   491) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   492) 		<section id="scope">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   493) 			<h3>Required Context Role</h3>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500   494) 			<p>The required context role defines the owning container where this <a>role</a> is allowed. If a role has a required context, authors MUST ensure that an element with the role is contained inside (or <a>owned</a> by) an element with the required context role. For example, an element with role <code>listitem</code> is only meaningful when contained inside (or <a>owned</a> by) an element with role <code>list</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   495) 			<p class="note">A role that has 'required context role' does not imply the reverse relationship. While an element with the given role needs to appear within an element of the listed role(s) in order to be meaningful, elements of the listed roles do not always need descendant elements of the given role in order to be meaningful. See <a href="#mustContain">required owned elements</a> for requirements about elements that require presence of a given descendant to be processed properly.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   496) 			<p class="note">An element with the appropriate <a href="#implicit_semantics">implicit WAI-ARIA semantic</a> fulfills this requirement.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   497) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   498) 		<section id="namecalculation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   499) 			<h3>Accessible Name Calculation</h3>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   500) 			<dl class="runin">
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   501) 				<dt>Values</dt>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   502) 				<dd>One of the following values:
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   503) 					<ol>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   504) 						<li>author: name comes from values provided by the author in explicit markup features such as the <pref>aria-label</pref> attribute, the <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute, or the host language labeling mechanism, such as the <code>alt</code> or <code>title</code> attributes in <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>, with HTML <code>title</code> attribute having the lowest precedence for specifying a text alternative.</li>
709453fb8 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2021-02-21 19:23:45 -0500   505) 						<li>contents: name comes from the text value of the <a>element</a> <a>node</a>. Although this may be allowed in addition to "author" in some <a>roles</a>, this is used in content only if higher priority "author" features are not provided. Priority is defined by the <a href="#mapping_additional_nd_te" class="accname">accessible name and description computation</a> algorithm [[ACCNAME-1.2]].</li>
259b2f578 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2021-05-05 22:27:41 -0400   506)                         <li>prohibited: the element does not support name from author. Authors MUST NOT use the <pref>aria-label</pref> or <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attributes to name the element.</li>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   507) 					</ol>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   508) 				</dd>
9a5c9bba4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-16 12:15:40 -0400   509) 			</dl>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   510) 			<section id="namecomputation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   511) 				<h4>Name Computation</h4>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700   512) 				<p><a href="#mapping_additional_nd_name" class="accname">Name Computation</a> is defined in the Accessible Name and Description specification.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   513) 			</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   514) 			<section id="descriptioncomputation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   515) 				<h4>Description Computation</h4>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700   516) 				<p><a href="#mapping_additional_nd_description" class="accname">Description Computation</a> is defined in the Accessible Name and Description specification.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   517) 			</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   518) 			<section id="textalternativecomputation">
aa02d6143 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2018-10-18 11:04:45 +0200   519) 				<h4>Accessible Name and Description Computation</h4>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700   520) 				<p><a href="#mapping_additional_nd_te" class="accname">Accessible Name and Description Computation</a> is defined in the Accessible Name and Description specification.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   521) 			</section>
f9053500d aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-06-15 08:44:35 -0500   522)             <section id="namefromauthor">
089483108 aria/aria.html (Joseph Scheuhammer  2016-09-08 14:18:50 -0400   523)                 <h4>Roles Supporting Name from Author</h4>
5569456cc index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-11 17:45:39 -0400   524)                 <div id="index_fromauthor">
5569456cc index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-11 17:45:39 -0400   525)                 </div>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   526) 			</section>
f9053500d aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-06-15 08:44:35 -0500   527)             <section id="namefromcontent">
089483108 aria/aria.html (Joseph Scheuhammer  2016-09-08 14:18:50 -0400   528)                 <h4>Roles Supporting Name from Content</h4>
f9053500d aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-06-15 08:44:35 -0500   529)                 <div id="index_fromcontent">
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   530)                 </div>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   531) 			</section>						
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   532) 			<section id="namefromprohibited">
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   533)                 <h4>Roles which cannot be named (Name prohibited)</h4>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700   534)                 <div id="index_fromprohibited">
f9053500d aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-06-15 08:44:35 -0500   535)                 </div>
f9053500d aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-06-15 08:44:35 -0500   536)             </section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   537) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   538) 		<section id="childrenArePresentational">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   539) 			<h3>Presentational Children</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   540) 			<dl class="runin">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   541) 				<dt>Values</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   542) 				<dd>
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200   543) 					<p>Boolean (<code>true</code> | <code>false</code>)</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   544) 				</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   545) 			</dl>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500   546) 			<p>The <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> descendants are presentational. <a>User agents</a> SHOULD NOT expose descendants of this <a>element</a> through the platform <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interface">API</abbr></a>. If <a>user agents</a> do not hide the descendant nodes, some information may be read twice.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   547) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   548) 		<section id="implictValueForRole">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   549) 			<h3>Implicit Value for Role</h3>
b137bbd5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-01-11 10:30:20 -0800   550) 			<p>Many states and properties have default values. Occasionally, the default value when used on a given role should be different from the usual default. Roles that require a state or property to have a non-standard default value indicate this in the "Implicit Value for Role". This is expressed in the form "Default for <code>state or property name</code> is <code>new default value</code>". Roles that define this have the new default value for the state or property if the author does not provide an explicit value.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   551) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   552) 	</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   553) 	<section id="roles_categorization">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   554) 		<h2>Categorization of Roles</h2>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500   555) 		<p>To support the current user scenario, this specification categorizes <a>roles</a> that define user interface <a>widgets</a> (sliders, tree controls, etc.) and those that define page structure (sections, navigation, etc.). Note that some assistive technologies provide special modes of interaction for regions marked with role <code>application</code> or <code>document</code>.</p>
7ca3f2d0f index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-04-21 22:22:24 -0400   556) 		<p>A visual description of the relationships among roles is available in the <a href="https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/1.2/class-diagram/">ARIA 1.2 Class Diagram</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   557) 		<p>Roles are categorized as follows:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   558) 		<ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   559) 			<li><a href="#abstract_roles">Abstract Roles</a></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   560) 			<li><a href="#widget_roles">Widget Roles</a></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   561) 			<li><a href="#document_structure_roles">Document Structure Roles</a></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   562) 			<li><a href="#landmark_roles">Landmark Roles</a></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   563) 			<li><a href="#live_region_roles">Live Region Roles</a></li>
afc8c3ce3 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-01-13 03:32:44 -0500   564) 			<li><a href="#window_roles">Window Roles</a></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   565) 		</ol>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   678) 		<section id="landmark_roles">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   679) 			<h3>Landmark Roles</h3>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700   680) 			<p>The following <a>roles</a> are regions of the page intended as navigational <a>landmarks</a>. All of these roles inherit from the <code>landmark</code> base type and all are imported from the <cite><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/role-attribute/#s_role_module_attributes">Role Attribute</a></cite> [[ROLE-ATTRIBUTE]]. The roles are included here in order to make them clearly part of the <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Roles Model.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   681) 			<ul>

afc8c3ce3 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-01-13 03:32:44 -0500   705) 			<p>The following <a>roles</a> act as windows within the browser or application.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   712) 	<section id="role_definitions">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   713) 		<h2>Definition of Roles</h2>
90438c4e3 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:21:05 -0400   714) 		<p>Below is an alphabetical list of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <a>roles</a> to be used by authors.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   715) 		<p>Abstract roles are used for the ontology. Authors MUST NOT use abstract roles in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   716) 		<p id="index_role">Placeholder for compact list of roles</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   717) 		<div class="role" id="alert">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   718) 			<rdef>alert</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   719) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   720) 				<p>A type of <a>live region</a> with important, and usually time-sensitive, information. See related <rref>alertdialog</rref> and <rref>status</rref>.</p>
90438c4e3 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:21:05 -0400   721) 				<p>Alerts are used to convey messages that may be immediately important to users. In the case of audio warnings, alerts provide an accessible alternative for hearing-impaired users. The <code>alert</code> <a>role</a> is applied to the element containing the alert message. An <code>alert</code> is a specialized form of the <rref>status</rref> role, which is processed as an atomic <a>live region</a>.</p>
90438c4e3 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:21:05 -0400   722) 				<p>Alerts are assertive live regions, which means they cause immediate notification for assistive technology users. If the operating system allows, the <a>user agent</a> SHOULD fire a system alert <a>event</a> through the accessibility API when the <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> alert is created.</p>
90438c4e3 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:21:05 -0400   723) 				<p>Neither authors nor user agents are required to set or manage focus to an alert in order for it to be processed. Since alerts are not required to receive focus, authors SHOULD NOT require users to close an alert. If an author desires focus to move to a message when it is conveyed, the author SHOULD use <rref>alertdialog</rref> instead of <code>alert</code>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500   724) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>alert</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-live</pref> value of <code>assertive</code>, and an implicit <pref>aria-atomic</pref> value of <code>true</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   725) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   796) 						<th class="implicit-values-head">Implicit Value for Role:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   797) 						<td class="implicit-values">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   798) 							Default for <pref>aria-live</pref> is <code class="default">assertive</code>.<br/>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   799) 							Default for <pref>aria-atomic</pref> is <code class="default">true</code>.
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   800) 						</td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   805) 		<div class="role" id="alertdialog">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   806) 			<rdef>alertdialog</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   807) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   808) 				<p>A type of dialog that contains an alert message, where initial focus goes to an <a>element</a> within the dialog. See related <rref>alert</rref> and <rref>dialog</rref>.</p>
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200   809) 				<p>Alert dialogs are used to convey messages to alert the user. The <code>alertdialog</code> <a>role</a> goes on the node containing both the alert message and the rest of the dialog. Content authors SHOULD make alert dialogs modal by ensuring that, while the <code>alertdialog</code> is shown, keyboard and mouse interactions only operate within the dialog. See <pref>aria-modal</pref>.</p>
90438c4e3 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:21:05 -0400   810) 				<p>Unlike <rref>alert</rref>, <code>alertdialog</code> can receive a response from the user. For example, to confirm that the user understands the alert being generated. When the alert dialog is displayed, authors SHOULD set focus to an active element within the alert dialog, such as a form control or confirmation button. The <a>user agent</a> SHOULD fire a system alert <a>event</a> through the accessibility API when the alert is created, provided one is specified by the intended <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500   811) 				<p>Authors SHOULD use <pref>aria-describedby</pref> on an <code>alertdialog</code> to reference the alert message element in the dialog. If they do not, an <a>assistive technology</a> can resort to its internal recovery mechanism to determine the contents of the alert message.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   812) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   874) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   875) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   876) 						<th class="role-namerequired-inherited-head" scope="row">Inherits Name Required:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   877) 						<td class="role-namerequired-inherited"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   878) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   879) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   880) 						<th class="role-childpresentational-head" scope="row">Children Presentational:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   881) 						<td class="role-childpresentational"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   882) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   883) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   884) 						<th class="role-presentational-inherited-head" scope="row">Inherits Presentational:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   885) 						<td class="role-presentational-inherited"> </td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   889) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   890) 		<div class="role" id="application">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   891) 			<rdef>application</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   892) 			<div class="role-description">
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   893) 				<p>A <rref>structure</rref> containing one or more focusable elements requiring user input, such as keyboard or gesture events, that do not follow a standard interaction pattern supported by a <rref>widget</rref> role.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   894) 				<p>Some <a>user agents</a> and <a>assistive technologies</a> have a browse mode where standard input events, such as up and down arrow key events, are intercepted and used to control a reading cursor. This browse mode behavior prevents elements that do not have a <rref>widget</rref> role from receiving and using such keyboard and gesture events to provide interactive functionality.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   895) 				<p>When there is a need to create an element with an interaction model that is not supported by any of the <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <rref>widget</rref> roles, authors MAY give that element role <code>application</code>. And, when a user navigates into an element with role <code>application</code>, <a>assistive technologies</a> that intercept standard input events SHOULD switch to a mode that passes most or all standard input events through to the web application.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   896) 				<p>For example, a presentation slide editor uses arrow keys to change the positions of textbox and image elements on the slide. There are not any WAI-ARIA <rref>widget</rref> roles that correspond to such an interaction model so an author could give the slide container role <code>application</code>, an <pref>aria-roledescription</pref> of &quot;Slide Editor&quot;, and use <pref>aria-describedby</pref> to provide instructions.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   897) 				<p> Because only the focusable elements contained in an <code>application</code> element are accessible to users of some assistive technologies, authors MUST use one of the following techniques to ensure all non-decorative static text or image content inside an application is accessible:</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   898) 				<ol>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   899) 					<li>Associate the content with a focusable element using <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> or <pref>aria-describedby</pref>.</li>
93f7cee7c aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-19 14:02:55 -0400   900) 					<li>Place the content in a focusable element that has role <rref>document</rref> or <rref>article</rref>.</li>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500   901) 					<li>Manage focus of <a>owned</a> elements as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>, updating the value of <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref> to reference the <a>element</a> containing the focused content.</li>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500   902) 				</ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   903) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   904) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   985) 		<div class="role" id="article">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   986) 			<rdef>article</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   987) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   988) 				<p>A section of a page that consists of a composition that forms an independent part of a document, page, or site.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   989) 				<p>An article is not a navigational <a>landmark</a>, but may be nested to form a discussion where assistive technologies could pay attention to article nesting to assist the user in following the discussion. An article could be a forum post, a magazine or newspaper article, a web log entry, a user-submitted comment, or any other independent item of content. It is <em>independent</em> in that its contents could stand alone, for example in syndication. However, the <a>element</a> is still associated with its ancestors; for instance, contact information that applies to a parent body element still covers the article as well. When nesting articles, the child articles represent content that is related to the content of the parent article. For instance, a web log entry on a site that accepts user-submitted comments could represent the comments as articles nested within the article for the web log entry. Author, heading, date, or other information associated with an article does not apply to nested articles.</p>
195e4a242 aria/aria.html (carmacleod          2016-04-22 18:40:16 -0400   990) 				<p>When the user navigates to an element assigned the role of <code>article</code>, <a>assistive technologies</a> that typically intercept standard keyboard events SHOULD switch to document browsing mode, as opposed to passing keyboard events through to the web application. Assistive technologies MAY provide a feature allowing the user to navigate the hierarchy of any nested <code>article</code> elements.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700   991) 				<p>When an <code>article</code> is in the context of a <rref>feed</rref>, the author MAY specify values for <pref>aria-posinset</pref> and <pref>aria-setsize</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   992) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400   993) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1016) 						<td class="role-base"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1017) 					</tr>

9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  1020) 						<td class="role-related"><code>&lt;article&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1021) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1022) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1024) 						<td class="role-scope"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1025) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1070) 		<div class="role" id="banner">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1071) 			<rdef>banner</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1072) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  1073) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> that contains mostly site-oriented content, rather than page-specific content.</p>
195e4a242 aria/aria.html (carmacleod          2016-04-22 18:40:16 -0400  1074) 				<p>Site-oriented content typically includes things such as the logo or identity of the site sponsor, and a site-specific search tool. A banner usually appears at the top of the page and typically spans the full width.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  1075) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>banner</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1076) 				<!-- keep the following paragraphs synced with the similar paragraphs in #main and #contentinfo-->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1077) 				<p>Within any <rref>document</rref> or <rref>application</rref>, the author SHOULD mark no more than one <a>element</a> with the <code>banner</code> <a>role</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1078) 				<p class="note">Because <code>document</code> and <code>application</code> elements can be nested in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, they may have multiple <code>banner</code> elements as <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> descendants, assuming each of those is associated with different document nodes, either by a DOM nesting (e.g., <rref>document</rref> within <rref>document</rref>) or by use of the <pref>aria-owns</pref> <a>attribute</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1079) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1229) 		<div class="role" id="button">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1230) 			<rdef>button</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1231) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1232) 				<p>An input that allows for user-triggered actions when clicked or pressed. See related <rref>link</rref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  1233) 				<p>Buttons are mostly used for discrete actions. Standardizing the appearance of buttons enhances the user's recognition of the <a>widgets</a> as buttons and allows for a more compact display in toolbars.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1234) 				<p>Buttons support the optional <a>attribute</a> <sref>aria-pressed</sref>. Buttons with a non-empty <sref>aria-pressed</sref> attribute are toggle buttons. When <sref>aria-pressed</sref> is <code>true</code> the button is in a "pressed" <a>state</a>, when <sref>aria-pressed</sref> is <code>false</code> it is not pressed. If the attribute is not present, the button is a simple command button.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1235) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1236) 			<table class="role-features">

efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1322) 		<div class="role" id="caption">
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1323) 			<rdef>caption</rdef>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1324) 			<div class="role-description">
dfc6c8ae8 index.html     (Sarah Higley        2020-02-11 10:58:01 -0800  1325) 				<p>Visible content that names, and may also describe, a <rref>figure</rref>, <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1326) 				<p>When using <code>caption</code> authors SHOULD ensure:</p>
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1327) 				<ul>
dfc6c8ae8 index.html     (Sarah Higley        2020-02-11 10:58:01 -0800  1328) 					<li>The <code>caption</code> is a direct child of a <rref>figure</rref>, <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</li>
dfc6c8ae8 index.html     (Sarah Higley        2020-02-11 10:58:01 -0800  1329) 					<li>The <code>caption</code> is the first child of a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</li>
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1330) 					<li>The <code>caption</code> is the first or last child of a <rref>figure</rref>.</li>
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1331) 				</ul>
dfc6c8ae8 index.html     (Sarah Higley        2020-02-11 10:58:01 -0800  1332) 				<p>Authors SHOULD set <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> on the parent <code>figure</code>, <code>table</code>, <code>grid</code>, or <rref>treegrid</rref> to reference the element with role <code>caption</code>. However, if a <code>caption</code> contains content that serves as both a name and description for its parent, authors MAY instead set <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> to reference an element within the <code>caption</code> that contains a concise name, and set <pref>aria-describedby</pref> to reference an element within the <code>caption</code> that contains the descriptive content.</p>
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1333) 
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1334) 				<pre class="example highlight">
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1335) 					&lt;div role="table" aria-labelledby="name" aria-describedby="desc"&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1336) 				    &lt;div role="caption"&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1337) 				      &lt;div id="name"&gt;Contest Entrants&lt;/div&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1338) 				      &lt;div id="desc"&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1339) 				        This table shows the total number of entrants (500) the
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1340) 				        contest accepted over the past four weeks.
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1341) 				      &lt;/div&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1342) 				    &lt;/div&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1343) 				    &lt;!-- ... --&gt;
50537ef16 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-25 16:30:01 -0400  1344) 				</pre>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1345) 			</div>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1346) 			<table class="role-features">
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1347) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1348) 				<thead>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1349) 					<tr>
efe72181f index.html     (joanmarie           2018-05-31 13:52:20 -0400  1350) 						<th scope="col">Characteristic</th>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1434) 		<div class="role" id="cell">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1435) 			<rdef>cell</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1436) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  1437) 				<p>A cell in a tabular container. See related <rref>gridcell</rref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  1438) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> cell are contained in, or owned by, an element with the <a>role</a> <rref>row</rref>.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1523) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1524) 		<div class="role" id="checkbox">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1525) 			<rdef>checkbox</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1526) 			<div class="role-description">
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200  1527) 				<p>A checkable input that has three possible <span>values</span>: <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, or <code>mixed</code>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  1528) 				<p>The <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> of a <code>checkbox</code> indicates whether the input is checked (<code>true</code>), unchecked (<code>false</code>), or represents a group of <a>elements</a> that have a mixture of checked and unchecked values (<code>mixed</code>). Many checkboxes do not use the <code>mixed</code> value, and thus are effectively boolean checkboxes.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1529) 			</div>

1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1628) 
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1629) 		<div class="role" id="code">
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1630) 			<rdef>code</rdef>
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1631) 			<div class="role-description">
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1632) 				<p>A section whose content represents a fragment of computer code.</p>
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1633) 				<p>
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1634) 					The primary purpose of the code role is to inform assistive technologies that the content is computer code and
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1635) 					thus may require special presentation, in particular with respect to synthesized speech. More specifically, screen
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1636) 					readers and other tools which provide text-to-speech presentation of content SHOULD prefer full punctuation verbosity to ensure common symbols (e.g. "-") are spoken.
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1637) 				</p>
1b5119e31 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2019-10-24 14:36:40 -0400  1638) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1729) 		<div class="role" id="columnheader">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1730) 			<rdef>columnheader</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1731) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1732) 				<p>A cell containing header information for a column.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1733) 				<p><code>columnheader</code> can be used as a column header in a table or grid. It could also be used in a pie chart to show a similar <a>relationship</a> in the data.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1734) 				<p>The <code>columnheader</code> establishes a relationship between it and all cells in the corresponding column. It is the structural equivalent to an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>th</code> <a>element</a> with a column scope.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  1735) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>columnheader</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>row</rref>.</p>
25b4cc2cd aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-05-13 06:41:56 -0400  1736) 				<p>Applying the <sref>aria-selected</sref> state on a columnheader MUST not cause the user agent to automatically propagate the <sref>aria-selected</sref> state to all the cells in the corresponding column. An author MAY choose to propagate selection in this manner depending on the specific application.</p>
e66a87a88 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-08-27 14:22:13 -0400  1737) 				<p>While the <code>columnheader</code> role can be used in both interactive grids and non-interactive tables, the use of <pref>aria-readonly</pref> and <pref>aria-required</pref> is only applicable to interactive elements. Therefore, authors SHOULD NOT use <pref>aria-required</pref> or <pref>aria-readonly</pref> in a <code>columnheader</code> that descends from a <rref>table</rref>, and user agents SHOULD NOT expose either property to <a>assistive technologies</a> unless the <code>columnheader</code> descends from a <rref>grid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1738) 				<p class="note">Because cells are organized into rows, there is not a single container element for the column. The column is the set of <rref>gridcell</rref> elements in a particular position within their respective <rref>row</rref> containers.</p>
991d90ce6 index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 15:09:49 -0700  1739)                 <p class="note" title="Usage of aria-disabled">While <sref>aria-disabled</sref> is currently supported on <rref>columnheader</rref>, in a future version the working group plans to prohibit its use on elements with role <rref>columnheader</rref> except when the element is in the context of a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1740) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1824) 		<div class="role" id="combobox">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1825) 			<rdef>combobox</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1826) 			<div class="role-description">
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1827) 				<p>An <rref>input</rref> that controls another element, such as a <rref>listbox</rref> or <rref>grid</rref>, that can dynamically pop up to help the user set the value of the <rref>input</rref>.</p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1828) 				<p class="ednote" title="Major Changes to combobox role in ARIA 1.2">
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1829) 					The Guidance for <rref>combobox</rref> has changed significantly in ARIA 1.2 due to problems with implementation of the previous patterns.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1830) 					Authors and developers of User Agents, Assistive Technologies, and Conformance Checkers are advised to review this section carefully to understand the changes.
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1831)           			Explanation of the changes is available in the <a href="https://github.com/w3c/aria/wiki/Resolving-ARIA-1.1-Combobox-Issues">ARIA repository wiki</a>.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1832) 				</p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1833) 				<p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1834) 				A <code>combobox</code> functionally combines a named input field with the ability to assist value selection via a supplementary popup element.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1835) 				A <code>combobox</code> input MAY be either a single-line text field that supports editing and typing or an element that only displays the current value of the <code>combobox</code>.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1836) 				If the <code>combobox</code> supports text input and provides autocompletion behavior as described in <pref>aria-autocomplete</pref>, authors MUST set <pref>aria-autocomplete</pref> on the <code>combobox</code> element to the value that corresponds to the provided behavior.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1837) 				</p>
1fd587c19 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-09-08 15:56:32 -0700  1838) 				<p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1839) 				Typically, the initial state of a <code>combobox</code> is collapsed.
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1840) 				In the collapsed state, only the <code>combobox</code> element and a separate, optional popup control <rref>button</rref> are visible.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1841) 				A <code>combobox</code> is said to be expanded when both the <code>combobox</code> element showing its current value and its associated popup element are visible.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1842) 				Authors MUST set <sref>aria-expanded</sref> to <code>true</code> on an element with role <code>combobox</code> when it is expanded and <code>false</code> when it is collapsed.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1843) 				</p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1844) 				<p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1845) 				Authors MUST ensure the popup element associated with a <code>combobox</code> has a role of <rref>listbox</rref>, <rref>tree</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>dialog</rref>.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1846) 				Authors MUST set <pref>aria-controls</pref> on a <code>combobox</code> element to a value that refers to the <code>combobox</code> popup element.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1847) 				</p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1848) 				<p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1849) 				Elements with the role <code>combobox</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-haspopup</pref> value of <code>listbox</code>.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1850) 				If the <code>combobox</code> popup element has a role other than <rref>listbox</rref>, authors MUST specify a value for <pref>aria-haspopup</pref> that corresponds to the role of its popup.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1851) 				</p>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1852) 				<p>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1853) 				If the user interface includes an additional icon that allows the visibility of the popup to be controlled via pointer and touch events, authors SHOULD ensure that element has role <rref>button</rref>, that it is focusable but not included in the page <kbd>Tab</kbd> sequence, and that it is not a descendant of the element with role <code>combobox</code>.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1854) 				In addition, to be keyboard accessible, authors SHOULD provide keyboard mechanisms for moving focus between the <code>combobox</code> element and elements contained in the popup.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1855) 				For example, one common convention is that <kbd>Down Arrow</kbd> moves focus from the input to the first focusable descendant of the popup element.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1856) 				If the popup element supports <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref>, in lieu of moving focus, such keyboard mechanisms can control the value of <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref> on the <code>combobox</code> element.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1857) 				When a descendant of the popup element is active, authors MAY set <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref> on the <code>combobox</code> to a value that refers to the active element within the popup while focus remains on the <code>combobox</code> element.
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1858) 				</p>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1859) 				<p>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1860) 				User agents MUST expose the value of elements with role <code>combobox</code> to <a>assistive technologies</a>.
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1861) 				The value of a <code>combobox</code> is represented by one of the following:
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1862) 				</p>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1863) 				<ul>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1864) 					<li>If the <code>combobox</code> element is a host language element that provides a value, such as an HTML <code>input</code> element, the value of the combobox is the value of that element.</li>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1865) 					<li>Otherwise, the value of the <code>combobox</code> is represented by its descendant elements and can be determined using the same method used to compute the name of a <rref>button</rref> from its descendant content.</li>
cd720bad7 index.html     (Matt King           2020-04-21 20:22:47 -0700  1866) 				</ul>
a0a916679 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 17:04:17 -0400  1867) 				<pre class="example highlight">
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1868)           &lt;label for="tag_combo">Tag&lt;/label>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1869) 		      &lt;input type="text" id="tag_combo"
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1870)             role="combobox" aria-autocomplete="list"
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1871)             aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-expanded="true"
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1872)             aria-controls="popup_listbox" aria-activedescendant="selected_option"&gt;
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1873) 				  &lt;ul role="listbox" id="popup_listbox"&gt;
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1874) 			      &lt;li role="option"&gt;Zebra&lt;/li&gt;
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  1875) 			      &lt;li role="option" id="selected_option"&gt;Zoom&lt;/li&gt;
a0a916679 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 17:04:17 -0400  1876) 				  &lt;/ul&gt;
a0a916679 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 17:04:17 -0400  1877) 				</pre>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1878) 				<p class="ednote" title="Validity changes combobox for ARIA 1.2">
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1879) 					Please review the following carefully. As a result of these changes a combobox following the ARIA 1.1 combobox specification will no longer conform with the ARIA specification.
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1880) 				</p>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1881) 				<div class="note">
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1882) 				<p>The structural requirements  for <code>combobox</code> defined by this version of the specification are different from the requirements defined by ARIA 1.0 and ARIA 1.1:</p>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1883) 				<ul>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1884) 					<li>The ARIA 1.0 specification required the input element with the <code>combobox</code> role to be a single-line text field and reference the popup element with <pref>aria-owns</pref> instead of <pref>aria-controls</pref>.</li>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1885) 					<li>The ARIA 1.1 specification, which was not broadly supported by assistive technologies, required the <code>combobox</code> to be a non-focusable element with two required owned elements -- a focusable <rref>textbox</rref> and a popup element controlled by the <rref>textbox</rref>.</li>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1886) 					<li>The changes introduced in ARIA 1.2 improve interoperability with assistive technologies and enable authors to create presentations of combobox that more closely imitate a native HTML <code>select</code> element.</li>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1887) 				</ul>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1888) 				</div>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1889) 				<p>The features and behaviors of combobox implementations vary widely. Consequently, there are many important authoring considerations. See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for additional details on implementing combobox design patterns.</p>
8bcf6e342 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-28 13:31:07 -0700  1890) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1981) 						</td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1985) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1986) 		<div class="role" id="command">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1987) 			<rdef>command</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1988) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1989) 				<p>A form of widget that performs an action but does not receive input data.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1990) 				<p class="note"><code>command</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1991) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1992) 			<table class="role-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1993) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  1994) 				<thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2064) 		<div class="role" id="complementary">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2065) 			<rdef>complementary</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2066) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  2067) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> that is designed to be complementary to the main content at a similar level in the DOM hierarchy, but remaining meaningful when separated from the main content.</p>
195e4a242 aria/aria.html (carmacleod          2016-04-22 18:40:16 -0400  2068) 				<p>There are various types of content that would appropriately have this <a>role</a>. For example, in the case of a portal, this may include but not be limited to show times, current weather, related articles, or stocks to watch. The complementary role indicates that contained content is relevant to the main content. If the complementary content is completely separable from the main content, it may be appropriate to use a more general role.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  2069) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>complementary</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2070) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2143) 		<div class="role" id="composite">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2144) 			<rdef>composite</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2145) 			<div class="role-description">
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  2146) 				<p>A <a>widget</a> that may contain navigable descendants or <a>owned</a> children.</p>
195e4a242 aria/aria.html (carmacleod          2016-04-22 18:40:16 -0400  2147) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure that a composite widget exists as a single navigation stop within the larger navigation system of the web page. Once the composite widget has focus, authors SHOULD provide a separate navigation mechanism for users to navigate to <a>elements</a> that are descendants or owned children of the composite element.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2148) 				<p class="note"><code>composite</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2149) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2150) 			<table class="role-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2151) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2152) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2153) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2154) 						<th scope="col">Characteristic</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2155) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2156) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2157) 				</thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2219) 		<div class="role" id="contentinfo">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2220) 			<rdef>contentinfo</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2221) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  2222) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> that contains information about the parent document.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2223) 				<p>Examples of information included in this region of the page are copyrights and links to privacy statements.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  2224) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>contentinfo</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2225) 				<!-- keep the following paragraphs synced with the similar paragraphs in #banner and #main -->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2226) 				<p>Within any <rref>document</rref> or <rref>application</rref>, the author SHOULD mark no more than one <a>element</a> with the <code>contentinfo</code> role.</p>
e4e8982f0 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 16:35:51 -0400  2227) 				<p class="note">Because <code>document</code> and <code>application</code> elements can be nested in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, they may have multiple <code>contentinfo</code> elements as <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> descendants, assuming each of those is associated with different document nodes, either by a DOM nesting (e.g., <rref>document</rref> within <rref>document</rref>) or by use of the <pref>aria-owns</pref> attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2228) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2301) 		<div class="role" id="definition">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2302) 			<rdef>definition</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2303) 			<div class="role-description">
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  2304) 				<p>A definition of a term or concept. See related <rref>term</rref>.</p>
ff75c21f2 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2019-05-28 11:05:39 -0500  2305) 				<p>Authors SHOULD identify the <a>element</a> being defined by giving that element a role of <rref>term</rref> and referencing it with the <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> <a>attribute</a> or by making the element with role <rref>term</rref> a descendant of the element with role <code>definition</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2306) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2307) 			<table class="role-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2308) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2309) 				<thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2313) 					</tr>

78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2375) 		<div class="role" id="deletion">
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2376) 			<rdef>deletion</rdef>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2377) 			<div class="role-description">
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2378) 				<p>A deletion contains content that is marked as removed or content that is being suggested for removal. See related <rref>insertion</rref>.</p>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2379) 				<p>Deletions are typically used to either mark differences between two versions of content or to designate content suggested for removal in scenarios where multiple people are revising content.</p>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  2380) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2458) 		<div class="role" id="dialog">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2459) 			<rdef>dialog</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2460) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2461) 				<p>A dialog is a descendant window of the primary window of a web application. For <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> pages, the primary application window is the entire web document, i.e., the <code>body</code> element.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2462) 				<p>Dialogs are most often used to prompt the user to enter or respond to information. A dialog that is designed to interrupt workflow is usually modal. See related <rref>alertdialog</rref>.</p>
c4363d787 index.html     (Wilco Fiers         2020-02-11 18:38:28 +0100  2463) 				<p>Authors MUST provide an accessible name for a dialog, which can be done with the <pref>aria-label</pref> or <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2464) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure that all dialogs (both modal and non-modal) have at least one focusable descendant element. Authors SHOULD focus an element in the modal dialog when it is displayed, and authors SHOULD manage focus of modal dialogs.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2465) 				<p class="note">In the description of this role, the term "web application" does not refer to the <rref>application</rref> role, which specifies specific assistive technology behaviors.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2466) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2467) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2472) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2473) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2474) 				</thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2478) 						<td class="role-abstract"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2479) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2480) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2481) 						<th class="role-parent-head" scope="row">Superclass Role:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2482) 						<td class="role-parent"><rref>window</rref></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2483) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2539) 		<div class="role" id="directory">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2540) 			<rdef>directory</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2541) 			<div class="role-description">
0c7de4bed index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-11 22:59:40 -0400  2542) 				<p>[Deprecated in ARIA 1.2] A list of references to members of a group, such as a static table of contents.</p>
0c7de4bed index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-11 22:59:40 -0400  2543) 				<p class="note">As exposed by accessibility APIs, the <code>directory</code> <a>role</a> is essentially equivalent to the <code>list</code> <a>role</a>. So, using <code>directory</code> does not provide any additional benefits to assistive technology users. Authors are advised to treat <code>directory</code> as deprecated and to use <code>list</code>, or a host language's equivalent semantics instead.</p>
0c7de4bed index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-11 22:59:40 -0400  2544) 				<p>A <code>directory</code> is a static table of contents, whether linked or unlinked. This includes tables of contents built with lists, including nested lists. Dynamic tables of contents, however, might use a <rref>tree</rref> role instead.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2545) 			</div>
