478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2618) 		<div class="role" id="document">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2619) 			<rdef>document</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2620) 			<div class="role-description">
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500  2621) 				<p>An <a>element</a> containing content that <a>assistive technology</a> users may want to browse in a reading mode.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500  2622) 				<p>When <a>user agent</a> focus moves to an element assigned the role of <code>document</code>, <a>assistive technologies</a> having a reading mode for browsing static content MAY switch to that reading mode and intercept standard input events, such as Up or Down arrow keyboard events, to control the reading cursor.</p>
edb65b291 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-11-12 16:39:11 -0500  2623) 				<p>Because <a>assistive technologies</a> that have a reading mode default to that mode for all elements except for those with either a <rref>widget</rref> or <rref>application</rref> role, the only circumstance where the <code>document</code> role is useful for changing assistive technology behavior is when the element with role <code>document</code> is a focusable child element of a <rref>widget</rref> or <rref>application</rref>. For example, given an <rref>application</rref> element which contains some static rich text, the author can apply role <code>document</code> to the element containing the text and give it a <code>tabindex</code> of <code>0</code>. When a screen reader user presses the Tab key and places focus on the <code>document</code> element, the user will be able to read the text with the screen reader's reading cursor.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2624) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2625) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2631) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2632) 				</thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2634) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2636) 						<td class="role-abstract"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2637) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2638) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2640) 						<td class="role-parent"><rref>structure</rref></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2641) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2642) 					<tr>

fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2697) 		<div class="role" id="emphasis">
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2698) 			<rdef>emphasis</rdef>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2699) 			<div class="role-description">
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2700) 				<p>One or more emphasized characters. See related <rref>strong</rref>.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2701) 				<p>The purpose of the <code>emphasis</code> role is to stress or emphasize content. It is not for communicating changes in typographical presentation that do not impact the meaning of the content. Authors SHOULD use the <code>emphasis</code> role only if its absence would change the meaning of the content.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2702) 				<p>The <code>emphasis</code> role is not intended to convey importance; for that purpose, the <rref>strong</rref> role is more appropriate.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  2703) 			</div>

fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2785) 		<div class="role" id="feed">
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2786) 			<rdef>feed</rdef>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2787) 				<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  2788) 					<p>A scrollable <rref>list</rref> of <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> where scrolling may cause <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> to be added to or removed from either end of the list.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2789) 					<p>A <code>feed</code> enables users of <a>assistive technologies</a> that have a document browse mode, such as  screen readers, to use the browse mode reading cursor to both read and scroll through a stream of rich content that may continue scrolling infinitely by loading more content as the user reads. In a <code>feed</code>, <a>assistive technologies</a> provide a web application with signals of the user's reading cursor movement by moving <a>user agent</a> focus, enabling the application to both add new content and visually position content as the user browses the page. The <code>feed</code> also lets authors inform assistive technologies when additions and removals are occurring so assistive technologies can more reliably update their reading view without disrupting reading or degrading performance.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2790) 					<p>For example, a <code>feed</code> could be used to present a stream of news stories where each <rref>article</rref> contains a story with text, links, images, and comments as well as widgets for sharing and commenting. As a screen reader user reads and interacts with each story and moves the screen reader reading cursor from story to story, each story scrolls into view and, as needed, new stories are loaded.</p>
b3f77d539 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-23 14:10:41 -0500  2791) 					<p>A <code>feed</code> is a container element whose children have role <rref>article</rref>. When <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> are added or removed from either or both ends of a <code>feed</code>, authors SHOULD set <sref>aria-busy</sref> to <code>true</code> on the <code>feed</code> element before the changes are made and set it to <code>false</code> after the changes are complete. Authors SHOULD avoid inserting or removing <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> in the middle of a <code>feed</code>. These requirements help <a>assistive technologies</a> gracefully respond to changes in the <code>feed</code> content that occur simultaneously with user commands to move the reading cursor within the <code>feed</code>.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2792) 					<p>Authors SHOULD make each <rref>article</rref> in a <code>feed</code> focusable and ensure that the application scrolls an <rref>article</rref> into view when <a>user agent</a> focus is set on the <rref>article</rref> or one of its descendant elements. For example, in HTML, each <rref>article</rref> element should have a <code>tabindex</code> value of either <code>-1</code> or <code>0</code>.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2793) 					<p> When an <a>assistive technology</a> reading cursor moves from one <rref>article</rref> to another, <a>assistive technologies</a> SHOULD set user agent focus on the <rref>article</rref> that contains the reading cursor. If the reading cursor lands on a focusable element inside the <rref>article</rref>, the assistive technology MAY set focus on that element in lieu of setting focus on the containing <rref>article</rref>.</p>
b3f77d539 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-23 14:10:41 -0500  2794) 					<p>Because the ability to scroll to another <rref>article</rref> with an <a>assistive technology</a> reading cursor depends on the presence of another <rref>article</rref> in the page, authors SHOULD attempt to load additional <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> before <a>user agent</a> focus reaches an <rref>article</rref> at either end of the set of <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> that has been loaded. Alternatively, authors MAY include an <rref>article</rref> at either or both ends of the loaded set of <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> that includes an element, such as a <rref>button</rref>, that lets the user request more <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> to be loaded.</p>
4958359c2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-11-01 17:13:29 -0700  2795) 					<p>In addition to providing a brief label, authors MAY apply <pref>aria-describedby</pref> to <rref>article</rref> elements in a <code>feed</code> to suggest to screen readers which elements to speak after the label when users navigate by <rref>article</rref>. Screen readers MAY provide users with a way to quickly scan <code>feed</code> content by speaking both the label and <a>accessible description</a> when navigating by <rref>article</rref>, enabling the user to ignore repetitive or less important elements, such as embedded interaction widgets, that the author has left out of the description.</p>
b3f77d539 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-23 14:10:41 -0500  2796) 					<p> Authors SHOULD provide keyboard commands for moving focus among <rref data-lt="article">articles</rref> in a <code>feed</code> so users who do not utilize an assistive technology that provides <rref>article</rref> navigation features can use the keyboard to navigate the <code>feed</code>.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2797) 					<p>If the number of articles available in a <code>feed</code> supply is static, authors MAY specify <pref>aria-setsize</pref> on <rref>article</rref> elements in that <code>feed</code>. However, if the total number is extremely large, indefinite, or changes often, authors MAY set <pref>aria-setsize</pref> to <code>-1</code> to communicate the unknown size of the set.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  2798) 					<p>See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for additional details on implementing a feed design pattern.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  2799) 				</div>

d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2872) 		<div class="role" id="figure">
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2873) 			<rdef>figure</rdef>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2874) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  2875) 				<p>A perceivable <rref>section</rref> of content that typically contains a <a>graphical document</a>, images, code snippets, or example text. The parts of a <code>figure</code> MAY be user-navigable.</p>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2876) 				<p>Authors SHOULD provide a reference to the <code>figure</code> from the main text, but the <code>figure</code> need not be displayed at the same location as the referencing element. Authors MAY reference text serving as a caption using <pref>aria-describedby</pref>. Authors MAY provide a label using <pref>aria-label</pref> or MAY reference text serving as a label using <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>.</p>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2877) 				<p><a>Assistive technologies</a> SHOULD enable users to quickly navigate to figures. Mainstream <a>user agents</a> MAY enable users to quickly navigate to figures.</p>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2878) 			</div>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2879) 			<table class="role-features">

d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2945) 					</tr>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2946) 					<tr>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2947) 						<th class="role-presentational-inherited-head" scope="row">Inherits Presentational:</th>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2948) 						<td class="role-presentational-inherited"> </td>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2949) 					</tr>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2950) 				</tbody>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2951) 			</table>
d7c87634d aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-15 12:54:29 -0400  2952) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2953) 		<div class="role" id="form">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2954) 			<rdef>form</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2955) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2956) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> region that contains a collection of items and objects that, as a whole, combine to create a form. See related <rref>search</rref>.</p>
765f1c76a index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-11 19:58:00 -0700  2957) 				<p>A form may contain a mix of host language form controls, scripted controls, and hyperlinks. Authors are reminded to use native host language semantics to create form controls whenever possible. If the purpose of a form is to submit search criteria, authors SHOULD use the <rref>search</rref> role instead of the generic <code>form</code> role.</p>
765f1c76a index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-11 19:58:00 -0700  2958) 				<p>Authors MUST give each element with role <code>form</code> a brief label that describes the purpose of the form. Authors SHOULD reference a visible label with <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> if a visible label is present. Authors SHOULD include the label inside of a heading whenever possible. The heading MAY be an instance of the standard host language heading element or an instance of an element with role <rref>heading</rref>.</p> 
765f1c76a index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-11 19:58:00 -0700  2959) 				<p>If an author uses a script to submit a form based on a user action that would otherwise not trigger an <code>onsubmit</code> event (for example, a form submission triggered by the user changing a form element's value), the author SHOULD provide the user with advance notification of the behavior.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  2960) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>form</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  2961) 			</div>

e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3034) 		<div class="role" id="generic">
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3035) 			<rdef>generic</rdef>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3036) 			<div class="role-description">
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3037) 				<p>A nameless container <a>element</a> that has no semantic meaning on its own.</p>
a43383b9c index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-26 18:27:31 -0400  3038) 				<p>The <code>generic</code> role is intended for use as the implicit role of generic elements in host languages (such as <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>div</code> or <code>span</code>), so is primarily for implementors of user agents. Authors SHOULD NOT use this role in content. Authors MAY use <rref>presentation</rref> or <rref>none</rref> to remove implicit accessibility semantics, or a semantic container role such as <rref>group</rref> to semantically group descendants in a named container.</p>
a43383b9c index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-26 18:27:31 -0400  3039) 				<p>Like an element with role <rref>presentation</rref>, an element with role <code>generic</code> can provide a limited number of accessible states and properties for its descendants, such as <pref>aria-live</pref> attributes. However, unlike elements with role <rref>presentation</rref>, <code>generic</code> elements are exposed in <a>accessibility APIs</a> so that assistive technologies can gather certain properties such as layout and bounds.</p>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3040) 			</div>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3041) 			<table class="role-features">

bf6697996 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-03-03 19:49:09 -0500  3096) 								<li><pref>aria-roledescription</pref></li>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3097) 							</ul>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3098) 						</td>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3099) 					</tr>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3100) 					<tr>
e9b64d4b1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2019-10-23 11:02:54 -0400  3101) 						<th class="role-namefrom-head" scope="row">Name From:</th>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3123) 		<div class="role" id="grid">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3124) 			<rdef>grid</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3125) 			<div class="role-description">
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3126) 				<p>A composite <rref>widget</rref> containing a collection of one or more rows with one or more cells where some or all cells in the grid are focusable by using methods of two-dimensional navigation, such as directional arrow keys.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3127) 				<p>The <code>grid</code> role does not imply a specific visual, e.g., tabular, presentation. It describes <a>relationships</a> among <a>elements</a>. It may be used for purposes as simple as grouping a collection of checkboxes or navigation links or as complex as creating a full-featured spreadsheet application.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3128) 				<p>The cell elements of a <code>grid</code> have role <rref>gridcell</rref>. Authors MAY designate a cell as a row or column header by using either the <rref>rowheader</rref> or <rref>columnheader</rref> <a>role</a> in lieu of the <rref>gridcell</rref> role. Authors MUST ensure elements with role <rref>gridcell</rref>, <rref>columnheader</rref>, or <rref>rowheader</rref> are <a>owned</a> by elements with role <rref>row</rref>, which are in turn owned by an element with role <rref>rowgroup</rref>, or <code>grid</code>.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3129) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants of a <code>grid</code> as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>. When a user is navigating the <code>grid</code> content with a keyboard, authors SHOULD set focus as follows:</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3130) 				<ul>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3131) 					<li>If a <rref>gridcell</rref> contains a single interactive <rref>widget</rref> that will not consume arrow key presses when it receives focus, such as a <rref>checkbox</rref>, <rref>button</rref>, or <rref>link</rref>, authors MAY set focus on the interactive element contained in that cell. This allows the contained widget to be directly operable.</li>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3132) 					<li>Otherwise, authors SHOULD ensure the element that receives focus is a <rref>gridcell</rref>, <rref>rowheader</rref>, or <rref>columnheader</rref> element.</li>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3133) 				</ul>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3134) 				<p>Authors SHOULD provide a mechanism for changing to an interaction or edit mode that allows users to navigate and interact with content contained inside a focusable cell if that focusable cell contains any of the following:</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3135) 				<ul>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3136) 					<li>a widget that requires arrow keys to operate, e.g., a <rref>combobox</rref> or <rref>radiogroup</rref></li>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3137) 					<li>multiple interactive elements</li>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3138) 					<li>editable content</li>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3139) 				</ul>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3140) 				<p>For example, if a cell in a spreadsheet contains a <rref>combobox</rref> or editable text, the <kbd>Enter</kbd> key might be used to activate a cell interaction or editing mode when that cell has focus so the directional arrow keys can be used to operate the contained <rref>combobox</rref> or <rref>textbox</rref>. Depending on the implementation, pressing <kbd>Enter</kbd> again, <kbd>Tab</kbd>, <kbd>Escape</kbd>, or another key may switch the application back to the grid navigation mode.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3141) 				<p>Authors MAY use a <rref>gridcell</rref> to display the result of a formula, which could be editable by the user. In a spreadsheet application, for example, a <rref>gridcell</rref> may show a value calculated from a formula until the user activates the <rref>gridcell</rref> for editing when a <rref>textbox</rref> appears in the <rref>gridcell</rref> containing the formula in an editable state.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3142) 				<!-- make sure the following para remains synced with its counterpart in #treegrid -->
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  3143) 				 <p>If <pref>aria-readonly</pref> is set on an element with role <code>grid</code>, <a>user agents</a> MUST propagate the value to all <rref>gridcell</rref> elements <a>owned</a> by the <code>grid</code> and expose the value in the accessibility API. An author MAY override the propagated value of <pref>aria-readonly</pref> for an individual <rref>gridcell</rref> element.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3144) 				 <p>In a <code>grid</code> that provides cell content editing functions, if the content of a focusable <rref>gridcell</rref> element is not editable, authors MAY set <pref>aria-readonly</pref> to <code>true</code> on the <code>gridcell</code> element. However, the value of <pref>aria-readonly</pref>, whether specified for a <code>grid</code> or individual cells, only indicates whether the content contained in cells is editable. It does not represent availability of functions for navigating or manipulating the <code>grid</code> itself.</p>
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200  3145) 				 <p>An unspecified value for <pref>aria-readonly</pref> does not imply that a <code>grid</code> or a <rref>gridcell</rref> contains editable content. For example, if a <code>grid</code> presents a collection of elements that are not editable, such as a collection of <rref>link</rref> elements representing dates in a datepicker, it is not necessary for the author to specify a value for <pref>aria-readonly</pref>.</p>
138e98106 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-03-13 16:41:24 -0400  3146) 				<p>Authors MAY indicate that a focusable <rref>gridcell</rref> is selectable as the object of an action with the <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute. If the <code>grid</code> allows multiple <rref>gridcell</rref>s to be selected, the author SHOULD set <pref>aria-multiselectable</pref> to <code>true</code> on the element with role <code>grid</code>.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3147) 				<p>Since <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> can augment an element of the host language, a <code>grid</code> can reuse the elements and attributes of a native table, such as an HTML <code>table</code> element. For example, if an author applies the <code>grid</code> role to an HTML <code>table</code> element, the author does not need to apply the <rref>row</rref> and <rref>gridcell</rref> roles to the descendant HTML <code>tr</code> and <code>td</code> elements because the <a>user agent</a> will automatically make the appropriate translations. When the author is reusing a native host language table element and needs a <rref>gridcell</rref> element to span multiple rows or columns, the author SHOULD apply the appropriate host language attributes instead of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <pref>aria-rowspan</pref> or <pref>aria-colspan</pref> properties.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  3148) 				<p>See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for additional details on implementing grid design patterns.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3149) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3232) 						<td class="role-presentational-inherited"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3233) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3234) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3235) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3236) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3237) 		<div class="role" id="gridcell">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3238) 			<rdef>gridcell</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3239) 			<div class="role-description">
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3240) 				<p>A <rref>cell</rref> in a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3241) 				<p>A <code>gridcell</code> may be focusable, editable, and selectable. A <code>gridcell</code> may have <a>relationships</a> such as <pref>aria-controls</pref> to address the application of functional relationships.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3242) 				<p>If an author intends a <code>gridcell</code> to have a row header, column header, or both, and if the relevant headers cannot be determined from the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> structure, authors SHOULD explicitly indicate which header cells are relevant to the <code>gridcell</code> by applying <pref>aria-describedby</pref> on the <code>gridcell</code> and referencing <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <rref>rowheader</rref> or <rref>columnheader</rref>.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  3243) 				<p>In a <rref>treegrid</rref>, authors MAY define a <code>gridcell</code> as expandable by using the <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attribute. If the <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attribute is provided, it applies only to the individual cell. It is not a proxy for the container <rref>row</rref>, which also can be expanded. The main use case for providing this attribute on a <code>gridcell</code> is pivot table behavior.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  3244) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> gridcell are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the <a>role</a> <rref>row</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3245) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3246) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3339) 		<div class="role" id="group">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3340) 			<rdef>group</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3341) 			<div class="role-description">
65037cc5e index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-08-24 15:00:34 -0400  3342) 				<p>A set of user interface <a>objects</a> that is not intended to be included in a page summary or table of contents by <a>assistive technologies</a>.</p>
65037cc5e index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-08-24 15:00:34 -0400  3343) 				<p>Contrast with <rref>region</rref>, which is a grouping of user interface objects that will be included in a page summary or table of contents.</p>
65c29f7af index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-11 22:50:20 -0400  3344) 				<p>Authors SHOULD use a <code>group</code> to form a logical collection of items in a <a>widget</a>, such as children in a tree widget forming a collection of siblings in a hierarchy. However, when a <code>group</code> is used in the context of a <rref>listbox</rref>, authors MUST limit its children to <rref>option</rref> elements. Therefore, proper handling of <code>group</code> by authors and assistive technologies is determined by the context in which it is provided.</p>
65037cc5e index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-08-24 15:00:34 -0400  3345) 				<p>Authors MAY nest <code>group</code> elements. If a section is significant enough to warrant inclusion in the web page's table of contents, the author SHOULD assign it a <a>role</a> of <rref>region</rref> or a <a href="#landmark_roles">standard landmark role</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3346) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3425) 			<rdef>heading</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3426) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3427) 				<p>A heading for a section of the page.</p>
c2ac47ca7 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-02-03 14:06:17 -0500  3428) 				<p>To ensure elements with a role of <code>heading</code> are organized into a logical outline, authors MUST use the <pref>aria-level</pref> attribute to indicate the proper nesting level.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3507) 		<div class="role" id="img">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3508) 			<rdef>img</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3509) 			<div class="role-description">
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  3510) 				<p>A container for a collection of <a>elements</a> that form an image.</p>
1c8610ad1 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-07-12 18:54:34 -0400  3511) 				<p>An <code>img</code> can contain captions and descriptive text, as well as multiple image files that when viewed together give the impression of a single image. An <code>img</code> represents a single graphic within a document, whether or not it is formed by a collection of drawing <a>objects</a>. In order for elements with a <a>role</a> of <code>img</code> to be <a>perceivable</a>, authors MUST provide a label using the <pref>aria-label</pref> or <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3512) 			</div>

9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3655) 		<div class="role" id="insertion">
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3656) 			<rdef>insertion</rdef>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3657) 			<div class="role-description">
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3658) 				<p>An insertion contains content that is marked as added or content that is being suggested for addition. See related <rref>deletion</rref>.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3659) 				<p>Insertions are typically used to either mark differences between two versions of content or to designate content suggested for addition in scenarios where multiple people are revising content.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  3660) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3738) 		<div class="role" id="landmark">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3739) 			<rdef>landmark</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3740) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3741) 				<p>A perceivable <rref>section</rref> containing content that is relevant to a specific, author-specified  purpose and sufficiently important that users will likely want to be able to navigate to the section easily and to have it listed in a summary of the page. Such a page summary could be generated dynamically by a user agent or assistive technology.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3742) 				 <p>Authors designate the purpose of the content by assigning a role that is a subclass of the landmark role and, when needed, by providing a brief, descriptive label.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3743) <p>Elements with a role that is a subclass of the landmark role are known as landmark regions or navigational landmark regions.
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  3744) <a>Assistive technologies</a> SHOULD enable users to quickly navigate to landmark regions. Mainstream <a>user agents</a> MAY enable users to quickly navigate to landmark regions.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3745) 				<p class="note"><code>landmark</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3746) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3819) 		<div class="role" id="link">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3820) 			<rdef>link</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3821) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3822) 				<p>An interactive reference to an internal or external resource that, when activated, causes the user agent to navigate to that resource. See related <rref>button</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3823) 				<p>If this is a native link in the host language (such as an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> anchor with an <code>href</code> value), activating the link causes the <a>user agent</a> to navigate to that resource. If this is a simulated link, the web application author is responsible for managing navigation.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3824) 				<p class="note">If pressing the link triggers an action but does not change browser focus or page location, authors are advised to consider using the <rref>button</rref> role instead of the <code>link</code> role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3825) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3826) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  3999) 			<rdef>listbox</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4000) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4001) 				<p>A <a>widget</a> that allows the user to select one or more items from a list of choices. See related <rref>combobox</rref> and <rref>list</rref>.</p>
2a644d6c2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 16:40:33 -0400  4002) 				<p>Items within the list are static and, unlike standard <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>select</code> <a>elements</a>, may contain images. List boxes contain children whose <a>role</a> is <rref>option</rref> or elements whose <a>role</a> is <rref>group</rref> which in turn contains children whose <a>role</a> is <rref>option</rref>.</p>
2a644d6c2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 16:40:33 -0400  4003) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of <rref>option</rref> descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  4004) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>listbox</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>vertical</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4005) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4106) 			<rdef>listitem</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4107) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4108) 				<p>A single item in a list or directory.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  4109) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> whose <a>role</a> is <code>listitem</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an <a>element</a> whose <a>role</a> is <rref>list</rref>.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4194) 		<div class="role" id="log">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4195) 			<rdef>log</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4196) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4197) 				<p>A type of <a>live region</a> where new information is added in meaningful order and old information may disappear. See related <rref>marquee</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4198) 				<p>Examples include chat logs, messaging history, game log, or an error log. In contrast to other live regions, in this <a>role</a> there is a <a>relationship</a> between the arrival of new items in the log and the reading order. The log contains a meaningful sequence and new information is added only to the end of the log, not at arbitrary points.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  4199) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>log</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-live</pref> value of <code>polite</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4200) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4201) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4277) 		<div class="role" id="main">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4278) 			<rdef>main</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4279) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  4280) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> containing the main content of a document.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  4281) 				<p>This marks the content that is directly related to or expands upon the central topic of the document. The <code>main</code> <a>role</a> is a non-obtrusive alternative for "skip to main content" links, where the navigation option to go to the main content (or other <a>landmarks</a>) is provided by the <a>user agent</a> through a dialog or by <a>assistive technologies</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4282) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>main</code> as navigational landmarks.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4283) 				<!-- keep the following paragraphs synced with the similar paragraphs in #banner and #contentinfo -->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4284) 				<p>Within any <rref>document</rref> or <rref>application</rref>, the author SHOULD mark no more than one <a>element</a> with the <code>main</code> role.</p>
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  4285) 				<p class="note">Because <code>document</code> and <code>application</code> elements can be nested in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, they may have multiple <code>main</code> elements as <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> descendants, assuming each of those is associated with different document nodes, either by a DOM nesting (e.g., <rref>document</rref> within <rref>document</rref>) or by use of the <pref>aria-owns</pref> attribute.</p>				
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4286) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4359) 		<div class="role" id="marquee">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4360) 			<rdef>marquee</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4361) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4362) 				<p>A type of <a>live region</a> where non-essential information changes frequently. See related <rref>log</rref>.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  4363) 				<p>Common usages of <code>marquee</code> include stock tickers and ad banners. The primary difference between a <code>marquee</code> and a <rref>log</rref> is that logs usually have a meaningful order or sequence of important content changes.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  4364) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>marquee</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-live</pref> value of <code>off</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4365) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4438) 		<div class="role" id="math">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4439) 			<rdef>math</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4440) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4441) 				<p>Content that represents a mathematical expression.</p>
36d5879d1 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-07-22 10:31:52 -0400  4442) 				<p>Content with the role <code>math</code> is intended to be marked up in an accessible format such as <cite><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/MathML3/">MathML</a></cite> [[MathML3]], or with another type of textual representation such as TeX or LaTeX, which can be converted to an accessible format by native browser implementations or a polyfill library.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4443) 				<p>While it is not ideal to use an image of a mathematical expression, there exists a significant amount of legacy content where images are used to represent mathematical expressions. Authors SHOULD ensure that images of math are labeled by text that describes the mathematical expression as it might be spoken.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4444) 				<div class="note">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4445) 					<p>Browsers that support native implementations of MathML are able to provide a more robust, accessible math experience than can be accomplished with plain text approximations of math. Some rendering engines have close integration with screen readers that allow spacial touch exploration of the formula and refreshable braille display output in the <a>Nemeth Braille</a> format. This level of integration is not supported with images of mathematical formulas, even if the author provides a plain text approximation.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4446) 					<p>At the time of this writing, some mainstream browsers do not support MathML natively, and must be retrofit using a JavaScript polyfill library. When authoring math content, use native MathML wherever possible, and test thoroughly. Use a polyfill library or provide a fallback image with a text alternative approximation if necessary.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4447) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4448) 				<h4><abbr title="Mathematical Markup Language">MathML</abbr> Example with Embedded TeX Annotation</h4>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4449) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4450) 					&lt;!-- Note: Use a JavaScript polyfill library to ensure
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4451) 					     this renders in user agents that do not support MathML. --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4452) 					&lt;!-- The math element has an implicit role="math". --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4453) 					&lt;math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4454) 					  &lt;mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4455) 					    &lt;mi&gt;x&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4456) 					    &lt;mo&gt;=&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4457) 					    &lt;mfrac&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4458) 					      &lt;mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4459) 					        &lt;mo form="prefix"&gt;&#x2212;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4460) 					        &lt;mi&gt;b&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4461) 					        &lt;mo&gt;&#x00B1;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4462) 					        &lt;msqrt&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4463) 					          &lt;msup&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4464) 					            &lt;mi&gt;b&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4465) 					            &lt;mn&gt;2&lt;/mn&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4466) 					          &lt;/msup&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4467) 					          &lt;mo&gt;&#x2212;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4468) 					          &lt;mn&gt;4&lt;/mn&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4469) 					          &lt;mo&gt;&amp;#x2062;&lt;!-- &amp;InvisibleTimes; --&gt;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4470) 					          &lt;mi&gt;a&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4471) 					          &lt;mo&gt;&amp;#x2062;&lt;!-- &amp;InvisibleTimes; --&gt;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4472) 					          &lt;mi&gt;c&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4473) 					        &lt;/msqrt&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4474) 					      &lt;/mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4475) 					      &lt;mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4476) 					        &lt;mn&gt;2&lt;/mn&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4477) 					        &lt;mo&gt;&amp;#x2062;&lt;!-- &amp;InvisibleTimes; --&gt;&lt;/mo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4478) 					        &lt;mi&gt;a&lt;/mi&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4479) 					      &lt;/mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4480) 					    &lt;/mfrac&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4481) 					  &lt;/mrow&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4482) 					  &lt;annotation encoding="TeX"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4483) 					    x=\frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^2-4ac}}{2a}
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4484) 					  &lt;/annotation&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4485) 					&lt;/math&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4486) 				</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4487) 				<h4>Plain HTML or Polyfill DOM Result of the MathML Quadratic Formula</h4>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4488) 				<p>If a rendering engine does not support a native math format such as MathML, authors MAY use JavaScript to downgrade the content to a format the browser can display, such as this HTML image using a data URI and plain text alternative.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4489) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4490) 					&lt;img role="math" src="..." alt="x=&#x27ee;&#x2212;b&#x00B1;&#8730;&#x27ee;b²&#x2212;4ac&#x27ef;&#x27ef;&#247;2a"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4491) 				</pre>
4c7299361 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:53:42 -0400  4492) 				<!--
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4493) 				<p class="ednote">Editor's note: Might need an RFC-2119 "should" requirement here to encourage AT to speak math approximations with high punctuation verbosity. Otherwise ambiguous characters like a forward slash (/) may not be spoken even when intended to be used interchangeably with the division sign character (&#247;).</p>
4c7299361 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:53:42 -0400  4494) 				-->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4495) 			</div>

60c32f3ba index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:06:59 -0400  4568) 		<div class="role" id="meter">
60c32f3ba index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:06:59 -0400  4569) 			<rdef>meter</rdef>
60c32f3ba index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:06:59 -0400  4570) 			<div class="role-description">
34baba430 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 14:07:18 -0400  4571) 				<p>An <a>element</a> that represents a scalar measurement within a known range, or a fractional value. See related <rref>progressbar</rref>.</p>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4572) 				<p>Authors MAY set <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> to indicate the minimum and maximum values for the <code>meter</code>. Otherwise, their implicit values follow the same rules as <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]:</p>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4573) 				<ul>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4574) 					<li>If <code>aria-valuemin</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 0 (zero).</li>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4575) 					<li>If <code>aria-valuemax</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 100.</li>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4576) 				</ul>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4577) 				<p>The value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> MUST NOT fall below or exceed the computed values of <code>aria-valuemin</code> and <code>aria-valuemax</code>, respectively.</p>
60c32f3ba index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:06:59 -0400  4578) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT use the <code>meter</code> role to indicate progress; the <rref>progressbar</rref> role exists to address that need.</p>
1bde3e14d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-04-03 19:54:46 -0400  4579) 				<p class="note">Presently, there are no <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> properties corresponding to the <code>low</code>, <code>optimum</code>, and <code>high</code> attributes supported on the <code>&lt;meter&gt;</code> element in [[HTML]]. The addition of these properties will be considered for ARIA version 1.3.</p>
60c32f3ba index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:06:59 -0400  4580) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4660) 		<div class="role" id="menu">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4661) 			<rdef>menu</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4662) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4663) 				<p>A type of <a>widget</a> that offers a list of choices to the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4664) 				<p>A menu is often a list of common actions or functions that the user can invoke. The <code>menu</code> <a>role</a> is appropriate when a list of menu items is presented in a manner similar to a menu on a desktop application.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4665) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  4666) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>menu</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>vertical</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4667) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4668) 			<table class="role-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4669) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4670) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4671) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4758) 		<div class="role" id="menubar">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4759) 			<rdef>menubar</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4760) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4761) 				<p>A presentation of <rref>menu</rref> that usually remains visible and is usually presented horizontally.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4762) 				<p>The <code>menubar</code> <a>role</a> is used to create a menu bar similar to those found in Windows, Mac, and Gnome desktop applications. A menu bar is used to create a consistent set of frequently used commands. Authors SHOULD ensure that <code>menubar</code> interaction is similar to the typical menu bar interaction in a desktop graphical user interface.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4763) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  4764) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>menubar</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>horizontal</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4765) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4766) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4852) 		<div class="role" id="menuitem">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4853) 			<rdef>menuitem</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4854) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4855) 				<p>An option in a set of choices contained by a <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4856) 				<p>Authors MAY disable a menu item with the <sref>aria-disabled</sref> attribute. If the menu item has its <pref>aria-haspopup</pref> attribute set to <code>true</code>, it indicates that the menu item may be used to launch a sub-level menu, and authors SHOULD display a new sub-level menu when the menu item is activated.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  4857) 				<p>In order to identify that they are related <a>widgets</a>, authors MUST ensure that menu items are <a>owned</a> by an element with role <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref>. Authors MAY separate menu items into sets by use of a <rref>separator</rref> or an element with an equivalent role from the native markup language.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4858) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4959) 		<div class="role" id="menuitemcheckbox">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4960) 			<rdef>menuitemcheckbox</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4961) 			<div class="role-description">
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200  4962) 				<p>A <rref>menuitem</rref> with a checkable state whose possible <span>values</span> are <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, or <code>mixed</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4963) 				<p>The <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> of a <code>menuitemcheckbox</code> indicates whether the menu item is checked (<code>true</code>), unchecked (<code>false</code>), or represents a sub-level menu of other menu items that have a mixture of checked and unchecked values (<code>mixed</code>).</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  4964) 				<p>In order to identify that they are related <a>widgets</a>, authors MUST ensure that menu item checkboxes are <a>owned</a> by an element with role <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref>. Authors MAY separate menu items into sets by use of a <rref>separator</rref> or an element with an equivalent role from the native markup language.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  4965) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5057) 		<div class="role" id="menuitemradio">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5058) 			<rdef>menuitemradio</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5059) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5060) 				<p>A checkable <rref>menuitem</rref> in a set of elements with the same role, only one of which can be checked at a time.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5061) 				<p>Authors SHOULD enforce that only one <code>menuitemradio</code> in a group can be checked at the same time. When one item in the group is checked, the previously checked item becomes unchecked (its <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> becomes <code>false</code>).</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5062) 				<!-- keep previous sentence synced with radiogroup, etc. -->
b84f59130 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-06-18 13:22:59 -0400  5063) 				<p>In order to identify that they are related <a>widgets</a>, authors MUST ensure that menu item radios are <a>owned</a> by an element with role <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref>, or by a role <rref>group</rref> which itself is <a>owned</a> by an element with role <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref>.</p>
7bf84d9da index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:01:25 -0400  5064)         <p>If a <rref>menu</rref> or <rref>menubar</rref> contains more than one group of <code>menuitemradio</code> elements, or if the menu contains one group and other, unrelated menu items, authors SHOULD contain each set of related <code>menuitemradio</code> elements in an element using the <rref>group</rref> role. Authors MAY also delimit the group from other menu items with an element using the <rref>separator</rref> role, or an element with an equivalent role from the native markup language.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5065) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5149) 		<div class="role" id="navigation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5150) 			<rdef>navigation</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5151) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  5152) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> containing a collection of navigational <a>elements</a> (usually links) for navigating the document or related documents.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  5153) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>navigation</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5228) 			<rdef>none</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5229) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  5230) 				<p>An <a>element</a> whose implicit native role semantics will not be mapped to the <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a>. See synonym <rref>presentation</rref>.</p>
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5231) 				<div class="note" id="role-none-note-none">
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5232) 					<h5>Note regarding the ARIA 1.1 <code>none</code> role.</h5>
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5233) 					<p>In ARIA 1.1, the working group introduced <code>none</code> as a synonym to the <rref>presentation</rref> role, due to author confusion surrounding the intended meaning of the word "presentation" or "presentational." Many individuals erroneously consider <code>role="presentation"</code> to be synonymous with <code>aria-hidden="true"</code>, and we believe <code>role="none"</code> conveys the actual meaning more unambiguously.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5234) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5235) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5236) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5237) 		<div class="role" id="note">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5238) 			<rdef>note</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5239) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5240) 				<p>A section whose content is parenthetic or ancillary to the main content of the resource.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5241) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5315) 			<rdef>option</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5316) 			<div class="role-description">
f18363a7c index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-22 12:42:28 -0400  5317) 				<p>A selectable item in a <rref>listbox</rref>.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  5318) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>option</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the <a>role</a>  <rref>listbox</rref> or <rref>group</rref> within a <code>listbox</code>. Options not associated with a <rref>listbox</rref> might not be correctly mapped to an <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  5319) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>option</code> have an implicit <sref>aria-selected</sref> value of <code>false</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5320) 			</div>

189daec54 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 13:25:13 -0400  5419) <!-- FIXME: This is commented out because the ARIA Working Group agreed to move the password role to ARIA 2.0,
189daec54 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 13:25:13 -0400  5420)      but we've not branched for 1.1 yet. Once we have branched, this entire section should be deleted from
189daec54 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 13:25:13 -0400  5421)      the 1.1 branch and uncommented for the master branch (pending discussion and consensus).
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5422) 		<div class="role" id="password">
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5423) 			<rdef>password</rdef>
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5424) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  5425) 				<p>An <rref>input</rref> for entering a password.</p>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5426) 				<div class="ednote">
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5427) 					<p>The Working Group is still considering implications of the <code>password</code> role:</p>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5428) 					<ul>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5429) 						<li>It might create security or privacy risks that custom password fields without the role would not;</li>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5430) 						<li>The use of such fields might not be widespread enough to justify the risks;</li>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5431) 						<li>Mitigating risks might require specific assisitve technology support that is not normally specified in ARIA.</li>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5432) 					</ul>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5433) 					<p>The role has been included in this Working Draft to solicit wide review on these questions. The ARIA Working Group particularly seeks input from <strong>security</strong> and <strong>privacy</strong> experts, <strong>assistive technology</strong> developers, and <strong>authors</strong> who potentially would use the role.</p>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5434) 					<p>If input suggests excessive risks or insufficient need, the role may be removed from the next publication of this specification.</p>
2fd0479b9 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-06-21 16:54:36 -0400  5435) 				</div>
3847a8e4a aria/aria.html (Michiel Bijl        2016-06-10 14:13:13 +0200  5436) 				<p class="warning">The <code>password</code> <a>role</a> does not convey or apply any of the security or privacy considerations found in native password fields. Authors are responsible for making sure that custom password fields have robust security and privacy protection, as befits their use.</p>
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5437) 				<p>The <code>password</code> <a>role</a> makes it possible for <a>assistive technologies</a> to customize their behavior in order to not inadvertently expose private information. For instance, a screen reader which normally echoes key presses might instead remain silent or echo each displayed character as it is inserted. In order to facilitate the latter behavior, authors SHOULD set the <code>password</code> element's text to characters which obscure the real value, when that value is obscured on screen. Authors SHOULD also update that text each time a character is inserted or deleted by the user.</p>
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5438) 				<p>In order to ensure that passwords will not be overheard during input, assistive technologies SHOULD NOT echo key presses of printable characters when an element with role <code>password</code> has focus, unless the user has explicitly enabled this option. If the user has enabled key echo, assistive technologies SHOULD present each rendered character as it is inserted rather than speaking a predetermined character, such as &quot;star.&quot; Presenting the rendered characters ensures that all users receive the same information, including notification when the value is being entered into an unobscured <code>password</code> field.</p>
ebfa47827 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-23 13:57:09 -0400  5439) 				<p>Authors SHOULD limit the use of the <code>password</code> role to single-line <a>elements</a> which are editable. Authors MAY use the <code>password</code> role on elements which are not currently editable due to application-specific conditions. However, in that instance, authors MUST indicate that the element is read only by setting <pref>aria-readonly</pref> to <code>true</code> or using the appropriate native host language attribute. User agents MUST ignore the <code>password</code> role when it is applied to elements which are neither editable nor explicitly marked as read only. Host languages SHOULD document that the <code>password</code> role can only be used on elements that are editable and not permanently read only.</p>
e682a8d02 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-02 14:26:22 -0400  5440) 			</div>
