478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5598) 		<div class="role" id="presentation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5599) 			<rdef>presentation</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5600) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  5601) 				<p>An <a>element</a> whose implicit native role semantics will not be mapped to the <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a>. See synonym <rref>none</rref>.</p>
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5602) 				<div class="note" id="role-presentation-note-none">
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5603) 					<h5>Note regarding the ARIA 1.1 <rref>none</rref> role.</h5>
1195ff7a7 aria/aria.html (michael-n-cooper    2017-10-27 15:35:42 -0400  5604) 					<p>In ARIA 1.1, the working group introduced <rref>none</rref> as a synonym to the <code>presentation</code> role, due to author confusion surrounding the intended meaning of the word "presentation" or "presentational." Many individuals erroneously consider <code>role="presentation"</code> to be synonymous with <code>aria-hidden="true"</code>, and we believe <code>role="none"</code> conveys the actual meaning more unambiguously.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  5605) 					<p>Until implementations include sufficient support for <code>role="none"</code>, web authors are advised to use the <code>presentation</code> role alone <code>role="presentation"</code> or redundantly as a fallback to the <rref>none</rref> role <code>role="none presentation"</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5606) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5607) 				<p>The intended use is when an element is used to change the look of the page but does not have all the functional, interactive, or structural relevance implied by the element type, or may be used to provide for an accessible fallback in older browsers that do not support <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5608) 				<p>Example use cases:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5609) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5610) 					<li>An element whose content is completely presentational (like a spacer image, decorative graphic, or clearing element);</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5611) 					<li>An image that is in a container with the <rref>img</rref> <a>role</a> and where the full text alternative is available and is marked up with <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> and (if needed) <pref>aria-describedby</pref>;</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5612) 					<li>An element used as an additional markup "hook" for <abbr title="Cascading Style Sheets">CSS</abbr>; or</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5613) 					<li>A layout table and/or any of its associated rows, cells, etc.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5614) 				</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5615) 				<p>For any element with a role of presentation and which is not focusable, the user agent MUST NOT expose the implicit native semantics of the element (the role and its states and properties) to accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">APIs</abbr>. However, the user agent MUST expose content and descendant elements that do not have an explicit or inherited role of presentation. Thus, the <code>presentation</code> role causes a given element to be treated as having no role or to be removed from the accessibility tree, but does not cause the content contained within the element to be removed from the accessibility tree.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5616) 				<p>For example, according to an accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interface">API</abbr>, the following markup elements would appear to have identical role semantics (no role) and identical content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5617) 				<pre class="example highlight"><span class="comment">&lt;!-- 1. [role="presentation"] negates the implicit 'heading' role semantics but does not affect the contents. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5618) &lt;h1 role="presentation"&gt; Sample Content &lt;/h1&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5619) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5620) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 2. There is no implicit role for span, so only the contents are exposed. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5621) &lt;span&gt; Sample Content &lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5622) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5623) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 3. Depending on styling and other factors, this role declaration is redundant in some implementations. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5624) &lt;span role="presentation"&gt; Sample Content &lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5625) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5626) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 4. In all cases, the element contents are exposed to accessibility APIs without any implied role semantics. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5627) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- &lt;&gt; --&gt;</span> Sample Content <span class="comment">&lt;!-- &lt;/&gt; --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5628) </pre>
1dd9e99db index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-10-24 12:17:01 -0400  5629) 				<p>The <code>presentation</code> role is used on an element that has implicit native semantics, meaning that there is a default accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interface">API</abbr> role for the element. Some elements are only complete when additional descendant elements are provided. For example, in <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>, table elements (matching the <rref>table</rref> role) require <code>tr</code> descendants (the <rref>row</rref> <a>role</a>), which in turn require <code>th</code> or <code>td</code> children (the <rref>cell</rref>, <rref>columnheader</rref>, <rref>rowheader</rref> roles). Similarly, lists require list item children. The descendant elements that complete the semantics of an element are described in <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> as <a href="#mustContain">required owned elements</a>.</p>
f96c158b0 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 10:28:14 -0500  5630) 				<p>When an explicit or inherited role of <code>presentation</code> is applied to an element with the implicit semantic of a <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> role that has <a href="#mustContain">required owned elements</a>, in addition to the element with the explicit role of <code>presentation</code>, the user agent MUST apply an inherited role of presentation to any owned elements that do not have an explicit role defined. Also, when an explicit or inherited role of presentation is applied to a host language element which has required children as defined by the host language specification, in addition to the element with the explicit role of presentation, the user agent MUST apply an inherited role of presentation to any required children that do not have an explicit role defined.</p>
99a2e0844 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2019-11-08 10:58:03 -0500  5631) 				<p>In <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>, the <code>&lt;img&gt;</code> <a>element</a> is treated as a single entity regardless of the type of image file. Consequently, using <code>role="presentation"</code> or <code>role="none"</code> on an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>img</code> is equivalent to using <code>aria-hidden="true"</code>. In order to make the image contents accessible, authors can embed the object using an <code>&lt;object&gt;</code> or <code>&lt;iframe&gt;</code> <a>element</a>, or use inline <abbr title="Scalable Vector Graphics">SVG</abbr> code, and follow the accessibility guidelines for the image content.</p>
1dd9e99db index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2018-10-24 12:17:01 -0400  5632) 				<p>For any element with an explicit or inherited role of presentation and which is not focusable, user agents MUST ignore role-specific <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> states and properties for that element. For example, in <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>, a <code>ul</code> or <code>ol</code> element with a role of <code>presentation</code> will have the implicit native semantics of its <code>li</code> elements removed because the <rref>list</rref> role to which the <code>ul</code> or <code>ol</code> corresponds has a <a href="#mustContain">required owned element</a> of <rref>listitem</rref>. Likewise, the implicit native semantics of an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>table</code> element's <code>thead</code>/<code>tbody</code>/<code>tfoot</code>/<code>tr</code>/<code>th</code>/<code>td</code> descendants will also be removed, because the <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> specification indicates that these are required structural descendants of the <code>table</code> element.</p>
0f5894a06 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-05-07 20:02:59 -0400  5633) 				<p class="note">Only the implicit native semantics of elements that correspond to <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <a href="#mustContain">required owned elements</a> are removed. All other content remains intact, including nested tables or lists, unless those elements also have an explicit role of <code>presentation</code> applied.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5634) 				<p>For example, according to an accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interface">API</abbr>, the following markup elements would appear to have identical role semantics (no roles) and identical content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5635) 				<pre class="example highlight"><span class="comment">&lt;!-- 1. [role="presentation"] negates the implicit 'list' and 'listitem' role semantics but does not affect the contents. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5636) &lt;ul role="presentation"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5637)   &lt;li&gt; Sample Content &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5638)   &lt;li&gt; More Sample Content &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5639) &lt;/ul&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5640) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5641) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 2. There is no implicit role for "foo", so only the contents are exposed. --&gt;</span>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5642) &lt;foo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5643)   &lt;foo&gt; Sample Content &lt;/foo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5644)   &lt;foo&gt; More Sample Content &lt;/foo&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5645) &lt;/foo&gt;</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5646) 				<p class="note">There are other <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> roles with required children for which this situation is applicable (e.g., radiogroups and listboxes), but tables and lists are the most common real-world cases in which the presentation inheritance is likely to apply.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5647) 				<p>For any element with an explicit or inherited role of <code>presentation</code>, user agents MUST apply an inherited role of <code>presentation</code> to all host-language-specific labeling elements for the presentational element. For example, a <code>table</code> element with a role of <code>presentation</code> will have the implicit native semantics of its <code>caption</code> element removed, because the caption is merely a label for the presentational table.</p>
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5648) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT provide meaningful alternative text (for example, use <code>alt=""</code> in <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>) when the <code>presentation</code> role is applied to an image.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5649) 				<p>In the following code sample, the containing <rref>img</rref> and is appropriately labeled by the caption paragraph. In this example the <code>img</code> element can be marked as presentation because the role and the text alternatives are provided by the containing element.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5650) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;div role="img" aria-labelledby="caption"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5651)   &lt;img src="example.png" role="presentation" alt=""&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5652)   &lt;p id="caption"&gt;A visible text caption labeling the image.&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5653) &lt;/div&gt;</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5654) 				<p>In the following code sample, because the anchor (<abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>a</code> element) is acting as the treeitem, the list item (<abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>li</code> element) is assigned an explicit <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> role of presentation to override the user agent's implicit native semantics for list items.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5655) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5656) &lt;ul role="tree"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5657)   &lt;li role="presentation"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5658) 	&lt;a role="treeitem" aria-expanded="true"&gt;An expanded tree node&lt;/a&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5659)   &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5660)   …
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5661) &lt;/ul&gt;</pre>
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5662) 				<section id="conflict_resolution_presentation_none">
f829b21a1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-08-10 04:24:19 -0400  5663) 					<h5>Presentational Roles Conflict Resolution</h5>
915c1d6f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-09-14 07:58:44 -0400  5664) 					<p>There are a number of ways presentational role conflicts are resolved.</p>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5665) 					<p>User agents MUST NOT expose <a>elements</a> having explicit or inherited presentational role in the accessibility tree, with these exceptions:</p>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5666) 					<ul>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5667) 						<li>If an element is focusable, or otherwise interactive, user agents MUST ignore the <code>presentation</code> role and expose the element with its implicit role, in order to ensure that the element is <a>operable</a>.</li>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5668) 						<li>If a <a href="#mustContain">required owned element</a> has an explicit non-presentational role, user agents MUST ignore an inherited presentational role and expose the element with its explicit role. If the action of exposing the explicit role causes the accessibility tree to be malformed, the expected results are undefined.</li>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5669) 						<li>If an element has global WAI-ARIA states or properties, user agents MUST ignore the <code>presentation</code> role and expose the element with its implicit role. However, if an element has only non-global, role-specific WAI-ARIA states or properties, the element MUST NOT be exposed unless the presentational role is inherited and an explicit non-presentational role is applied.</li>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5670) 					</ul>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5671) 					<p>For example, <pref>aria-describedby</pref> is a global attribute and would always be applied; <pref>aria-level</pref> is not a global attribute and would therefore only apply if the element was not in a presentational state.</p>
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5672) 					<pre class="example highlight">
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5673) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 1. [role="presentation"] is ignored due to the global aria-describedby property. --&gt;</span>
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5674) &lt;h1 role="presentation" aria-describedby="comment-1"&gt; Sample Content &lt;/h1&gt;
cfffbc199 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-03 18:33:20 -0500  5675) <span class="comment">&lt;!-- 2. [role="presentation"] negates both the implicit 'heading' and the non-global aria-level. --&gt;</span>
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5676) &lt;h1 role="presentation" aria-level="2"&gt; Sample Content &lt;/h1&gt;
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5677) 					</pre>
c2808fe47 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-06-16 17:38:49 -0400  5678) 				</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5679) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5761) 		<div class="role" id="progressbar">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5762) 			<rdef>progressbar</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5763) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5764) 				<p>An <a>element</a> that displays the progress status for tasks that take a long time.</p>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5765) 				<p>A progressbar indicates that the user's request has been received and the application is making progress toward completing the requested action.</p>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5766) 				<p>Authors MAY set <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> to indicate the minimum and maximum progress indicator values. Otherwise, their implicit values follow the same rules as <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]:</p>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5767) 					<ul>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5768) 						<li>If <code>aria-valuemin</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 0 (zero).</li>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5769) 						<li>If <code>aria-valuemax</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 100.</li>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5770) 					</ul>
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5771) 				<p>The author SHOULD supply a <span>value</span> for <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> unless the value is indeterminate, in which case the author SHOULD omit the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute. 
363cbbc54 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:47:48 -0700  5772) 				Authors SHOULD update this value when the visual progress indicator is updated. If the <code>progressbar</code> is describing the loading progress of a particular region of a page, the author SHOULD use <pref>aria-describedby</pref> to point to the status, and set the <sref>aria-busy</sref> attribute to <code>true</code> on the region until it is finished loading. It is not possible for the user to alter the value of a <code>progressbar</code> because it is always read-only.</p>
b5d35d0a0 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-09-30 10:38:57 -0600  5773) 				<p class="note">Assistive technologies generally will render the value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> as a percent of a range between the value of <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref>, unless <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> is specified.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5774) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5859) 		<div class="role" id="radio">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5860) 			<rdef>radio</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5861) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5862) 				<p>A checkable input in a group of elements with the same role, only one of which can be checked at a time.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  5863) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure that <a>elements</a> with role <code>radio</code> are explicitly grouped in order to indicate which ones affect the same value. This is achieved by enclosing the radio elements in an element with role <rref>radiogroup</rref>. If it is not possible to make the radio buttons <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> children of the <rref>radiogroup</rref>, authors SHOULD use the <pref>aria-owns</pref> <a>attribute</a> on the <rref>radiogroup</rref> element to indicate the <a>relationship</a> to its children.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5864) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5865) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5955) 		<div class="role" id="radiogroup">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5956) 			<rdef>radiogroup</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5957) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5958) 				<p>A group of <rref>radio</rref> buttons.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  5959) 				<p>A <code>radiogroup</code> is a type of <rref>select</rref> list that can only have a single entry checked at any one time. Authors SHOULD enforce that only one radio button in a group can be checked at the same time. When one item in the group is checked, the previously checked item becomes unchecked (its <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> becomes <code>false</code>).</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5960) 				<!-- keep previous sentence synced with menuitemradio, etc. -->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  5961) 			</div>

6a3aa33e0 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-02-05 14:46:58 -0500  6044) 				<p>An element representing a range of values.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6045) 				<p class="note"><code>range</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6118) 		<div class="role" id="region">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6119) 			<rdef>region</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6120) 			<div class="role-description">
59d325f3d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 18:51:33 -0700  6121) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> containing content that is relevant to a specific, author-specified  purpose and sufficiently important that users will likely want to be able to navigate to the section easily and to have it listed in a summary of the page. Such a page summary could be generated dynamically by a user agent or assistive technology.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6122) 				<p>Authors SHOULD limit use of the region role to sections containing content with a purpose that is not accurately described by one of the other <rref>landmark</rref> roles, such as <rref>main</rref>, <rref>complementary</rref>, or <rref>navigation</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6123) 				<p>Authors MUST give each element with role region a brief label that describes the purpose of the content in the region. Authors SHOULD reference a visible label with <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> if a visible label is present. Authors SHOULD include the label inside of a heading whenever possible. The heading MAY be an instance of the standard host language heading element or an instance of an element with role <rref>heading</rref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  6124) 				<p><a>Assistive technologies</a> SHOULD enable users to quickly navigate to elements with role region. Mainstream <a>user agents</a> MAY enable users to quickly navigate to elements with role region.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6125) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6198) 		<div class="role" id="roletype">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6199) 			<rdef>roletype</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6200) 			<div class="role-description">
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700  6201) 				<p>The base <a>role</a> from which all other roles inherit.</p>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700  6202) 				<p>Properties of this role describe the structural and functional purpose of <a>objects</a> that are assigned this role. A role is a concept that can be used to understand and operate instances.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6203) 				<p class="note"><code>roletype</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6204) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6273) 		<div class="role" id="row">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6274) 			<rdef>row</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6275) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6276) 				<p>A row of cells in a tabular container.</p>
804f82010 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:37:57 +0200  6277) 				<p>Rows contain <rref>cell</rref> or <rref>gridcell</rref> <a>elements</a>, and thus serve to organize a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
533bf77db index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-11-01 16:28:08 -0700  6278) 				<p>While the row role can be used in a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>, the semantics of <sref>aria-expanded</sref>, <pref>aria-posinset</pref>, <pref>aria-setsize</pref>, and <pref>aria-level</pref> are only applicable to the hierarchical structure of an interactive tree grid. Therefore, authors MUST NOT apply <sref>aria-expanded</sref>, <pref>aria-posinset</pref>, <pref>aria-setsize</pref>, and <pref>aria-level</pref> to a <rref>row</rref> that descends from a <rref>table</rref> or <rref>grid</rref>, and user agents SHOULD NOT expose any of these four properties to assistive technologies unless the <rref>row</rref> descends from a <rref>treegrid</rref>.
533bf77db index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-11-01 16:28:08 -0700  6279) 				</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  6280) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>row</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, <rref>rowgroup</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
991d90ce6 index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 15:09:49 -0700  6281) 				<p class="note" title="Usage of aria-disabled">While <sref>aria-disabled</sref> is currently supported on <rref>row</rref>, in a future version the working group plans to prohibit its  on elements with role <rref>row</rref> except when the element is in the context of a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6282) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6283) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6389) 		<div class="role" id="rowgroup">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6390) 			<rdef>rowgroup</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6391) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6392) 				<p>A structure containing one or more row elements in a tabular container.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  6393) 				<p>The <code>rowgroup</code> role establishes a <a>relationship</a> between <a>owned</a> <rref>row</rref> elements. It is a structural equivalent to the <code>thead</code>, <code>tfoot</code>, and <code>tbody</code> elements in an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>table</code> <a>element</a>.</p>
340d2e9b9 index.html     (Dan Bjorge          2019-03-26 14:03:32 -0400  6394) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>rowgroup</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>grid</rref>, <rref>table</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6395) 				<p class="note">The <code>rowgroup</code> role exists, in part, to support role symmetry in HTML, and allows for the propagation of presentation inheritance on HTML <code>table</code> elements with an explicit <code>presentation</code> role applied.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6396) 				<p class="note">This role does not differentiate between types of row groups (e.g., <code>thead</code> vs. <code>tbody</code>), but an issue has been raised for <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> 2.0.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6397) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6476) 		<div class="role" id="rowheader">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6477) 			<rdef>rowheader</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6478) 			<div class="role-description">
ac7581bfc index.html     (Matt King           2018-08-21 11:32:02 -0700  6479) 				<p>A cell containing header information for a row.</p>
ac7581bfc index.html     (Matt King           2018-08-21 11:32:02 -0700  6480) 				<p>The <rref>rowheader</rref> role can be used to identify a cell as a header for a row in a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. The rowheader establishes a <a>relationship</a> between it and all cells in the corresponding row. It is a structural equivalent to setting <code>scope="row"</code> on an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>th</code> <a>element</a>.</p>
ac7581bfc index.html     (Matt King           2018-08-21 11:32:02 -0700  6481) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>rowheader</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>row</rref>.</p>
ac7581bfc index.html     (Matt King           2018-08-21 11:32:02 -0700  6482) 				<p>Applying the <sref>aria-selected</sref> state on a rowheader MUST NOT cause the user agent to automatically propagate the <sref>aria-selected</sref> state to all the cells in the corresponding row. An author MAY choose to propagate selection in this manner depending on the specific application.</p>
991d90ce6 index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 15:09:49 -0700  6483) 				<p>While the <code>rowheader</code> role can be used in both interactive grids and non-interactive tables, the use of <sref>aria-expanded</sref>, <pref>aria-readonly</pref>, and <pref>aria-required</pref> is only applicable to interactive elements. Therefore, authors SHOULD NOT use <sref>aria-expanded</sref>, <pref>aria-readonly</pref>, or <pref>aria-required</pref> in a <code>rowheader</code> that descends from a <rref>table</rref>, and user agents SHOULD NOT expose these properties to <a>assistive technologies</a> unless the <code>rowheader</code> descends from a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
991d90ce6 index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 15:09:49 -0700  6484) 				<p class="note" title="Usage of aria-disabled">While <sref>aria-disabled</sref> is currently supported on <rref>rowheader</rref>, in a future version the working group plans to prohibit its use on elements with role <rref>rowheader</rref> except when the element is in the context of a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6485) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6486) 			<table class="role-features">

910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6574) 		<div class="role" id="scrollbar">
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6575) 			<rdef>scrollbar</rdef>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6576) 			<div class="role-description">
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6577) 				<p>A graphical object that controls the scrolling of content within a viewing area, regardless of whether the content is fully displayed within the viewing area.</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6578) 				<p>A scrollbar represents the current value and range of possible values via the size of the scrollbar and position of the thumb with respect to the visible range of the orientation (horizontal or vertical) it controls. Its orientation represents the orientation of the scrollbar and the scrolling effect on the viewing area controlled by the scrollbar. It is typically possible to add or subtract to the current value by using directional keys such as arrow keys.</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6579) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <pref>aria-controls</pref> attribute on the scrollbar element to reference the scrollable area it controls.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  6580) 				<p>Authors MAY set <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> to indicate the minimum and maximum thumb position. Otherwise, their implicit values follow the same rules as <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]:</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6581) 				<ul>
bbe6473d3 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-06-04 14:18:08 -0400  6582) 				    <li>If <code>aria-valuemin</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 0 (zero).</li>
bbe6473d3 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-06-04 14:18:08 -0400  6583) 				    <li>If <code>aria-valuemax</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 100.</li>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6584) 				</ul>
5569456cc index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-11 17:45:39 -0400  6585) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute to indicate the current thumb position. If aria-valuenow is missing or has an unexpected value, browsers MAY implement the repair techniques specified in the <a href="#authorErrorDefaultValuesTable">section describing handling author errors in states and properties</a>, which are equivalent to the repair techniques for <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]].</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6586) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>scrollbar</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>vertical</code>.</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6587) 				<p class="note">Assistive technologies generally will render the value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> as a percent of a range between the value of <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref>, unless <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> is specified. It is best to set the values for <pref>aria-valuemin</pref>, <pref>aria-valuemax</pref>, and <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> in a manner that is appropriate for this calculation.</p>
910f91f41 aria/aria.html (Carolyn MacLeod     2016-04-25 12:47:25 -0400  6588) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6686) 		<div class="role" id="search">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6687) 			<rdef>search</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6688) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6689) 				<p>A <rref>landmark</rref> region that contains a collection of items and objects that, as a whole, combine to create a search facility. See related <rref>form</rref> and <rref>searchbox</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6690) 				<p>A search region may be a mix of host language form controls, scripted controls, and hyperlinks.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  6691) 				<p>User agents SHOULD treat elements with the role of <code>search</code> as navigational <a>landmarks</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6692) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6693) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6695) 				<thead>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6836) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6837) 				<p>A renderable structural containment unit in a document or application.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6838) 				<p class="note"><code>section</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6904) 		<div class="role" id="sectionhead">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6905) 			<rdef>sectionhead</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6906) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6907) 				<p>A structure that labels or summarizes the topic of its related section.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  6908) 				<p class="note"><code>sectionhead</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7054) 		<div class="role" id="separator">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7055) 			<rdef>separator</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7056) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7057) 				<p>A divider that separates and distinguishes sections of content or groups of menuitems.</p>
c2556a392 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-06-24 14:09:42 -0400  7058) 				<p>There are two types of separators: a static <rref>structure</rref> that provides only a visible boundary and a focusable, interactive <rref>widget</rref> that is also moveable. If a <code>separator</code> is not focusable, it is revealed to <a>assistive technologies</a> as a static structural element. For example, a static <code>separator</code> can be used to help visually divide two groups of menu items in a menu or to provide a horizontal rule between two sections of a page.</p>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7059) 				<p>Authors MAY make a <code>separator</code> focusable to create a <rref>widget</rref> that both provides a visible boundary between two sections of content and enables the user to change the relative size of the sections by changing the position of the <code>separator</code>. A variable <code>separator</code> widget can be moved continuously within a range, whereas a fixed <code>separator</code> widget supports only two discrete positions. Typically, a fixed <code>separator</code> widget is used to toggle one of the sections between expanded and collapsed states.</p>
b41c0917e aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-07-20 18:46:35 -0400  7060) 				<p>If the <code>separator</code> is focusable, authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> to a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a> reflecting the current position of the <code>separator</code> and update that value when it changes. Authors SHOULD also provide the value of <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> if it is not <code>0</code> and the value of <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> if it is not <code>100</code>. If missing or not a number, the implicit values of these attributes are as follows:</p>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7061) 				<ul>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7062) 				    <li>The implicit value of <code>aria-valuemin</code> is <code>0</code>.</li>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7063) 				    <li>The implicit value of <code>aria-valuemax</code> is <code>100</code>.</li>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7064) 				</ul>
8ef8dfb94 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-07-07 14:04:35 -0400  7065) 				<p>In applications where there is more than one focusable <code>separator</code>, authors SHOULD provide an accessible name for each one.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  7066) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>separator</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>horizontal</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7067) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7161) 		<div class="role" id="slider">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7162) 			<rdef>slider</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7163) 			<div class="role-description">
57a4429a4 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-06-04 14:10:25 -0400  7164) 				<p>An input where the user selects a value from within a given range.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7165) 				<p>A slider represents the current value and range of possible values via the size of the slider and position of the thumb. It is typically possible to add or subtract to the value by using directional keys such as arrow keys.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  7166) 				<p>Authors MAY set the <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> attributes.	Otherwise, their implicit values follow the same rules as <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7167) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7168) 				    <li>If <code>aria-valuemin</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 0 (zero). </li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7169) 				    <li>If <code>aria-valuemax</code> is missing or not a <a href="#valuetype_number">number</a>, it defaults to 100. </li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7170) 				</ul>
5569456cc index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-03-11 17:45:39 -0400  7171) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute. If aria-valuenow is missing or has an unexpected value, browsers MAY implement the repair techniques specified in the <a href="#authorErrorDefaultValuesTable">section describing handling author errors in states and properties</a>, which are equivalent to the repair techniques for <code>&lt;input[type="range"]&gt;</code> in [[HTML]].</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  7172) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>slider</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>horizontal</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7173) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7261) 						<th class="implicit-values-head" scope="row">Implicit Value for Role:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7262) 						<td class="implicit-values">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7263) 							Default for <pref>aria-orientation</pref> is <code class="default">horizontal</code>. <br/>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7264) 							Default for <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> is <code class="default">0</code>. <br/>
57a4429a4 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-06-04 14:10:25 -0400  7265) 							Default for <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> is <code class="default">100</code>.
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7266) 						</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7267) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7270) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7271) 		<div class="role" id="spinbutton">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7272) 			<rdef>spinbutton</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7273) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7274) 				<p>A form of <rref>range</rref> that expects the user to select from among discrete choices.</p>
d6a99dec3 index.html     (Matt King           2018-10-05 15:47:02 -0700  7275) 				<p>A <code>spinbutton</code> typically allows users to change its displayed value by activating increment and decrement buttons that step through a set of allowed values. Some implementations display the value in an text field that allows editing and typing but typically limits input in ways that help prevent invalid values.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7276) 				<p>Although a <code>spinbutton</code> is similar in appearance to many presentations of <code>select</code>, it is advisable to use <code>spinbutton</code> when working with known ranges (especially in the case of large ranges) as opposed to distinct options. For example, a <code>spinbutton</code> representing a range from 1 to 1,000,000 would provide much better performance than a <code>select</code> <a>widget</a> representing the same values.</p>
d6a99dec3 index.html     (Matt King           2018-10-05 15:47:02 -0700  7277) 				<p>Authors MAY create a <code>spinbutton</code> with children or owned elements, but MUST limit those elements to a <rref>textbox</rref> and/or two <rref title="button">buttons</rref>. Alternatively, authors MAY apply the <rref>spinbutton</rref> role to a text input and create sibling buttons to support the increment and decrement functions.</p>
d6a99dec3 index.html     (Matt King           2018-10-05 15:47:02 -0700  7278) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>. When a <code>spinbutton</code> receives focus, authors SHOULD ensure focus is placed on the <rref>textbox</rref> element if one is present, and on the <code>spinbutton</code> itself otherwise. Authors SHOULD also ensure the <kbd>up</kbd> and <kbd>down</kbd> arrows on a keyboard perform the increment and decrement functions and that the increment and decrement <rref>button</rref> elements are <em>NOT</em> included in the primary navigation ring, e.g., the Tab ring in <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr>.</p>
d6a99dec3 index.html     (Matt King           2018-10-05 15:47:02 -0700  7279) 				<p>Authors SHOULD set the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute when the <rref>spinbutton</rref> has a value. Authors SHOULD set the <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> attribute when there is a minimum value, and the <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> attribute when there is a maximum value.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7280) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7281) 			<table class="role-features">

d36e35cf1 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-15 14:14:02 -0400  7339) 								<li><pref>aria-valuetext</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7340) 							</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7341) 						</td>

9fce35e90 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-03-10 12:59:05 -0500  7370) 							Default for <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> is that there is no minimum value.<br/>
9fce35e90 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-03-10 12:59:05 -0500  7371) 							Default for <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> is that there is no maximum value.<br/>
149e86f2f index.html     (James Nurthen       2023-02-17 09:52:57 -0800  7372) 							Default for <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> is <code class="default">0</code><br/>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7373) 						</td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7378) 		<div class="role" id="status">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7379) 			<rdef>status</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7380) 			<div class="role-description">
4d9fd9828 aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-05-20 11:19:55 -0500  7381) 				<p>A type of <a>live region</a> whose content is advisory information for the user but is not important enough to justify an <rref>alert</rref>, often but not necessarily presented as a status bar.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7382) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure an element with role <code>status</code> does not receive focus as a result of change in status.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7383) 				<p>Status is a form of <a>live region</a>. If another part of the page controls what appears in the status, authors SHOULD make the <a>relationship</a> explicit with the <pref>aria-controls</pref> <a>attribute</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7384) 				<p><a>Assistive technologies</a> MAY reserve some cells of a Braille display to render the status.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  7385) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>status</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-live</pref> value of <code>polite</code> and an implicit <pref>aria-atomic</pref> value of <code>true</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7386) 			</div>

fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7466) 		<div class="role" id="strong">
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7467) 			<rdef>strong</rdef>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7468) 			<div class="role-description">
0f5894a06 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-05-07 20:02:59 -0400  7469) 				<p>Content that is important, serious, or urgent. See related <rref>emphasis</rref>.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7470) 				<p>The purpose of the <code>strong</code> role is to communicate strong importance, seriousness, or urgency. It is not for communicating changes in typographical presentation that are not important to the meaning of the content. Authors SHOULD use the <code>strong</code> role only if its absence would change the meaning of the content.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7471) 				<p>The <code>strong</code> role is not intended to convey stress or emphasis; for that purpose, the <rref>emphasis</rref> role is more appropriate.</p>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7472) 			</div>
fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7473) 			<table class="role-features">

fbc29d292 index.html     (joanmarie           2019-10-24 14:42:48 -0400  7496) 						<td class="role-base"> </td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7554) 		<div class="role" id="structure">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7555) 			<rdef>structure</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7556) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7557) 				<p>A document structural <a>element</a>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  7558) 				<p><a>Roles</a> for document structure support the accessibility of dynamic web content by helping <a>assistive technologies</a> determine active content versus static document content. Structural roles by themselves do not all map to <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">APIs</abbr></a>, but are used to create <a>widget</a> roles or assist content adaptation for assistive technologies.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7559) 				<p class="note"><code>structure</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7560) 			</div>

a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7629) 		<div class="role" id="subscript">
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7630) 			<rdef>subscript</rdef>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7631) 			<div class="role-description">
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7632) 				<p>One or more subscripted characters. See related <rref>superscript</rref>.</p>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7633) 				<p>The <code>subscript</code> role is intended to be used only to mark up typographical conventions that have specific meanings; not for typographical presentation for presentation's sake. In general, authors SHOULD use this role only if the absence of the subscript would change the meaning of the content.</p>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7634) 			</div>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7635) 			<table class="role-features">

a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7716) 		<div class="role" id="superscript">
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7717) 			<rdef>superscript</rdef>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7718) 			<div class="role-description">
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7719) 				<p>One or more superscripted characters.  See related <rref>superscript</rref>.</p>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7720) 				<p>The <code>superscript</code> role is intended to be used only to mark up typographical conventions that have specific meanings; not for typographical presentation for presentation's sake. In general, authors SHOULD use this role only if the absence of the superscript would change the meaning of the content.</p>
a3288756a index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2019-10-24 14:16:34 -0400  7721) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7803) 		<div class="role" id="switch">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7804) 			<rdef>switch</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7805) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  7806) 				<p>A type of checkbox that represents on/off values, as opposed to checked/unchecked values. See related <rref>checkbox</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7807) 				<p>The <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> of a <code>switch</code> indicates whether the input is on (<code>true</code>) or off (<code>false</code>). The <code>mixed</code> value is invalid, and user agents MUST treat a <code>mixed</code> value as equivalent to <code>false</code> for this role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7808) 				<p class="note">A <code>switch</code> provides approximately the same functionality as a <code>checkbox</code> and toggle <code>button</code>, but makes it possible for assistive technologies to present the widget in a fashion consistent with its on-screen appearance.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7809) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7810) 			<table class="role-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7811) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7890) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7891) 		<div class="role" id="tab">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7892) 			<rdef>tab</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7893) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7894) 				<p>A grouping label providing a mechanism for selecting the tab content that is to be rendered to the user.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  7895) 				<p>If a  <rref>tabpanel</rref> or item in a <rref>tabpanel</rref> has focus, the associated <code>tab</code> is the currently active tab in the <rref>tablist</rref>, as defined in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>. <rref>tablist</rref> elements, which contain a set of associated <rref>tab</rref> elements, are typically placed near a series of <rref>tabpanel</rref> elements, usually preceding it. See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for details on implementing a tab set design pattern.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  7896) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <rref>tab</rref> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>tablist</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7897) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure the <rref>tabpanel</rref> associated with the currently active tab is <a>perceivable</a> to the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7898) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7899) 				<!-- keep following para synced with its counterpart in #tablist -->
533bf77db index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-11-01 16:28:08 -0700  7900) 				<p>For a single-selectable <rref>tablist</rref>, authors SHOULD hide other <code>tabpanel</code> <a>elements</a> from the user until the user selects the tab associated with that tabpanel. For a multi-selectable <rref>tablist</rref>, authors SHOULD ensure that the <rref>tab</rref> for each visible <rref>tabpanel</rref> has the <sref>aria-expanded</sref> <a>attribute</a> set to <code>true</code>, and that the <code>tabs</code> associated with the remaining hidden <code>tabpanel</code> elements have their <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attributes set to <code>false</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7901) 
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  7902) 				<p>In either case, authors SHOULD ensure that a selected tab has its <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute set to <code>true</code>, that inactive tab elements have their <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute set to <code>false</code>, and that the currently selected tab provides a visual indication that it is selected. In the absence of an <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute on the current tab, <a>user agents</a> SHOULD indicate to <a>assistive technologies</a> through the platform <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a> that the currently focused tab is selected.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7903) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  7999) 		<div class="role" id="table">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8000) 			<rdef>table</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8001) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  8002) 				<p>A <rref>section</rref> containing data arranged in rows and columns. See related <rref>grid</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8003) 				<p>The <code>table</code> role is intended for tabular containers which are not interactive. If the tabular container maintains a selection state, provides its own two-dimensional navigation, or allows the user to rearrange or otherwise manipulate its contents or the display thereof, authors SHOULD use <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref> instead.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  8004) 				<p>Authors SHOULD prefer the use of the host language's semantics for table whenever possible, such as the <code>&lt;table&gt;</code> element in [[HTML]].</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8005) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8089) 			<rdef>tablist</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8090) 			<div class="role-description">
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  8091) 				<p>A list of <rref>tab</rref> <a>elements</a>, which are references to <rref>tabpanel</rref> elements.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8092) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8093) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8094) 				<!-- keep following para synced with its counterpart in #tab -->
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8095) 				<p>For a single-selectable <code>tablist</code>, authors SHOULD hide other <code>tabpanel</code> <a>elements</a> from the user until the user selects the tab associated with that tabpanel. For a multi-selectable <rref>tablist</rref>, authors SHOULD ensure each visible <rref>tabpanel</rref> has its <sref>aria-expanded</sref> <a>attribute</a> set to <code>true</code>, and that the remaining hidden <code>tabpanel</code> elements have their <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attributes set to <code>false</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8096) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8097) 				<!-- keep following para synced with its counterpart in #tabpanel -->
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  8098) 				<p><rref>tablist</rref> elements are typically placed near usually preceding, a series of <rref>tabpanel</rref> elements. See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for details on implementing a tab set design pattern.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8099) 
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  8100) 				<p>Elements with the role <rref>tablist</rref> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>horizontal</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8101) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8187) 		<div class="role" id="tabpanel">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8188) 			<rdef>tabpanel</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8189) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8190) 				<p>A container for the resources associated with a <rref>tab</rref>, where each <rref>tab</rref> is contained in a <rref>tablist</rref>.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8191) 				<p>Authors SHOULD associate a <code>tabpanel</code> <a>element</a> with its <rref>tab</rref>, either by using the <pref>aria-controls</pref> attribute on the tab to reference the tab panel, or by using the  <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute on the tab panel to reference the tab.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8192) 				<!-- keep following para synced with its counterpart in #tablist -->
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  8193) 				<p><rref>tablist</rref> elements are typically placed near, usually preceding, a series of <rref>tabpanel</rref> elements. See the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite> for details on implementing a tab set design pattern.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8194) 			</div>

8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8267) 		<div class="role" id="term">
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8268) 			<rdef>term</rdef>
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8269) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  8270) 				<p>A word or phrase with a corresponding definition. See related <rref>definition</rref>.</p>
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8271) 				<p>The <code>term</code> role is used to explicitly identify a word or phrase for which a <rref>definition</rref> has been provided by the author or is expected to be provided by the user.</p>
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8272) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT use the <code>term</code> role on interactive elements such as links because doing so could prevent users of <a>assistive technologies</a> from interacting with those elements.</p>
8a7f8b67a aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 12:53:24 -0400  8273) 			</div>

79f37fb96 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-27 14:18:41 -0400  8346) <!-- FIXME: This is commented out because the ARIA Working Group agreed to move the text role to ARIA 2.0,
79f37fb96 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-27 14:18:41 -0400  8347)      but we've not branched for 1.1 yet. Once we have branched, this entire section should be deleted from
79f37fb96 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-27 14:18:41 -0400  8348)      the 1.1 branch and uncommented for the master branch.
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8349) 		<div class="role" id="text">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8350) 			<rdef>text</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8351) 			<div class="role-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  8352) 				<p>An element whose entire subtree should be exposed to accessibility APIs as plain text.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8353) 				<p>The <code>text</code> role allows authors to mark an element and all of its subtree contents as plain text.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8354) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT use the <code>text</code> role on interactive controls (buttons, links, etc.) or ancestors of those controls, because it could prevent users of assistive technologies from accessing the controls. Authors wishing to retain the semantics of subtree contents could consider the ARIA 1.0 <rref>presentation</rref> or ARIA 1.1 <rref>none</rref> role instead.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8355) 				<div class="note">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8356) 					<p>As with any ARIA 1.1 role, authors may provide a fallback ARIA 1.0 role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8357) 					<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8358) 						&lt;p&gt;I &lt;span role="text img" aria-label="love"&gt;♥︎&lt;/span&gt; New York.&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8359) 						&lt;p&gt;My &lt;span role="text img" aria-label="heart"&gt;♥︎&lt;/span&gt; bleeds.&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8360) 						&lt;p&gt;&lt;span role="text img" aria-label="3 of 5 stars"&gt;★★★☆☆︎&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8361) 					</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8362) 					<p>In a screen reader using an ARIA 1.1-capable browsers, the user would hear "I love New York." In an ARIA 1.0-capable browser, the user might hear "I, love image, New York."</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8363) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8364) 				<div class="note">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8365) 					<p>It is not necessary to use the fallback role if the implicit role for the element provides sufficient fallback. In this example, an ARIA 1.0-capable browser would not recognize the "text" role token, and fall back to the default image role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8366) 					<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8367) 						&lt;p&gt;I &lt;img src="icon.gif" alt="love" role="text"&gt; New York.︎&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8368) 						&lt;p&gt;My &lt;img src="icon.gif" alt="heart" role="text"&gt; bleeds.︎&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8369) 					</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8370) 				</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8371) 				<div class="note">
1b1146efe aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 13:47:00 -0400  8372) 					<p>The text role can also be used to flatten structural semantics without providing an explicit label. The following example would be presented to assistive technologies as one static text element ("I like turtles") rather than three separate paragraphs.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8373) 					<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8374) 						&lt;div role="text"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8375) 						  &lt;p&gt;I&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8376) 						  &lt;p&gt;like&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8377) 						  &lt;p&gt;turtles&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8378) 						&lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8379) 					</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8380) 					<p>Use caution when using the text role on structural elements. In particular, avoid using the text role on elements with interactive descendants.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8381) 					<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8382) 						&lt;p role="text"&gt;
ca2ea0d2c aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-10-20 09:18:34 -0400  8383) 						  &lt;!&dash;&dash; Example of incorrect usage. &dash;&dash;&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8384) 						  This &lt;a href="#"&gt;link&lt;/a&gt; becomes presentational, so
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8385) 						  it is no longer a link. The paragraph is just plain text.
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8386) 						  This is probably not what the author intended.
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8387) 						&lt;/p&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8388) 					</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8389) 				</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8469) 		<div class="role" id="textbox">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8470) 			<rdef>textbox</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8471) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8472) 				<p>A type of input that allows free-form text as its value.</p>
1dda04647 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-08 13:21:10 -0400  8473) 				<p>If the <pref>aria-multiline</pref> <a>attribute</a> is <code>true</code>, the <a>widget</a> accepts line breaks within the input, as in an <abbr title="Hypertext Markup Language">HTML</abbr> <code>textarea</code>. Otherwise, this is a simple text box. The intended use is for languages that do not have a text input <a>element</a>, or cases in which an element with different <a>semantics</a> is repurposed as a text field.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8474) 				<!-- keep the following para synced with its equivalent in #aria-multiline -->
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8475) 				<p class="note">In most user agent implementations, the default behavior of the <kbd>ENTER</kbd> or <kbd>RETURN</kbd> key is different between the single-line and multi-line text fields in HTML. When user has focus in a single-line <code>&lt;input type="text"&gt;</code> element, the keystroke usually submits the form. When user has focus in a multi-line <code>&lt;textarea&gt;</code> element, the keystroke inserts a line break. The <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <code>textbox</code> role differentiates these types of boxes with the <pref>aria-multiline</pref> attribute, so authors are advised to be aware of this distinction when designing the field.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8476) 			</div>
