d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8558) 				<div class="role" id="time">
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8559) 			<rdef>time</rdef>
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8560) 			<div class="role-description">
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8561) 				<p>An element that represents a specific point in time.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  8562) 				<p class="note">At the present time, there are no <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> properties corresponding to the <code>datetime</code> attribute supported on <code>&lt;time&gt;</code> in [[HTML]]. The addition of this property will be considered for ARIA version 1.3.</p>
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8563) 				<p>Authors SHOULD limit text contents to a valid date- or time-related string, or apply this future <code>datetime</code>-equivalent property to the element which has role <code>time</code>.</p>
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8564) 				<p>Examples of valid date- or time-related strings as text contents of an element with the <code>time</code> role:</p>
d8172e7e0 index.html     (Melanie Richards    2019-10-24 14:23:48 -0400  8565) 				<ul>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8669) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8670) 		<div class="role" id="timer">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8671) 			<rdef>timer</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8672) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8673) 				<p>A type of <a>live region</a> containing a numerical counter which indicates an amount of elapsed time from a start point, or the time remaining until an end point.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8674) 				<p>The text contents of the timer <a>object</a> indicate the current time measurement, and are updated as that amount changes. The timer value is not necessarily machine parsable, but authors SHOULD update the text contents at fixed intervals, except when the timer is paused or reaches an end-point.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  8675) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>timer</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-live</pref> value of <code>off</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8676) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8749) 		<div class="role" id="toolbar">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8750) 			<rdef>toolbar</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8751) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8752) 				<p>A collection of commonly used function buttons or controls represented in compact visual form.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8753) 				<p>The toolbar is often a subset of functions found in a <rref>menubar</rref>, designed to reduce user effort in using these functions. Authors MUST supply a label on each toolbar when the application contains more than one toolbar.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8754) 				<p>Authors MAY manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  8755) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>toolbar</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>horizontal</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8756) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8835) 		<div class="role" id="tooltip">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8836) 			<rdef>tooltip</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8837) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8838) 				<p>A contextual popup that displays a description for an element.</p>
b2fd431ba index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-09 20:46:15 -0700  8839) 				<p>The <code>tooltip</code> typically becomes visible, after a short delay, in response to a mouse hover, or after the owning element receives keyboard focus. The use of a <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> tooltip is a supplement to the normal tooltip behavior of the user agent.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8840) 				<p class="note">Typical tooltip delays last from one to five seconds.</p>
23088c143 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-11-13 11:02:18 -0500  8841) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure that elements with the <a>role</a> <code>tooltip</code> are referenced through the use of <pref>aria-describedby</pref> before or at the time the tooltip is displayed.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8842) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8920) 		<div class="role" id="tree">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8921) 			<rdef>tree</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8922) 			<div class="role-description">
8ad5769f7 index.html     (James Nurthen       2018-06-07 11:20:48 -0700  8923) 				<p>A <rref>widget</rref> that allows the user to select one or more items from a hierarchically organized collection.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8924) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
8827de2e9 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 14:16:32 -0500  8925) 				<p>Elements with the role <code>tree</code> have an implicit <pref>aria-orientation</pref> value of <code>vertical</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  8926) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9015) 		<div class="role" id="treegrid">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9016) 			<rdef>treegrid</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9017) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9018) 				<p>A <rref>grid</rref> whose rows can be expanded and collapsed in the same manner as for a <rref>tree</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9019) 				<!-- make sure the following para remains synced with its counterpart in #grid -->
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  9020) 				<p>If <pref>aria-readonly</pref> is set on an <a>element</a> with <a>role</a> <code>treegrid</code>, <a>user agents</a> MUST propagate the value to all <rref>gridcell</rref> elements owned by the <code>treegrid</code> and expose the value in the accessibility API. An author MAY override the propagated value of <pref>aria-readonly</pref> for an individual <rref>gridcell</rref> element.</p>
e427cbeac aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-01-21 16:14:32 -0500  9021) 				<p>When the <pref>aria-readonly</pref> attribute is applied to a focusable <rref>gridcell</rref>, it indicates whether the content contained in the <rref>gridcell</rref> is editable. The <pref>aria-readonly</pref> attribute does not represent availability of functions for navigating or manipulating the <code>treegrid</code> itself.</p>
138e98106 aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-03-13 16:41:24 -0400  9022) 				<p>In a <code>treegrid</code> that provides content editing functions, if the content of a focusable <rref>gridcell</rref> element is not editable, authors MAY set <pref>aria-readonly</pref> to <code>true</code> on the <rref>gridcell</rref> element. However, if a <code>treegrid</code> presents a collection of elements that do not support <pref>aria-readonly</pref>, such as a collection of <rref>link</rref> elements, it is not necessary for the author to specify a value for <pref>aria-readonly</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9023) 				<p>To be <a>keyboard accessible</a>, authors SHOULD manage focus of descendants for all instances of this <a>role</a>, as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9024) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9107) 		<div class="role" id="treeitem">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9108) 			<rdef>treeitem</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9109) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9110) 				<p>An option item of a <rref>tree</rref>. This is an <a>element</a> within a tree that may be expanded or collapsed if it contains a sub-level group of tree item elements.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9111) 				<p>A collection of <code>treeitem</code> elements to be expanded and collapsed are enclosed in an element with the <rref>group</rref> <a>role</a>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9112) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure <a>elements</a> with <a>role</a> <code>treeitem</code> are contained in, or <a>owned</a> by, an element with the role <rref>group</rref> or <rref>tree</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9113) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9206) 		<div class="role" id="widget">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9207) 			<rdef>widget</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9208) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9209) 				<p>An interactive component of a graphical user interface (<abbr title="Graphical User Interface">GUI</abbr>).</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9210) 				<p>Widgets are discrete user interface objects with which the user can interact. Widget <a>roles</a> map to standard features in <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">APIs</abbr></a>. When the user navigates an element assigned any of the non-abstract subclass roles of <code>widget</code>, <a>assistive technologies</a> that typically intercept standard keyboard events SHOULD switch to an application browsing mode, and pass keyboard events through to the web application. The intent is to hint to certain <a>assistive technologies</a> to switch from normal browsing mode into a mode more appropriate for interacting with a web application; some <a>user agents</a> have a browse navigation mode where keys, such as up and down arrows, are used to browse the document, and this native behavior prevents the use of these keys by a web application.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9211) 				<p class="note"><code>widget</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9212) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9213) 			<table class="role-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9281) 		<div class="role" id="window">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9282) 			<rdef>window</rdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9283) 			<div class="role-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9284) 				<p>A browser or application window.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9285) 				<p><a>Elements</a> with this <a>role</a> have a window-like behavior in a graphical user interface (<abbr title="Graphical User Interface">GUI</abbr>) context, regardless of whether they are implemented as a native window in the operating system, or merely as a section of the document styled to look like a window.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9286) 				<p class="note">In the description of this role, the term "application" does not refer to the <rref>application</rref> role, which specifies specific assistive technology behaviors.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9287) 				<p class="note"><code>window</code> is an abstract role used for the ontology. Authors should not use this role in content.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9288) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9355) <section class="normative" id="states_and_properties">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9356) 	<h1>Supported States and Properties</h1>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9357) 	<section id="statevsprop">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9358) 		<h2>Clarification of States versus Properties</h2>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9359) 		<p>The terms "states" and "properties" refer to similar features. Both provide specific information about an <a>object</a>, and both form part of the definition of the nature of <a>roles</a>. In this document, states and properties are both treated as aria-prefixed markup <a>attributes</a>. However, they are maintained conceptually distinct to clarify subtle differences in their meaning. One major difference is that the <span>values</span> of properties (such as <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>) are often less likely to change throughout the application life-cycle than the values of states (such as <sref>aria-checked</sref>) which may change frequently due to user interaction. Note that the frequency of change difference is not a rule; a few properties, such as <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> are expected to change often. Because the distinction between states and properties is of little consequence to most web content authors, this specification refers to both "states" and "properties" simply as "attributes" whenever possible. See the definitions of <a class="termref" href="#dfn-state">state</a> and <a class="termref" href="#dfn-property">property</a> for more information.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9360) 	</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9361) 	<section id="state_prop_att">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9362) 		<h2>Characteristics of States and Properties</h2>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9363) 		<p>States and properties have the characteristics described in the following sections.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9364) 		<section id="propcharacteristic_relatedconcept">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9365) 			<h3>Related Concepts</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9366) 			<p>Advisory information about features from this or other languages that correspond to this <a>state</a> or <a>property</a>. While the correspondence may not be exact, it is useful to help understand the intent of the state or property.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9367) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9368) 		<section id="propcharacteristic_usedinrole">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9369) 			<h3>Used in Roles</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9370) 			<p>Advisory information about <a href="#role_definitions">roles</a> that use this <a>state</a> or <a>property</a>. This information is provided to help understand the appropriate usage of the state or property. Use of a given state or property is not defined when used on roles other than those listed.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9371) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9372) 		<section id="propcharacteristic_inheritsintoroles">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9373) 			<h3>Inherits into Roles</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9374) 			<p>Advisory information about <a href="#role_definitions">roles</a> that inherit the <a>state</a> or <a>property</a> from an ancestor role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9375) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9376) 		<section id="propcharacteristic_value">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9377) 			<h3>Value</h3>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9378) 			<p>Value type of the <a>state</a> or <a>property</a>. The value may be one of the following types:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9379) 			<dl>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9380) 				<dt id="valuetype_true-false">true/false</dt>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9381) 				<dd>Value representing either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code>. The default value for this value type is <code>false</code> unless otherwise specified.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9382) 				<dt id="valuetype_tristate">tristate</dt>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9383) 				<dd>Value representing <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, <code>mixed</code>, or <code>undefined</code> values. The default value for this value type is <code>undefined</code> unless otherwise specified.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9384) 				<dt id="valuetype_true-false-undefined">true/false/undefined</dt>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9385) 				<dd>Value representing <code>true</code>, <code>false</code>, or <code>undefined</code> (not applicable). The default value for this value type is <code>undefined</code> unless otherwise specified. For example, an element with <sref>aria-expanded</sref> set to <code>false</code> is not currently expanded; an element with <sref>aria-expanded</sref> set to <code>undefined</code> is not expandable.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9386) 				<dt id="valuetype_idref">ID reference</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9387) 				<dd>Reference to the ID of another <a>element</a> in the same document</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9388) 				<dt id="valuetype_idref_list">ID reference list</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9389) 				<dd>A list of one or more ID references.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9390) 				<dt id="valuetype_integer">integer</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9391) 				<dd>A numerical value without a fractional component.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9392) 				<dt id="valuetype_number">number</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9393) 				<dd>Any real numerical value.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9394) 				<dt id="valuetype_string">string</dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9395) 				<dd>Unconstrained value type.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9396) 				<dt id="valuetype_token">token</dt>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9397) 				<dd>One of a limited set of allowed values. The default value is defined in each attribute's Values table, as specified in the <a href="#enumerated-attribute-values">Attribute Values</a> section.</dd>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9398) 				<dt id="valuetype_token_list"><dfn>token list</dfn></dt>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9399) 				<dd>A list of one or more tokens.</dd>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9400) 			</dl>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9401) 			<p>These are generic types for states and properties, but do not define specific representation. See <a href="#state_property_processing">State and Property Attribute Processing</a> for details on how these values are expressed and handled in host languages.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9402) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9403) 	</section>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9404) 	<section>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9405) 		<h2>ARIA Attributes</h2>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9406) 		<section id="enumerated-attribute-values">
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9407) 			<h3>Multi-value Attribute Values</h3>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9408) 			<p>When the ARIA attribute definition includes a table listing the attribute's allowed <span>values</span>, 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9409) 			that attribute is a multi-value nullable attribute. 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9410) 			Each value in the table is a keyword for the attribute, mapping to a state of the same name. </p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9411) 		</section>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9412) 		<section id="idl-reflection-attribute-values">
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9413) 			<h3>IDL reflection of ARIA attributes</h3>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9414) 			<p>All ARIA attributes reflect in IDL as [=nullable type|nullable=] {{DOMString}} attributes. 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9415) 			This includes the boolean-like <a href="#valuetype_true-false">true/false</a> type, and all other ARIA attributes.</p>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9416) 			<p>Default values from the ARIA values tables MUST NOT reflect to IDL as the 
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9417) 			<a data-cite="html/common-microsyntaxes.html#missing-value-default">missing value default</a> or the 
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9418) 			<a data-cite="html/common-microsyntaxes.html#invalid-value-default">invalid value default</a> for the attribute. 
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9419) 			On getting, a missing ARIA attribute will return <code>null</code>. ARIA attributes are not validated on get. 
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9420) 			If an ARIA value is invalid, on getting, it will return its set value as a literal string, and will not return an invalid value default.</p>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9421) 		</section>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9422) 		<section id="os-aapi-attribute-mapping">
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9423) 			<h3>Operating System Accessibility API mapping of multi-value ARIA attributes</h3>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9424) 			<p>Unlike IDL reflection, operating system accessibility API mappings of ARIA attributes can have defaults. 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9425) 			Any default values from the ARIA values tables are exposed to the operating system accessibility API as described in 
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9426) 			[[[#supportedState]]], and in [[[CORE-AAM]]].</p>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9427) 		</section>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9428) 		<section id="enumerated-attribute-values-html">
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9429) 			<h3>ARIA nullable DOMString Attributes</h3>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9430) 			<p>As noted in [[[#typemapping]]], attributes are included in host languages, and the syntax for representation of WAI-ARIA types is governed by the host language.</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9431) 			<p>The following algorithm should be used for ARIA nullable {{DOMString}} attributes in HTML:</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9432) 			<p>On getting, if the corresponding content attribute is not present, then the IDL attribute must return null, 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9433) 			otherwise, the IDL attribute must get the value in a transparent, case-preserving manner. 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9434) 			On setting, if the new value is null, the content attribute must be removed, and otherwise, 
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9435) 			the content attribute must be set to the specified new value in a transparent, case-preserving manner.</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9436) 			<p class="note">
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9437) 			Note: As of ARIA 1.2, all ARIA attributes exposed via IDL are defined as nullable {{DOMStrings}}. This matches the current implementation of all major rendering engines. This specification change should result in no implementation changes; it will merely represent the current reality of web engines.
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9438) 			However, in a future draft, the ARIA Working Group intends to change several ARIA attributes to non-nullable DOMStrings, and seek implementations. The proposed change will bring ARIA into alignment with the HTML’s usage of <a data-cite="html/common-microsyntaxes.html#enumerated-attribute">enumerated attributes</a>.</p>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9439) 			<section class="informative" id="enumeration-example">
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9440) 				<h4>Example Attribute Usage</h4>
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9441) 				<aside class="example">
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9442) 
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9443) <!-- ReSpec needs these examples to be unindented. -->
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9444) <pre>// HTML hidden="" example (not aria-hidden="true")
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9445) // Actual boolean type; defaults to false.
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9446) 
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9447) // Note: Actual boolean assignment and return value.
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9448) el.hidden = true;
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9449) el.hidden; // true
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9450) 
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9451) // Removal of content attribute results in missing value default: boolean false.
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9452) el.removeAttribute("hidden");
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9453) el.hidden; // false</pre>
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9454) 
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9455) 			</aside>

7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9457) 
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9458) <!-- ReSpec needs these examples to be unindented. -->
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9459) <pre>// aria-busy example
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9460) // true/false ~ boolean-like nullable string; returns null unless set
cd04b6a1a index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-09-17 15:02:37 -0700  9461)

6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9474) el.ariaBusy; // "busy"</pre>
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9475)

7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9480) <pre>// aria-pressed example
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800  9481) // Tristate ~ true/false/mixed/undefined string; null if unspecified

7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9485)

7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9490) button.ariaPressed; // "false"
7f111c9a8 index.html     (James Craig         2020-06-12 14:41:49 -0700  9491)

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9503) 	</section>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9504) 	<section>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9505) 		<h2>Translatable States and Properties</h2>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700  9506) 		<p>The HTML specification states that other specifications can define <a href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dom.html#translatable-attributes">translatable attributes</a>. In order to be understandable by assistive technology users, the values of the following <a>states</a> and <a>properties</a> are <a href="https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dom.html#translatable-attributes">translatable attributes</a> and should be translated when a page is localized:</p>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9507) 		<ul>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9508) 			<li><pref>aria-label</pref></li>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9509) 			<li><pref>aria-placeholder</pref></li>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9510) 			<li><pref>aria-roledescription</pref></li>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9511) 			<li><pref>aria-valuetext</pref></li>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9512) 		</ul>
a45ea7a5c index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-03-27 15:39:59 -0700  9513) 	</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9514) 	<section id="global_states">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9515) 		<h2>Global States and Properties</h2>
78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700  9516) 		<p>Some <a>states</a> and <a>properties</a> are applicable to all host language <a>elements</a> regardless of whether a <a>role</a> is applied. The following global states and properties are supported by all roles and by all base markup elements unless otherwise prohibited. If a role prohibits use of any global states or properties, those states or properties are listed as prohibited in the characteristics table included in the section that defines the role.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9517) 		<p class="placeholder">Placeholder for global states and properties</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9518) 	</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9519) 	<section id="state_prop_taxonomy">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9520) 		<h2>Taxonomy of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> States and Properties</h2>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9521) 		<p>States and properties are categorized as follows:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9522) 		<ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9523) 			<li><a href="#attrs_widgets">Widget Attributes</a></li>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9528) 		<section id="attrs_widgets">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9529) 			<h3>Widget Attributes</h3>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9530) 			<p>This section contains <a>attributes</a> specific to common user interface <a>elements</a> found on <abbr title="Graphical User Interface">GUI</abbr> systems or in rich internet applications which receive user input and process user actions. These attributes are used to support the <a href="#widget_roles">widget roles</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9531) 			<ul>

b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9557) 			<p>Widget attributes might be mapped by a <a>user agent</a> to platform <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a> <a>state</a>, for access by <a>assistive technologies</a>, or they might be accessed directly from the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>. User agents MUST provide a way for assistive technologies to be notified when states change, either through <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> attribute change <a>events</a> or platform accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr> events.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9558) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9559) 		<section id="attrs_liveregions">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9560) 			<h3>Live Region Attributes</h3>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9561) 			<p>This section contains <a>attributes</a> specific to <a>live regions</a> in rich internet applications. These attributes may be applied to any <a>element</a>. The purpose of these attributes is to indicate that content changes may occur without the element having focus, and to provide <a>assistive technologies</a> with information on how to process those content updates. Some <a>roles</a> specify a default value for the <pref>aria-live</pref> attribute specific to that role. An example of a live region is a ticker section that lists updating stock quotes.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9562) 			<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9563) 				<li><pref>aria-atomic</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9564) 				<li><sref>aria-busy</sref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9565) 				<li><pref>aria-live</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9566) 				<li><pref>aria-relevant</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9567) 			</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9568) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9569) 		<section id="attrs_dragdrop">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9570) 			<h3>Drag-and-Drop Attributes</h3>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9571) 			<p>This section lists <a>attributes</a> which indicate information about drag-and-drop interface <a>elements</a>, such as draggable elements and their drop targets. Drop target information will be rendered visually by the author and provided to <a>assistive technologies</a> through an alternate modality.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9572) 			<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9573) 				<li><pref>aria-dropeffect</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9574) 				<li><sref>aria-grabbed</sref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9575) 			</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9576) 		</section>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9577) 		<section id="attrs_relationships">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9578) 			<h3>Relationship Attributes</h3>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9579) 			<p>This section lists <a>attributes</a> that indicate <a>relationships</a> or associations between <a>elements</a> which cannot be readily determined from the document structure.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9580) 			<ul>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9585) 				<li><pref>aria-controls</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9586) 				<li><pref>aria-describedby</pref></li>
b8a0535f6 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-08-11 14:51:43 -0400  9587) 				<li><pref>aria-details</pref></li>
7163888ed aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 16:19:04 -0400  9588) 				<li><pref>aria-errormessage</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9589) 				<li><pref>aria-flowto</pref></li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9590) 				<li><pref>aria-labelledby</pref></li>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9600) 	<section id="state_prop_def">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9601) 		<h2>Definitions of States and Properties (all aria-* attributes)</h2>
79d5c7ba7 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-04-20 15:41:51 -0400  9602) 		<p>Below is an alphabetical list of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <a>states</a> and <a>properties</a> to be used by rich internet application authors. A detailed definition of each <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> state and <a>property</a> follows this compact list.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9603) 		<p id="index_state_prop" class="placeholder">Placeholder for index of states and properties</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9604) 		<div class="property" id="aria-activedescendant">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9605) 			<pdef>aria-activedescendant</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9606) 			<div class="property-description">
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  9607) 				<p>Identifies the currently active element when DOM focus is on a <rref>composite</rref> widget, <rref>combobox</rref>, <rref>textbox</rref>, <rref>group</rref>, or <rref>application</rref>.</p>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  9608) 				<p>The <code>aria-activedescendant</code> property provides an alternative method of managing focus for interactive elements that may contain multiple focusable descendants, such as menus, grids, and toolbars. Instead of moving DOM focus among <a>owned</a> elements, authors MAY set DOM focus on a container <a>element</a> that supports <code>aria-activedescendant</code> and then use <code>aria-activedescendant</code> to refer to the element that is active.</p>
93f7cee7c aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-19 14:02:55 -0400  9609) 				<p> Authors MUST ensure that one of the following two sets of conditions is met when setting the value of <code>aria-activedescendant</code> on an element with DOM focus:</p>
93f7cee7c aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-19 14:02:55 -0400  9610) 				<ol>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  9611) 					<li>The value of <code>aria-activedescendant</code> refers to an <a>owned</a> element. An owned element is either a descendant of the element with DOM focus or a logical descendant as indicated by the <pref>aria-owns</pref> attribute.</li>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  9612) 					<li>
944e1bd07 index.html     (Jon Gunderson       2020-07-16 17:54:14 -0500  9613)             			The element with DOM focus is a <rref>combobox</rref>, <rref>textbox</rref> or <rref>searchbox</rref> with <pref>aria-controls</pref> referring to an element that supports <code>aria-activedescendant</code>, and the value of <code>aria-activedescendant</code> refers to an owned element of the controlled element.
436d41f33 index.html     (JAWS-test2          2020-02-11 18:47:20 +0100  9614)             			For example, in a <rref>combobox</rref>, focus may remain on the <rref>combobox</rref> while the value of <code>aria-activedescendant</code> on the <rref>combobox</rref> element refers to a descendant of a popup <rref>listbox</rref> that is controlled by the <rref>combobox</rref>.
436d41f33 index.html     (JAWS-test2          2020-02-11 18:47:20 +0100  9615)           			</li>
93f7cee7c aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-19 14:02:55 -0400  9616) 				</ol>
93f7cee7c aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-19 14:02:55 -0400  9617) 				<p> Authors SHOULD also ensure that the currently active descendant is visible and in view (or scrolls into view) when focused.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9618) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9619) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9624) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9625) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9626) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9627) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9628) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9629) 						<th class="property-related-head" scope="row">Related Concepts:</th>
a483254f4 index.html     (Daniel Montalvo     2023-02-17 19:33:54 +0100  9630) 						<td class="property-related"><cite><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG2/"><abbr title="Scalable Vector Graphics">SVG</abbr></a></cite> [[SVG2]] and <cite><a href="https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/"><abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr></a></cite> [[DOM]] active</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9631) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9632) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9633) 						<th class="property-applicability-head" scope="row">Used in Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9634) 						<td class="property-applicability">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9635) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9636) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9637) 						<th class="property-descendants-head" scope="row">Inherits into Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9638) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9639) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9640) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9641) 						<th class="property-value-head" scope="row">Value:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9642) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_idref">ID reference</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9643) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9644) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9645) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9646) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9647) 		<div class="property" id="aria-atomic">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9648) 			<pdef>aria-atomic</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9649) 			<div class="property-description">
4d9fd9828 aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2016-05-20 11:19:55 -0500  9650) 				<p>Indicates whether <a>assistive technologies</a> will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the <pref>aria-relevant</pref> attribute.</p>
a483254f4 index.html     (Daniel Montalvo     2023-02-17 19:33:54 +0100  9651) 				<p>Both <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">APIs</abbr></a> and the <cite><a href="https://dom.spec.whatwg.org/">Document Object Model</a></cite> [[DOM]] provide events to allow the assistive technologies to determine changed areas of the document.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9652) 				<p>When the content of a <a>live region</a> changes, user agents SHOULD examine the changed <a>element</a> and traverse the ancestors to find the first element with <pref>aria-atomic</pref> set, and apply the appropriate behavior for the cases below.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9653) 				<ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9654) 					<li>If none of the ancestors have explicitly set <pref>aria-atomic</pref>, the default is that <pref>aria-atomic</pref> is <code>false</code>, and assistive technologies will only present the changed node to the user.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9655) 					<li>If <pref>aria-atomic</pref> is explicitly set to <code>false</code>, assistive technologies will stop searching up the ancestor chain and present only the changed node to the user.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9656) 					<li>If <pref>aria-atomic</pref> is explicitly set to <code>true</code>, assistive technologies will present the entire contents of the element, including the author-defined live region label if one exists.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9657) 				</ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9658) 				<p>When <pref>aria-atomic</pref> is <code>true</code>, assistive technologies MAY choose to combine several changes and present the entire changed region at once.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9659) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9660) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9676) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9677) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9678) 						<th class="property-descendants-head" scope="row">Inherits into Roles:</th>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9684) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9697) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">false (default)</strong></th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9698) 						<td class="value-description">Assistive technologies will present only the changed node or nodes.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9699) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9700) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9701) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">true</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9702) 						<td class="value-description">Assistive technologies will present the entire changed region as a whole, including the author-defined label if one exists.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9703) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9704) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9705) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9706) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9707) 		<div class="property" id="aria-autocomplete">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9708) 			<pdef>aria-autocomplete</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9709) 			<div class="property-description">
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  9710) 				<p>Indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for a <rref>combobox</rref>, <rref>searchbox</rref>, or <rref>textbox</rref> and specifies how predictions would be presented if they were made.</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9711) 				<p>The <code>aria-autocomplete</code> property describes the type of interaction model a <rref>textbox</rref>, <rref>searchbox</rref>, or <rref>combobox</rref> employs when dynamically helping users complete text input. It distinguishes between two models: the inline model (<code>aria-autocomplete="inline"</code>) that presents a value completion prediction inside the text input and the list model (<code>aria-autocomplete="list"</code>) that presents a collection of possible values in a separate element that pops up adjacent to the text input. It is possible for an input to offer both models at the same time (<code>aria-autocomplete="both"</code>).</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9712) 				<p>The <code>aria-autocomplete</code> property is limited to describing predictive behaviors of an input element. Authors SHOULD either omit specifying a value for <code>aria-autocomplete</code> or set <code>aria-autocomplete</code> to <code>none</code> if an input element provides one or more input proposals where none of the proposals are dependent on the specific input provided by the user. For instance, a combobox where the value of <code>aria-autocomplete</code> would be <code>none</code> is a search field that displays suggested values by listing the 5 most recently used search terms without any filtering of the list based on the user's input. Elements with a role that supports <code>aria-autocomplete</code> have a default value for <code>aria-autocomplete</code> of <code>none</code>.</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9713) 				<p>When an inline suggestion is made as a user types in an input, suggested text for completing the value of the field dynamically appears in the field after the input cursor, and the suggested value is accepted as the value of the input if the user performs an action that causes focus to leave the field. When an element has <code>aria-autocomplete</code> set to <code>inline</code> or <code>both</code>, authors SHOULD ensure that the automatically suggested portion of the text is presented as selected text. This enables assistive technologies to distinguish between a user's input and the automatic suggestion and, in the event that the suggestion is not the desired value, enables the user to easily delete the suggestion or replace it by continuing to type.</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9714) 				<p> If an element has <code>aria-autocomplete</code> set to <code>list</code> or <code>both</code>, authors MUST ensure both of the following conditions are met:</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9715) 				<ol>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9716) 					<li>The element has a value specified for <pref>aria-controls</pref> that refers to the element that contains the collection of suggested values.</li>
c2905d18e index.html     (Matt King           2019-11-01 13:32:39 -0700  9717) 					<li>The element has a value for <pref>aria-haspopup</pref> that matches the role of the element that contains the collection of suggested values.</li>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9718) 				</ol>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9719) 				<p>Some implementations of the list model require the user to perform an action, such as moving focus to the suggestion with the <kbd>Down Arrow</kbd> or clicking on the suggestion, in order to choose the suggestion. In such implementations, authors MAY manage focus by either using <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref> if the collection container supports it or by moving DOM focus to the suggestion. However, other implementations of the list model automatically highlight one suggestion as the selected value that will be accepted when the field loses focus, e.g., when the user presses the <kbd>Tab</kbd> key or clicks on a different field. If an element has <code>aria-autocomplete</code> set to <code>list</code> or <code>both</code>, and if a suggestion is automatically selected as the user provides input, authors MUST ensure all the following conditions are met:</p>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9720) 				<ol>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9721) 					<li>The collection of suggestions is presented in an element with a role that supports <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref>.</li>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9722) 					<li>The value of <code>aria-activedescendant</code> set on the input field is dynamically adjusted to refer to the element containing the selected suggestion as described in the definition of <pref>aria-activedescendant</pref>.</li>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9723) 					<li>DOM focus remains on the text input while the suggestions are displayed.</li>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9724) 				</ol>
a87be5eb4 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-06-21 17:36:33 -0400  9725) 				<p>The <code>aria-autocomplete</code> property is not intended to indicate the presence of a completion suggestion, and authors SHOULD NOT dynamically change its value in order to communicate the presence of a suggestion. When an element has <code>aria-autocomplete</code> set to <code>list</code> or <code>both</code>, authors SHOULD use the <sref>aria-expanded</sref> state to communicate whether the element that presents the suggestion collection is displayed.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9726) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9727) 			<table class="property-features">

d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9765) 						<td class="value-description">When a user is providing input, text suggesting one way to complete the provided input may be dynamically inserted after the caret.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9766) 					</tr>

d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9769) 						<td class="value-description">When a user is providing input, an element containing a collection of values that could complete the provided input may be displayed.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9770) 					</tr>
d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9771)                     <tr>
d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9772)                         <th class="value-name" scope="row">both</th>
d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9773)                         <td class="value-description">When a user is providing input, an element containing a collection of values that could complete the provided input may be displayed. If displayed, one value in the collection is automatically selected, and the text needed to complete the automatically selected value appears after the caret in the input.</td>
d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9774)                     </tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9775) 					<tr>

d7cdc8f97 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie           2016-06-21 17:05:57 -0400  9777) 						<td class="value-description">When a user is providing input, an automatic suggestion that attempts to predict how the user intends to complete the input is not displayed.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9778) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9782) 		<div class="state" id="aria-busy">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9783) 			<sdef>aria-busy</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9784) 			<div class="state-description">
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9785) 				<p>Indicates an element is being modified and that assistive technologies MAY want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9786) 				<p>The default value of <code>aria-busy</code> is <code>false</code> for all elements. When <code>aria-busy</code> is <code>true</code> for an element, assistive technologies MAY ignore changes to content owned by that element and then process all changes made during the busy period as a single, atomic update when <code>aria-busy</code> becomes <code>false</code>.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9787) 				<p>If it is necessary to make multiple additions, modifications, or removals within a container element that is already either partially or fully rendered, authors MAY set <code>aria-busy</code> to <code>true</code> on the container element before the first change, and then set it to <code>false</code> when the last change is complete. For example, if multiple changes to a <a>live region</a> should be spoken as a single unit of speech, authors MAY set <code>aria-busy</code> to <code>true</code> while the changes are being made and then set it to <code>false</code> when the changes are complete and ready to be spoken.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9788) 				<p>If an element with role <rref>feed</rref> is marked busy, assistive technologies MAY defer rendering changes that occur inside the <code>feed</code> with the exception of user-initiated changes that occur inside the <rref>article</rref> that the user is reading during the busy period.</p>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9789) 				<p>If changes to a rendered <rref>widget</rref> would create a state where the <rref>widget</rref> is missing <a href="#mustContain">required owned elements</a> during script execution, authors MUST set <code>aria-busy</code> to <code>true</code> on the <rref>widget</rref> during the update process. For example, if a rendered tree grid required a set of simultaneous updates to multiple discontiguous branches, an alternative to replacing the complete tree element with a single update would be to mark the tree busy while each of the branches are modified.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9790) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9791) 			<table class="state-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9807) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9815) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9816) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9817) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9818) 			<table class="value-descriptions">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9819) 				<caption>Values:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9820) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9821) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9822) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9823) 						<th scope="col">Description</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9824) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9825) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9826) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9827) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9828) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">false (default)</strong>:</th>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9829) 						<td class="value-description">There are no expected updates for the element.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9830) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9831) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9832) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">true</th>
fce8f4ac4 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2015-09-17 02:59:16 -0700  9833) 						<td class="value-description">The element is being updated.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9834) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9835) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9836) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9837) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9838) 		<div class="state" id="aria-checked">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9839) 			<sdef>aria-checked</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9840) 			<div class="state-description">
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9841) 				<p>Indicates the current "checked" <a>state</a> of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other <a>widgets</a>. See related <sref>aria-pressed</sref> and <sref>aria-selected</sref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9842) 				<p>The <sref>aria-checked</sref> <a>attribute</a> indicates whether the <a>element</a> is checked (<code>true</code>), unchecked (<code>false</code>), or represents a group of other elements that have a mixture of checked and unchecked <span>values</span> (<code>mixed</code>). Most inputs only support values of <code>true</code> and <code>false</code>, but the <code>mixed</code> value is supported by certain tri-state inputs such as a <rref>checkbox</rref> or <rref>menuitemcheckbox</rref>.</p>
bc064a6f2 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-21 10:05:37 -0700  9843) 				<p>The <code>mixed</code> value is <em>not</em> supported on <rref>radio</rref>, <rref>menuitemradio</rref>, <rref>switch</rref> or any element that inherits from these, and <a>user agents</a> MUST treat a <code>mixed</code> value as equivalent to <code>false</code> for those <a>roles</a>.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700  9844) 				<p>Examples using the <code>mixed</code> value of tri-state inputs are covered in the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9845) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9890) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9902) 		<div class="property" id="aria-colcount">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9903) 			<pdef>aria-colcount</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9904) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  9905) 				<p>Defines the total number of columns in a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-colindex</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9906) 				<p>If all of the columns are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, it is not necessary to set this <a>attribute</a> as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the total number of columns. However, if only a portion of the columns is present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> at a given moment, this attribute is needed to provide an explicit indication of the number of columns in the full table.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9907) 				<p>Authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-colcount</pref> to an integer equal to the number of columns in the full table. If the total number of columns is unknown, authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-colcount</pref> to <code>-1</code> to indicate that the value should not be calculated by the user agent.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9908) 				<p>The following example shows a grid with 16 columns, of which columns 2, 3, 4, and 9 are displayed to the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9909) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9910) &lt;div role="grid" <strong>aria-colcount="16"</strong>&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9911)   &lt;div role="rowgroup"&gt;

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9914)       &lt;span role="columnheader" aria-colindex="3"&gt;Last Name&lt;/span&gt;

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9924)       &lt;span role="gridcell" aria-colindex="9"&gt;555-1234&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9925)     &lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9926)     &lt;div role="row"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9927)       &lt;span role="gridcell" aria-colindex="2"&gt;Sara&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9928)       &lt;span role="gridcell" aria-colindex="3"&gt;James&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9929)       &lt;span role="gridcell" aria-colindex="4"&gt;Acme, Inc.&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9930)       &lt;span role="gridcell" aria-colindex="9"&gt;555-1235&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9931)     &lt;/div&gt;

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9948) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9951) 						<td class="property-applicability">Placeholder</td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9953) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9963) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9964) 		<div class="property" id="aria-colindex">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9965) 			<pdef>aria-colindex</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9966) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200  9967) 				<p>Defines an <a>element's</a> column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-colcount</pref> and <pref>aria-colspan</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9968) 				<p>If all of the columns are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, it is not necessary to set this <a>attribute</a> as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the column index of each cell or <rref>gridcell</rref>. However, if only a portion of the columns is present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> at a given moment, this attribute is needed to provide an explicit indication of the column of each cell or gridcell with respect to the full table.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9969) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <span>value</span> for <pref>aria-colindex</pref> to an integer greater than or equal to 1, greater than the <pref>aria-colindex</pref> value of any previous elements within the same row, and less than or equal to the number of columns in the full table. For a cell or gridcell which spans multiple columns, authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-colindex</pref> to the start of the span.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500  9970) 				<p>If the set of columns which is present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> is contiguous, and if there are no cells which span more than one row or column in that set, then authors MAY place <pref>aria-colindex</pref> on each row, setting the value to the index of the first column of the set. Otherwise, authors SHOULD place <pref>aria-colindex</pref> on all of the children or <a>owned</a> elements of each row.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9971) 				<p>The following example shows a grid with 16 columns, of which columns 2 through 5 are displayed to the user. Because the set of columns is contiguous, <pref>aria-colindex</pref> can be placed on each row.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9972) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9973) &lt;div role="grid" aria-colcount="16"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9974)   &lt;div role="rowgroup"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9975)     &lt;div role="row" <strong>aria-colindex="2"</strong>&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9976)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;First Name&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9977)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Last Name&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9978)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Company&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9979)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Address&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9980)     &lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9981)   &lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9982)   &lt;div role="rowgroup"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400  9983)     &lt;div role="row" <strong>aria-colindex="2"</strong>&gt;

While the set of columns is contiguous, some of the cells span multiple rows. As a result, <pref>aria-colindex</pref> needs to be placed on all of the owned elements of each row.</p>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10079) 		<div class="property" id="aria-colspan">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10080) 			<pdef>aria-colspan</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10081) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 10082) 				<p>Defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-colindex</pref> and <pref>aria-rowspan</pref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 10083) 				<p>This <a>attribute</a> is intended for cells and gridcells which are not contained in a native table. When defining the column span of cells or gridcells in a native table, authors SHOULD use the host language's attribute instead of <pref>aria-colspan</pref>. If <pref>aria-colspan</pref> is used on an element for which the host language provides an equivalent attribute, <a>user agents</a> MUST ignore the value of <pref>aria-colspan</pref> and instead expose the value of the host language's attribute to <a>assistive technologies</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10084) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <span>value</span> of <pref>aria-colspan</pref> to an integer greater than or equal to 1 and less than the value which would cause the cell or gridcell to overlap the next cell or gridcell in the same row.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10085) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10086) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10114) 		<div class="property" id="aria-controls">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10115) 			<pdef>aria-controls</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10116) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10117) 				<p>Identifies the <a>element</a> (or elements) whose contents or presence are controlled by the current element. See related <pref>aria-owns</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10118) 				<p>For example:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10119) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10120) 					<li>A table of contents tree view may control the content of a neighboring document pane.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10121) 					<li>A group of checkboxes may control what commodity prices are tracked live in a table or graph.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10122) 					<li>A tab controls the display of its associated tab panel.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10123) 				</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10124) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10125) 			<table class="property-features">
