478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10155) 		<div class="state" id="aria-current">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10156) 			<sdef>aria-current</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10157) 			<div class="state-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 10158) 				<p>Indicates the <a>element</a> that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800 10159) 				<p>The <sref>aria-current</sref> <a>attribute</a> is a token type. Any value not included in the list of allowed values SHOULD be treated by <a>assistive technologies</a> as if the value <code>true</code> had been provided. If the attribute is not present or its value is an empty string or <code>undefined</code>, the default value of <code>false</code> applies and the <sref>aria-current</sref> <a>state</a> MUST NOT be exposed by user agents or assistive technologies.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10160) 				<p>The <sref>aria-current</sref> attribute is used when an element within a set of related elements is visually styled to indicate it is the current item in the set. For example:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10161) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10162) 					<li>A <code>page</code> token used to indicate a link within a set of pagination links, where the link is visually styled to represent the currently-displayed page.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10163) 					<li>A <code>step</code> token used to indicate a link within a step indicator for a step-based process, where the link is visually styled to represent the current step.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10164) 					<li>A <code>location</code> token used to indicate the image that is visually highlighted as the current component of a flow chart.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10165) 					<li>A <code>date</code> token used to indicate the current date within a calendar.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10166) 					<li>A <code>time</code> token used to indicate the current time within a timetable.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10167) 				</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10168) 				<p>Authors SHOULD only mark one element in a set of elements as current with <sref>aria-current</sref>.</p>
25b4cc2cd aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-05-13 06:41:56 -0400 10169) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT use the <sref>aria-current</sref> attribute as a substitute for <sref>aria-selected</sref> in widgets where <sref>aria-selected</sref> has the same meaning. For example, in a <rref>tablist</rref>, <sref>aria-selected</sref> is used on a <rref>tab</rref> to indicate the currently-displayed <rref>tabpanel</rref>.</p>
25b4cc2cd aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-05-13 06:41:56 -0400 10170) 				<p class="note">In some use cases for widgets that support <sref>aria-selected</sref>, current and selected can have different meanings and can both be used within the same set of elements. For example, <code>aria-current="page"</code> can be used in a navigation <rref>tree</rref> to indicate which page is currently displayed, while <code>aria-selected="true"</code> indicates which page will be displayed if the user activates the <rref>treeitem</rref>. Furthermore, the same tree may support operating on one or more selected pages (treeitems) by way of a context menu containing options such as "delete" and "move."</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10171) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10239) 		<div class="property" id="aria-describedby">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10240) 			<pdef>aria-describedby</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10241) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10242) 				<p>Identifies the <a>element</a> (or elements) that describes the <a>object</a>. See related <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10243) 				<p>The <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute is similar to the <pref>aria-describedby</pref> in that both reference other elements to calculate a text alternative, but a label should be concise, where a description is intended to provide more verbose information.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10244) 				<!-- keep previous sentence synced with the associated description in #aria-labelledby -->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10245) 				<p>The element or elements referenced by the aria-describedby comprise the entire description. Include ID references to multiple elements if necessary, or enclose a set of elements (e.g., paragraphs) with the element referenced by the ID.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10246) 			</div>

57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10281)                 <div class="property" id="aria-details">
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10282) 			<pdef>aria-details</pdef>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10283) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 10284) 				<p>Identifies the <a>element</a> that provides a detailed, extended description for the <a>object</a>. See related <pref>aria-describedby</pref>.</p>
d9617aaca aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-09-02 15:57:22 -0400 10285) 				<p>The <code>aria-details</code> attribute references a single element that provides more detailed information than would normally be provided by <pref>aria-describedby</pref>. It enables <a>assistive technologies</a> to make users aware of the availability of an extended description as well as navigate to it. Authors SHOULD ensure the element referenced by <code>aria-details</code> is visible to all users.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700 10286) 				<p>Unlike elements referenced by <code>aria-describedby</code>, the element referenced by <code>aria-details</code> is not used in either the Accessible <a href="#mapping_additional_nd_name" class="accname">Name Computation</a> or the Accessible <a href="#mapping_additional_nd_description" class="accname">Description Computation</a> as defined in the Accessible Name and Description specification. Thus, the content of an element referenced by <code>aria-details</code> is not flattened to a string when presented to assistive technology users. This makes <code>aria-details</code> particularly useful when converting the information to a string would cause a loss of information or make the extended description more difficult to understand.</p>
d9617aaca aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-09-02 15:57:22 -0400 10287) 				<p>In some user agents, multiple reference relationships for descriptive information are not supported by the accessibility API. In such cases, if both <pref>aria-describedby</pref> and <code>aria-details</code> are provided on an element, <code>aria-details</code> takes precedence.</p>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10288) 				<p>A common use for <code>aria-details</code> is in digital publishing where an extended description needs to be conveyed in a book that requires structural markup or the embedding of other technology to provide illustrative content. The following example demonstrates this scenario.</p>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10289) 				<pre class="example highlight">
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10290)                                 &lt;!-- Provision of an extended description --&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10291)                                 &lt;img src="pythagorean.jpg" alt="Pythagorean Theorem" aria-details="det"&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10292)                                 &lt;details id="det"&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10293)                                   &lt;summary&gt;Example&lt;/summary&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10294)                                   &lt;p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10295)                                     The Pythagorean Theorem is a relationship in Euclidean Geometry between the three sides of
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10296)                                     a right triangle, where the square of the hypotenuse is the sum of the squares of the two
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10297)                                     opposing sides.
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10298)                                   &lt;/p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10299)                                   &lt;p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10300)                                     The following drawing illustrates an application of the Pythagorean Theorem when used to
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10301)                                     construct a skateboard ramp.
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10302)                                   &lt;/p&gt;
ba03d59e0 index.html     (Simon Pieters       2019-02-27 14:56:59 +0100 10303)                                   &lt;object data="skatebd-ramp.svg"  type="image/svg+xml"&gt;&lt;/object&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10304)                                   &lt;p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10305)                                     In this example you will notice a skateboard with a base and vertical board whose width
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10306)                                     is the width of the ramp. To compute how long the ramp must be, simply calculate the
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10307)                                     base length, square it, sum it with the square of the height of the ramp, and take the
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10308)                                     square root of the sum.
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10309)                                   &lt;/p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10310)                                 &lt;/details&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10311) 				</pre>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10312) 				<p>Alternatively, <code>aria-details</code> may refer to a link to a web page having the extended description, as shown in the following example.</p>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10313) 				<pre class="example highlight">
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10314)                                 &lt;!-- Provision of an extended description --&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10315)                                 &lt;img src="pythagorean.jpg" alt="Pythagorean Theorem" aria-details="det"&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10316)                                 &lt;p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10317)                                   See an &lt;a href="http://foo.com/pt.html" id="det"&gt;Application of the Pythagorean Theorem&lt;/a&gt;.
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10318)                                 &lt;/p&gt;
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10319) 				</pre>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10320) 			</div>
57c31439e aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-02-25 16:18:41 -0500 10321) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10341) 		<div class="state" id="aria-disabled">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10342) 			<sdef>aria-disabled</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10343) 			<div class="state-description">
25b4cc2cd aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-05-13 06:41:56 -0400 10344) 				<p>Indicates that the <a>element</a> is <a>perceivable</a> but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise <a>operable</a>. See related <sref>aria-hidden</sref> and <pref>aria-readonly</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10345) 				<p>For example, irrelevant options in a radio group may be disabled. Disabled elements might not receive focus from the tab order. For some disabled elements, applications might choose not to support navigation to descendants. In addition to setting the <sref>aria-disabled</sref> attribute, authors SHOULD change the appearance (grayed out, etc.) to indicate that the item has been disabled.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10346) 				<p>The <a>state</a> of being disabled applies to the current element and all focusable descendant elements of the element on which the <sref>aria-disabled</sref> <a>attribute</a> is applied.</p>
484483e22 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-25 11:14:05 -0700 10347)                 <p class="note">While <sref>aria-disabled</sref> and proper scripting can successfully disable an element with role <rref>link</rref>, fully disabling a host language equivalent can be problematic. Authors are advised not to use <sref>aria-disabled</sref> on elements that cannot be disabled through features of the host language alone.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10348) 				<p class="note" title="Usage on columnheader, rowheader and row">While <sref>aria-disabled</sref> is currently supported on <rref>columnheader</rref>, <rref>rowheader</rref>, and <rref>row</rref>, in a future version the working group plans to prohibit its use on elements with any of those three roles except when they are in the context of a <rref>grid</rref> or <rref>treegrid</rref>.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10349) 				<p class="note">This state is being deprecated as a global state in ARIA 1.2. In future versions it will only be allowed on roles where it is specifically supported.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10350) 			</div>

3f268c829 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2016-05-16 10:12:11 -0700 10398) 		<div class="property deprecated" id="aria-dropeffect">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10399) 			<pdef>aria-dropeffect</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10400) 			<div class="property-description">
3f268c829 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2016-05-16 10:12:11 -0700 10401) 			  <p>[Deprecated in ARIA 1.1] Indicates what functions can be performed when a dragged object is released on the drop target.</p>
214e03d9b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 13:14:46 -0500 10402) 			  <p class="note">The <code>aria-dropeffect</code> property is expected to be replaced by a new feature in a future version of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr>. Authors are therefore advised to treat <code>aria-dropeffect</code> as <a>deprecated</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10403) 			  <p>This <a>property</a> allows assistive technologies to convey the possible drag options available to users, including whether a pop-up menu of choices is provided by the application. Typically, drop effect functions can only be provided once an object has been grabbed for a drag operation as the drop effect functions available are dependent on the object being dragged.</p>
6502442a1 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-02 11:04:04 -0700 10404) 				<p>More than one drop effect may be supported for a given <a>element</a>. Therefore, the value of this <a>attribute</a> is a space-separated set of tokens indicating the possible effects, or <code>none</code> if there is no supported operation. In addition to setting the <pref>aria-dropeffect</pref> attribute, authors SHOULD show a visual indication of potential drop targets.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10405) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10439) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10440) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10441) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10442) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10443) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">copy</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10444) 						<td class="value-description">A duplicate of the source object will be dropped into the target.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10445) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10446) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10447) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">execute</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10448) 						<td class="value-description">A function supported by the drop target is executed, using the drag source as an input.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10449) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10450) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10451) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">link</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10452) 						<td class="value-description">A reference or shortcut to the dragged object will be created in the target object.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10453) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10454) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10456) 						<td class="value-description">The source object will be removed from its current location and dropped into the target.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10457) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10458) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10459) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">none (default)</strong></th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10460) 						<td class="value-description">No operation can be performed; effectively cancels the drag operation if an attempt is made to drop on this object. Ignored if combined with any other token value. e.g., 'none copy' is equivalent to a 'copy' value.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10461) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10465) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10468) 		</div>
7163888ed aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 16:19:04 -0400 10469) 		<div class="property" id="aria-errormessage">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10470) 			<pdef>aria-errormessage</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10471) 			<div class="property-description">
7eaf90605 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-12-06 17:12:50 -0500 10472) 				<p>Identifies the <a>element</a> that provides an error message for an <a>object</a>. See related <sref>aria-invalid</sref> and <pref>aria-describedby</pref>.</p>
7eaf90605 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-12-06 17:12:50 -0500 10473) 				<p>The <code>aria-errormessage</code> attribute references another element that contains error message text. Authors MUST use <sref>aria-invalid</sref> in conjunction with <code>aria-errormessage</code>.</p>
7eaf90605 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-12-06 17:12:50 -0500 10474) 				<p>When the value of an object is not valid, <sref>aria-invalid</sref> is set to <code>true</code>, which indicates that the message contained by an element referenced by <code>aria-errormessage</code> is pertinent.</p>
d9770573d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-15 09:09:42 -0400 10475) 				<p>When an object is in a valid state, it has either <sref>aria-invalid</sref> set to <code>false</code> or it does not have the <sref>aria-invalid</sref> attribute. Authors MAY use <code>aria-errormessage</code> on an object that is currently valid, but only if the element referenced by <code>aria-errormessage</code> is <a>hidden</a>, because the message it contains is not pertinent.</p>
d9770573d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-15 09:09:42 -0400 10476) 				<p>When <code>aria-errormessage</code> is pertinent, authors MUST ensure the content is not hidden so users can navigate to and examine the error message. Similarly, when <code>aria-errormessage</code> is not pertinent, authors MUST either ensure the content is <a>hidden</a> or remove the <code>aria-errormessage</code> attribute or its value.</p>
7eaf90605 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-12-06 17:12:50 -0500 10477) 				<p>User agents MUST NOT expose <code>aria-errormessage</code> for an object with an <sref>aria-invalid</sref> value of <code>false</code>.</p>
7eaf90605 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-12-06 17:12:50 -0500 10478) 				<p>Authors MAY call attention to a newly rendered error message with a live region by either applying an <pref>aria-live</pref> property or using one of the <a href="#live_region_roles">live region roles</a>, such as <rref>alert</rref>. A live region is appropriate when an error message is displayed to users after they have provided an invalid value.</p>
d9770573d index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-10-15 09:09:42 -0400 10479) 				<p>A typical message describes what is wrong and informs users what is required. For example, an error message might be, <q>Invalid time: the time must be between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM.</q> The following example code shows markup for an initial valid state and for a subsequent invalid state. Note the changes to <sref>aria-invalid</sref> on the text input <a>object</a>, and to <pref>aria-live</pref> on the <a>element</a> containing the text of the error message:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10480) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10481) 				&lt;!-- Initial valid state --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10482) 				&lt;label for="startTime"&gt; Please enter a start time for the meeting: &lt;/label&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10483) 				&lt;input id="startTime" type="text" aria-errormessage="msgID" value="" aria-invalid="false"&gt;
bd3b08332 index.html     (JAWS-test           2019-10-10 03:40:41 +0200 10484) 				&lt;span id="msgID" aria-live="assertive"&gt;&lt;span style="visibility:hidden"&gt;Invalid time: the time must be between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10485) 
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10486) 				&lt;!-- User has input an invalid value --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10487) 				&lt;label for="startTime"&gt; Please enter a start time for the meeting: &lt;/label&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10488) 				&lt;input id="startTime" type="text" aria-errormessage="msgID" aria-invalid="true" value="11:30 PM" &gt;
bd3b08332 index.html     (JAWS-test           2019-10-10 03:40:41 +0200 10489) 				&lt;span id="msgID" aria-live="assertive"&gt;&lt;span style="visibility:visible"&gt;Invalid time: the time must be between 9:00 AM and 5:00 PM&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10490) 				</pre>
b0f1ed0a7 index.html     (Harris Schneiderman 2020-02-03 11:27:07 -0800 10491) 				<p class="note">This example uses <code>aria-live="assertive"</code> to indicate that assistive technologies should immediately announce the error message rather than completing other queued announcements first. This increases the likelihood that users are aware of the error message before they move focus out of the input.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10492) 				<p class="note">This state is being deprecated as a global state in ARIA 1.2. In future versions it will only be allowed on roles where it is specifically supported.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10493)       		</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10518) 		<div class="state" id="aria-expanded">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10519) 			<sdef>aria-expanded</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10520) 			<div class="state-description">
d91c6d6b3 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:28:03 +0200 10521) 				<p>Indicates whether a grouping element owned or controlled by this element is expanded or collapsed.</p>
d91c6d6b3 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:28:03 +0200 10522) 				<p>The <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attribute is applied to a focusable, interactive element that toggles visibility of content in another element. For example, it is applied to a parent <rref>treeitem</rref> to indicate whether its child branch of the tree is shown. Similarly, it can be applied to a <rref>button</rref> that controls visibility of a section of page content.</p>
d91c6d6b3 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:28:03 +0200 10523) 				<p>If a grouping container that can be expanded or collapsed is not <a>owned</a> by the element that has the <sref>aria-expanded</sref> attribute, the author SHOULD identify the controlling relationship by referencing the container from the element that has <sref>aria-expanded</sref> with the <pref>aria-controls</pref> property.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10524) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10564) 					</tr>

d91c6d6b3 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:28:03 +0200 10567) 						<td class="value-description">The grouping element this element owns or controls is expanded.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10568) 					</tr>

d91c6d6b3 index.html     (Matt King           2019-09-04 11:28:03 +0200 10571) 						<td class="value-description">The element does not own or control a grouping element that is expandable.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10572) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10575) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10576) 		<div class="property" id="aria-flowto">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10577) 			<pdef>aria-flowto</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10578) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10579) 				<p>Identifies the next <a>element</a> (or elements) in an alternate reading order of content which, at the user's discretion, allows assistive technology to override the general default of reading in document source order.</p>
a7868d263 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-05-21 19:09:28 -0400 10580) 				<p>When <pref>aria-flowto</pref> has a single ID reference, it allows <a>assistive technologies</a> to, at the user's request, forego normal document reading order and go to the targeted <a>object</a>. <!-- [No longer ref XHTML2] <pref>aria-flowto</pref> in subsequent elements would follow a process similar to <cite><a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/2006/WD-xhtml2-20060726/mod-hyperAttributes.html#adef_hyperAttributes_nextfocus">next focus in <abbr title="Extensible Hypertext Markup Language">XHTML</abbr>2</a></cite> ([[XHTML2]]). --> However, when <pref>aria-flowto</pref> is provided with multiple ID references, assistive technologies SHOULD present the referenced elements as path choices.</p>
a7868d263 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-05-21 19:09:28 -0400 10581) 				<p>In the case of one or more ID references, <a>user agents</a> or assistive technologies SHOULD give the user the option of navigating to any of the targeted elements. The name of the path can be determined by the name of the target element of the <pref>aria-flowto</pref> <a>attribute</a>. <a>Accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">APIs</abbr></a> can provide named path <a>relationships</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10582) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10583) 			<table class="property-features">

3f268c829 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2016-05-16 10:12:11 -0700 10613) 		<div class="state deprecated" id="aria-grabbed">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10614) 			<sdef>aria-grabbed</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10615) 			<div class="state-description">
3f268c829 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2016-05-16 10:12:11 -0700 10616) 				<p>[Deprecated in ARIA 1.1] Indicates an element's "grabbed" <a>state</a> in a drag-and-drop operation.</p>
214e03d9b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-02-04 13:14:46 -0500 10617) 				<p class="note">The <code>aria-grabbed</code> state is expected to be replaced by a new feature in a future version of <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr>. Authors are therefore advised to treat <code>aria-grabbed</code> as <a>deprecated</a>.</p>
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200 10618) 				<p>Setting <code>aria-grabbed</code> to <code>true</code> indicates that the <a>element</a> has been selected for dragging. Setting <code>aria-grabbed</code> to <code>false</code> indicates that the element can be grabbed for a drag-and-drop operation, but is not currently grabbed. If <code>aria-grabbed</code> is unspecified or set to <code>undefined</code> (default), the element cannot be grabbed.</p>
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200 10619) 				<p>When <sref>aria-grabbed</sref> is set to <code>true</code>, authors SHOULD update the <pref>aria-dropeffect</pref> <a>attribute</a> of all potential drop targets. When an element is not grabbed (the value is set to <code>false</code> or <code>undefined</code>, or the attribute is removed), authors SHOULD revert the <pref>aria-dropeffect</pref> attributes of the associated drop targets to <code>none</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10620) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10672) 		<div class="property" id="aria-haspopup">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10673) 			<pdef>aria-haspopup</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10674) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 10675) 				<p>Indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an <a>element</a>.</p>
93f778660 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 15:54:25 -0400 10676) 				<p>A popup element usually appears as a block of content that is on top of other content. Authors MUST ensure that the role of the element that serves as the container for the popup content is <rref>menu</rref>, <rref>listbox</rref>, <rref>tree</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>dialog</rref>, and that the value of <code>aria-haspopup</code> matches the role of the popup container.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10677) 				<p>For the popup element to be keyboard accessible, authors SHOULD ensure that the element that can trigger the popup is focusable, that there is a keyboard mechanism for opening the popup, and that the popup element manages focus of all its descendants as described in <a href="#managingfocus">Managing Focus</a>.</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800 10678) 				<p>The <code>aria-haspopup</code> property is a token type. <a>User agents</a> MUST treat any value of <code>aria-haspopup</code> that is not included in the list of allowed values, including an empty string, as if the value <code>false</code> had been provided. To provide backward compatibility with ARIA 1.0 content, user agents MUST treat an <code>aria-haspopup</code> value of <code>true</code> as equivalent to a value of <code>menu</code>.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10679) 				<p><a>Assistive technologies</a> SHOULD NOT expose the <code>aria-haspopup</code> property if it has a value of <code>false</code>.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10680) 				<p class="note">A <rref>tooltip</rref> is not considered to be a popup in this context.</p>
46b6a9762 index.html     (Domenic Denicola    2020-09-18 13:34:32 -0400 10681) 				<p class="note"><code>aria-haspopup</code> is most relevant to use when there is a visual indicator in the element that triggers the popup.
46b6a9762 index.html     (Domenic Denicola    2020-09-18 13:34:32 -0400 10682) 					For example, many controls styled with a downward pointing triangle, chevron, or ellipsis (three consecutive dots) have become standard visual indicators that a popup will display when the control is activated.
24427e8c5 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-07-09 17:23:06 -0700 10683) 					If some functional difference is relevant to display to a sighted user by means of a different visual style, that functional difference is usually relevant to convey to users of assistive technology.
24427e8c5 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-07-09 17:23:06 -0700 10684) 					If there is no visual indication that an element will trigger a popup, authors are advised to consider whether use of <code>aria-haspopup</code> is necessary, and avoid using it when it's not.
24427e8c5 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-07-09 17:23:06 -0700 10685) 				</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10686) 				<p class="note">This property is being deprecated as a global property in ARIA 1.2. In future versions it will only be allowed on roles where it is specifically supported.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10687) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10727) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">false (default)</strong></th>
93f778660 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 15:54:25 -0400 10728) 						<td class="value-description">Indicates the element does not have a popup.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10729) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10730) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10731) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">true</th>
93f778660 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 15:54:25 -0400 10732) 						<td class="value-description">Indicates the popup is a <rref>menu</rref>.</td>
93f778660 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 15:54:25 -0400 10733) 					</tr>
93f778660 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-05-05 15:54:25 -0400 10734) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10757) 		<div class="state" id="aria-hidden">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10758) 			<sdef>aria-hidden</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10759) 			<div class="state-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10760) 				<p>Indicates whether the <a>element</a> is exposed to an accessibility API. See related <sref>aria-disabled</sref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10761) 				<p>User agents determine an element's <a>hidden</a> status based on whether it is rendered, and the rendering is usually controlled by CSS. For example, an element whose <code>display</code> property is set to <code>none</code> is not rendered. An element is considered <a>hidden</a> if it, or any of its ancestors are not rendered or have their <code>aria-hidden</code> attribute value set to <code>true</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10762) 				<p>Authors MAY, with caution, use aria-hidden to hide visibly rendered content from assistive technologies <em>only</em> if the act of hiding this content is intended to improve the experience for users of assistive technologies by removing redundant or extraneous content. Authors using aria-hidden to hide visible content from screen readers MUST ensure that identical or equivalent meaning and functionality is exposed to assistive technologies.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10763) 				<p class="note">Authors are advised to use extreme caution and consider a wide range of disabilities when hiding visibly rendered content from assistive technologies. For example, a sighted, dexterity-impaired individual may use voice-controlled assistive technologies to access a visual interface. If an author hides visible link text "Go to checkout" and exposes similar, yet non-identical link text "Check out now" to the accessibility API, the user may be unable to access the interface they perceive using voice control. Similar problems may also arise for screen reader users. For example, a sighted telephone support technician may attempt to have the blind screen reader user click the "Go to checkout" link, which they may be unable to find using a type-ahead item search ("Go to…").</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10764) 				<p class="note">At the time of this writing, <code><sref>aria-hidden</sref>="false"</code> is known to work inconsistently in browsers. As future implementations improve, use caution and test thoroughly before relying on this approach.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10765) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10819) 			<div class="state-description">
7163888ed aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 16:19:04 -0400 10820) 				<p>Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application. See related <pref>aria-errormessage</pref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 10821) 				<p>If the value is computed to be invalid or out-of-range, the application author SHOULD set this <a>attribute</a> to <code>true</code>. <a>User agents</a> SHOULD inform the user of the error. Application authors SHOULD provide suggestions for corrections if they are known.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 10822) 				<p>When the user attempts to submit data involving a field for which <pref>aria-required</pref> is <code>true</code>, authors MAY use the <sref>aria-invalid</sref> attribute to signal there is an error. However, if the user has not attempted to submit the form, authors SHOULD NOT set the <sref>aria-invalid</sref> attribute on required <a>widgets</a> simply because the user has not yet entered data.</p>
6345e5545 index.html     (James Nurthen       2021-11-12 13:19:11 -0800 10823) 				<p>For future expansion, the <sref>aria-invalid</sref> attribute is a token type. Any value not recognized in the list of allowed <span>values</span> MUST be treated by user agents as if the value <code>true</code> had been provided. If the attribute is not present, or its value is <code>false</code>, or its value is an empty string, the default value of <code>false</code> applies.</p>
bdfa6d97b index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-07 17:12:52 -0700 10824) 				<p class="note">This state is being deprecated as a global state in ARIA 1.2. In future versions it will only be allowed on roles where it is specifically supported.</p>

c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10881) 		<div class="property" id="aria-keyshortcuts">
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10882) 			<pdef>aria-keyshortcuts</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10883) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 10884) 				<p>Indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.</p>
6502442a1 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-02 11:04:04 -0700 10885) 				<p>The value of the <code>aria-keyshortcuts</code> attribute is a space-separated list of keyboard shortcuts that can be pressed to activate a command or textbox widget. The keys defined in the shortcuts represent the physical keys pressed and not the actual characters generated. Each keyboard shortcut consists of one or more tokens delimited by the plus sign ("+") representing zero or more modifier keys and exactly one non-modifier key that must be pressed simultaneously to activate the given shortcut.</p>
19dd98bec aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-10-21 16:44:18 -0400 10886) 				<p>Authors MUST specify modifier keys exactly according to the <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/uievents-key/">UI Events KeyboardEvent key Values</a> spec [[!uievents-key]] - for example, "Alt", "Control", "Shift", "Meta", or "AltGraph". Note that Meta corresponds to the Command key, and Alt to the Option key, on Apple computers.</p>
19dd98bec aria/aria.html (Michael Cooper      2016-10-21 16:44:18 -0400 10887) 				<p>The valid names for non-modifier keys are any printable character such as "A", "B", "1", "2", "$", "Plus" for a plus sign, "Space" for the spacebar, or the names of any other non-modifier key specified in the <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/uievents-key/">UI Events KeyboardEvent key Values</a> spec [[!uievents-key]] - for example, "Enter", "Tab", "ArrowRight", "PageDown", "Escape", or "F1". The use of "Space" for the spacebar is an exception to the <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/uievents-key/">UI Events KeyboardEvent key Values</a> spec [[!uievents-key]] as the space or spacebar key is encoded as <code>'&#160;'</code> and would be treated as a whitespace character.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10888) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure modifier keys come first when they are part of a keyboard shortcut. Authors MUST ensure that required non-modifier keys come last when they are part of a shortcut. The order of the modifier keys is not otherwise significant, so "Alt+Shift+T" and "Shift+Alt+T" are equivalent, but "T+Shift+Alt" is not valid because all of the modifier keys don't come first, and "Alt" is not valid because it doesn't include at least one non-modifier key.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10889) 				<p>When specifying an alphabetic key, both the uppercase and lowercase variants are considered equivalent: "a" and "A" are the same.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10890)                                 <p>When implementing keyboard shortcuts authors should consider the keyboards they intend to support to avoid unintended results. Keyboard designs vary significantly based on the device used and the languages supported. For example, many modifier keys are used in conjunction with other keys to create common punctuation symbols, create number characters, swap keyboard sides on bilingual keyboards to switch languages, and perform a number of other functions.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10891) 				<p>For many supported keyboards, authors can prevent conflicts by avoiding keys other than ASCII letters, as number characters and common punctuation often require modifiers. Here, the keyboard shortcut entered does not equate to the key generated. For example, in French keyboard layouts, the number characters are not available until you press the Control key, so a keyboard shortcut defined as "Control+2" would be ambiguous as this is how one would type the "2" character on a French keyboard.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10892) 				<p>If the character used is determined by a modifier key, the author MUST specify the actual key used to generate the character, that is generated by the key, and not the resulting character. This convention enables the assistive technology to accurately convey what keys must be used to generate the shortcut. For example, on most U.S. English keyboards, the percent sign "%" can be input by pressing Shift+5. The correct way to specify this shortcut is "Shift+5". It is incorrect to specify "%" or "Shift+%". However, note that on some international keyboards the percent sign may be an unmodified key, in which case "%" and "Shift+%" could be correct on those keyboards.</p>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10893) 				<p>If the key that needs to be specified is illegal in the host language or would cause a string to be terminated, authors MUST use the string escaping sequence of the host language to specify it. For example, the double-quote character can be encoded as "Shift+&amp;#39;" in HTML.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10894) 				<p>Examples of valid keyboard shortcuts include:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10895) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10896) 					<li>"A"</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10897) 					<li>"Shift+Space"</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10898) 					<li>"Control+Alt+."</li>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10899) 					<li>"Control+Shift+&amp;#39;"</li>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10900) 					<li>"Alt+Shift+P Control+F"</li>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10901) 					<li>"Meta+C Meta+Shift+C"</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10902) 				</ul>
c58fc4ac4 aria/aria.html (richschwer          2016-04-28 13:59:45 -0400 10903) 				<p>User agents MUST NOT change keyboard behavior in response to the <code>aria-keyshortcuts</code> attribute. Authors MUST handle scripted keyboard events to process <code>aria-keyshortcuts</code>. The <code>aria-keyshortcuts</code> attribute exposes the existence of these shortcuts so that assistive technologies can communicate this information to users.</p>
e1a1f62a6 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-06-27 21:01:08 -0400 10904) 				<p>Authors SHOULD provide a way to expose keyboard shortcuts so that all users may discover them, such as through the use of a tooltip. Authors MUST ensure that <code>aria-keyshortcuts</code> applied to disabled elements are unavailable.</p>
a205e5457 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-04-21 19:27:31 -0700 10905) 				<p>Authors SHOULD avoid implementing shortcut keys that inhibit operating system, user agent, or assistive technology functionality. This requires the author to carefully consider both which keys to assign and the contexts and conditions in which the keys are available to the user. For guidance, see the keyboard shortcuts section of the <cite><a href="" class="practices"><abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> Authoring Practices</a></cite>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10906) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10935) 		<div class="property" id="aria-label">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10936) 			<pdef>aria-label</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10937) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10938) 				<p>Defines a string value that labels the current element. See related <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10939) 				<p>The purpose of <pref>aria-label</pref> is the same as that of <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>. It provides the user with a recognizable name of the object. The most common <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a> mapping for a label is the <a>accessible name</a> property.</p>
1b202f187 index.html     (Carolyn MacLeod     2020-01-23 17:46:42 -0500 10940) 				<p>If the label text is available in the DOM (i.e. typically visible text content), authors SHOULD use <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> and SHOULD NOT use <pref>aria-label</pref>. There may be instances where the name of an element cannot be determined programmatically from the DOM, and there are cases where referencing DOM content is not the desired user experience. Most host languages provide an attribute that could be used to name the element (e.g., the <code>title</code> attribute in [[HTML]]), yet this could present a browser tooltip. In the cases where DOM content or a tooltip is undesirable, authors MAY set the accessible name of the element using <pref>aria-label</pref>. As required by the <a href="#textalternativecomputation">accessible name and description computation</a>, user agents give precedence to <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> over <pref>aria-label</pref> when computing the accessible name property.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10941) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10969) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10970) 		<div class="property" id="aria-labelledby">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10971) 			<pdef>aria-labelledby</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10972) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10973) 				<p>Identifies the <a>element</a> (or elements) that labels the current element. See related <pref>aria-describedby</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10974) 				<p>The purpose of <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> is the same as that of <pref>aria-label</pref>. It provides the user with a recognizable name of the object. The most common <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a> mapping for a label is the <a>accessible name</a> property.</p>
aa02d6143 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2018-10-18 11:04:45 +0200 10975) 				<p>If the interface is such that it is not possible to have a visible label on the screen, authors SHOULD use <pref>aria-label</pref> and SHOULD NOT use <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>. As required by the <a href="#textalternativecomputation">accessible name and description computation</a>, user agents give precedence to <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> over <pref>aria-label</pref> when computing the accessible name property.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10976) 				<p>The <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> attribute is similar to <pref>aria-describedby</pref> in that both reference other elements to calculate a text alternative, but a label should be concise, where a description is intended to provide more verbose information.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10977) 				<!-- keep previous sentence synced with the associated description in #aria-describedby -->
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10978) 				<p class="note">The expected spelling of this property in <abbr title="United States">U.S.</abbr> English is "labeledby." However, the <a>accessibility <abbr title="Application Programing Interfaces">API</abbr></a> features to which this property is mapped have established the "labelledby" spelling. This property is spelled that way to match the convention and minimize the difficulty for developers.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10979) 			</div>

78395d330 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-06-28 16:39:32 -0700 10995) 						<td class="property-applicability">All elements of the base markup except for some roles or elements that prohibit its use</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10996) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10997) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 10999) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11000) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11001) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11003) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_idref_list">ID reference list</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11004) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11005) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11006) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11007) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11008) 		<div class="property" id="aria-level">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11009) 			<pdef>aria-level</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11010) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11011) 				<p>Defines the hierarchical level of an <a>element</a> within a structure.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11012) 				<p>This can be applied inside trees to tree items, to headings inside a document, to nested grids, nested tablists and to other structural items that may appear inside a container or participate in an ownership hierarchy. The value for <pref>aria-level</pref> is an integer greater than or equal to 1.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11013) 				<p>Levels increase with depth. If the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> ancestry does not accurately represent the level, authors SHOULD explicitly define the <pref>aria-level</pref> <a>attribute</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11014) 				<p>This attribute is applied to elements that act as leaf nodes within the orientation of the set, for example, on elements with role <rref>treeitem</rref> rather than elements with role <rref>group</rref>. This means that multiple elements in a set may have the same value for this attribute. Although it would be less repetitive to provide a single value on the container, restricting this to leaf nodes ensures that there is a single way for <a>assistive technologies</a> to use the attribute.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11015) 				<p>If the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> ancestry accurately represents the level, the <a>user agent</a> can calculate the level of an item from the document structure. This attribute can be used to provide an explicit indication of the level when that is not possible to calculate from the document structure or the <pref>aria-owns</pref> attribute. User agent support for automatic calculation of level may vary; authors SHOULD test with <a>user agents</a> and assistive technologies to determine whether this attribute is needed. If the author intends for the user agent to calculate the level, the author SHOULD omit this attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11016)                 <p class="note"> In the case of a <rref>treegrid</rref>, <pref>aria-level</pref> is supported on elements with the role <rref>row</rref>, not elements with role <rref>gridcell</rref>. At first glance, this may seem inconsistent with the application of <pref>aria-level</pref> on <rref>treeitem</rref> elements, but it is consistent in that the <rref>row</rref> acts as the leaf node within the vertical orientation of the <rref>grid</rref>, whereas the <rref>gridcell</rref> is a leaf node within the horizontal orientation of each <rref>row</rref>. Level is not supported on sets of cells within rows, so the <pref>aria-level</pref> attribute is applied to the element with the role <rref>row</rref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11017) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11018) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11042) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11045) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11046) 		<div class="property" id="aria-live">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11047) 			<pdef>aria-live</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11048) 			<div class="property-description">
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11049) 				<p>Indicates that an <a>element</a> will be updated, and describes the types of updates the <a>user agents</a>, <a>assistive technologies</a>, and user can expect from the <a>live region</a>.</p>
318a781f6 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-08-01 10:32:36 -0400 11050) 				<p>The <span>values</span> of this <a>attribute</a> are expressed in degrees of importance. When regions are specified as <code>polite</code>, assistive technologies will notify users of updates but generally do not interrupt the current task, and updates take low priority. When regions are specified as <code>assertive</code>, assistive technologies will immediately notify the user, and could potentially clear the speech queue of previous updates.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11051) 				<p>Politeness levels are essentially an ordering mechanism for updates and serve as a strong suggestion to user agents or assistive technologies. The value may be overridden by user agents, assistive technologies, or the user. For example, if assistive technologies can determine that a change occurred in response to a key press or a mouse click, the assistive technologies may present that change immediately even if the value of the <pref>aria-live</pref> attribute states otherwise.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11052) 				<p>Since different users have different needs, it is up to the user to tweak his or her assistive technologies' response to a live region with a certain politeness level from the commonly defined baseline. Assistive technologies may choose to implement increasing and decreasing levels of granularity so that the user can exercise control over queues and interruptions.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11053) 				<p>When the <a>property</a> is not set on an <a>object</a> that needs to send updates, the politeness level is the value of the nearest ancestor that sets the <pref>aria-live</pref> attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11054) 				<p>The <pref>aria-live</pref> attribute is the primary determination for the order of presentation of changes to live regions. Implementations will also consider the default level of politeness in a <a>role</a> when the <pref>aria-live</pref> attribute is not set in the ancestor chain (e.g., <rref>log</rref> changes are <code>polite</code> by default). Items which are <code>assertive</code> will be presented immediately, followed by <code>polite</code> items. User agents or assistive technologies MAY choose to clear queued changes when an assertive change occurs. (e.g., changes in an assertive region may remove all currently queued changes)</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11055) 				<p>When live regions are marked as <code>polite</code>, assistive technologies SHOULD announce updates at the next graceful opportunity, such as at the end of speaking the current sentence or when the user pauses typing. When live regions are marked as <code>assertive</code>, assistive technologies SHOULD notify the user immediately. Because an interruption may disorient users or cause them to not complete their current task, authors SHOULD NOT use the assertive value unless the interruption is imperative.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11056) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11057) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11080) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_token">token</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11081) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11082) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11083) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11084) 			<table class="value-descriptions">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11085) 				<caption>Values:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11086) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11087) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11088) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11089) 						<th scope="col">Description</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11090) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11091) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11092) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11093) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11094) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">assertive</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11095) 						<td class="value-description">Indicates that updates to the region have the highest priority and should be presented the user immediately.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11096) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11097) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11098) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">off (default)</strong></th>
4fdff5631 index.html     (Nicolás Alvarez     2018-10-15 13:06:24 -0300 11099) 						<td class="value-description">Indicates that updates to the region should not be presented to the user unless the user is currently focused on that region.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11100) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11101) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11102) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">polite</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11103) 						<td class="value-description">Indicates that updates to the region should be presented at the next graceful opportunity, such as at the end of speaking the current sentence or when the user pauses typing.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11104) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11105) 				</tbody>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11108) 		<div class="property" id="aria-modal">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11109) 			<pdef>aria-modal</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11110) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11111) 				<p>Indicates whether an <a>element</a> is modal when displayed.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11112) 				<p>The <pref>aria-modal</pref> <a>attribute</a> is used to indicate that the presence of a "modal" element precludes usage of other content on the page. For example, when a modal dialog is displayed, it is expected that the user's interaction is limited to the contents of the dialog, until the modal dialog loses focus or is no longer displayed.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11113) 				<p>When a modal element is displayed, assistive technologies SHOULD navigate to the element unless focus has explicitly been set elsewhere. Assistive technologies MAY limit navigation to the modal element's contents. If focus moves to an element outside the modal element, assistive technologies SHOULD NOT limit navigation to the modal element.</p>
1b1146efe aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 13:47:00 -0400 11114) 				<p>When a modal element is displayed, authors MUST ensure the interface can be controlled using only descendants of the modal element. In other words, if a modal dialog has a close button, the button should be a descendant of the dialog. When a modal element is displayed, authors SHOULD mark all other contents as inert (such as "inert subtrees" in HTML) if the ability to do so exists in the host language.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11115) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11163) 		<div class="property" id="aria-multiline">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11164) 			<pdef>aria-multiline</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11165) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11166) 				<p>Indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11167) 				<!-- keep the following para synced with its equivalent in #textbox -->
8f52204b1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-08-10 04:12:46 -0400 11168) 				<p class="note">In most user agent implementations, the default behavior of the <kbd>ENTER</kbd> or <kbd>RETURN</kbd> key is different between the single-line and multi-line text fields in HTML. When user has focus in a single-line <code>&lt;input type="text"&gt;</code> element, the keystroke usually submits the form. When user has focus in a multi-line <code>&lt;textarea&gt;</code> element, the keystroke inserts a line break. The <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> <code>textbox</code> role differentiates these types of boxes with the <pref>aria-multiline</pref> attribute, so authors are advised to be aware of this distinction when designing the field.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11169) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11217) 		<div class="property" id="aria-multiselectable">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11218) 			<pdef>aria-multiselectable</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11219) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11220) 				<p>Indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11221) 				<p>Authors SHOULD ensure that selected descendants have the <sref>aria-selected</sref> <a>attribute</a> set to <code>true</code>, and selectable descendant have the <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute set to <code>false</code>. Authors SHOULD NOT use the <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute on descendants that are not selectable.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11222) 				<p class="note">Lists and trees are examples of roles that might allow users to select more than one item at a time.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11223) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11271) 		<div class="property" id="aria-orientation">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11272) 			<pdef>aria-orientation</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11273) 			<div class="property-description">
eddb09b4b aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-07-20 12:58:23 +0200 11274) 				<p>Indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11275) 				<p class="note">In ARIA 1.1, the default value for <pref>aria-orientation</pref> changed from <code>horizontal</code> to <code>undefined</code>. Implicit defaults are defined on some roles (e.g., <rref>slider</rref> defaults to horizontal; <rref>scrollbar</rref> defaults to vertical) but remain undefined on roles where an expected default orientation is ambiguous (e.g., <rref>radiogroup</rref>).</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11276) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11329) 			<pdef>aria-owns</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11330) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11331) 				<p>Identifies an <a>element</a> (or elements) in order to define a visual, functional, or contextual parent/child <a>relationship</a> between <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> elements where the DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship. See related <pref>aria-controls</pref>.</p>
a7868d263 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2019-05-21 19:09:28 -0400 11332) 				<p>The value of the <pref>aria-owns</pref> <a>attribute</a> is a space-separated ID reference list that references one or more elements in the document by ID. The reason for adding <pref>aria-owns</pref> is to expose a parent/child contextual relationship to <a>assistive technologies</a> that is otherwise impossible to infer from the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>.</p>
4001eee2c aria/aria.html (James Nurthen       2016-06-16 15:28:34 -0400 11333) 				<p>If an element has both <pref>aria-owns</pref> and  <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> children then the order of the child elements with respect to the parent/child relationship is the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> children first, then the elements referenced in <pref>aria-owns</pref>. If the author intends that the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> children are not first, then list the DOM children in <pref>aria-owns</pref> in the desired order. Authors SHOULD NOT use <pref>aria-owns</pref> as a replacement for the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> hierarchy. If the relationship is represented in the DOM, do not use <pref>aria-owns</pref>. Authors MUST ensure that an element's ID is not specified in more than one other element's <pref>aria-owns</pref> attribute at any time. In other words, an element can have only one explicit owner.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11334) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11335) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11354) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11358) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_idref_list">ID reference list</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11359) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11362) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11363) 		<div class="property" id="aria-placeholder">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11364) 			<pdef>aria-placeholder</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11365) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11366) 				<p>Defines a short hint (a word or short phrase) intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. A hint could be a sample value or a brief description of the expected format.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11367) 				<p>Authors SHOULD NOT use <pref>aria-placeholder</pref> instead of a label as their purposes are different: The label indicates what kind of information is expected. The placeholder text is a hint about the expected value. See related <pref>aria-labelledby</pref> and <pref>aria-label</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11368) 				<p>Authors SHOULD present this hint to the user by displaying the hint text at any time the control's <span>value</span> is the empty string. This includes cases where the control first receives focus, and when users remove a previously-entered value.</p>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700 11369) 				<p class="note">As is the case with the related <code>placeholder</code> attribute in [[HTML]], use of placeholder text as a replacement for a displayed label can reduce the accessibility and usability of the control for a range of users including older users and users with cognitive, mobility, fine motor skill or vision impairments. While the hint given by the control's label is shown at all times, the short hint given in the placeholder attribute is only shown before the user enters a value. Furthermore, placeholder text may be mistaken for a pre-filled value, and as commonly implemented the default color of the placeholder text provides insufficient contrast and the lack of a separate visible label reduces the size of the hit region available for setting focus on the control.</p>
41fde1c10 index.html     (Stephane Deschamps  2020-02-11 20:00:30 +0100 11370) 				<p class="note">The following examples do not use the HTML <code>label</code> element as it cannot be used to label HTML elements with <code>contenteditable</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11371) 				<p>The following example shows a <rref>searchbox</rref> in which the user has entered a value:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11372) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11373) &lt;span id="label"&gt;Birthday:&lt;/span&gt;
38d5c1291 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-14 19:41:16 -0400 11374) &lt;div contenteditable role="searchbox" aria-labelledby="label" <strong>aria-placeholder="MM-DD-YYYY"</strong>&gt;03-14-1879&lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11375) 				</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11376) 				<p>The following example shows the same <rref>searchbox</rref> in which the user has not yet entered a value or has removed a previously-entered value:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11377) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11378) &lt;span id="label"&gt;Birthday:&lt;/span&gt;
38d5c1291 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-10-14 19:41:16 -0400 11379) &lt;div contenteditable role="searchbox" aria-labelledby="label" <strong>aria-placeholder="MM-DD-YYYY"</strong>&gt;MM-DD-YYYY&lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11380) 				</pre>
