478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11409) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11410) 		<div class="property" id="aria-posinset">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11411) 			<pdef>aria-posinset</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11412) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11413) 				<p>Defines an <a>element</a>'s number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>. See related <pref>aria-setsize</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11414) 				<p>If all items in a set are present in the document structure, it is not necessary to set this <a>attribute</a>, as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the set size and position for each item. However, if only a portion of the set is present in the document structure at a given moment, this <a>property</a> is needed to provide an explicit indication of an element's position.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11415) 				<p>The following example shows items 5 through 8 in a set of 16.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11416) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;h2 id="label_fruit"&gt; Available Fruit &lt;/h2&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11417) &lt;ul role="listbox" aria-labelledby="label_fruit"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11418)   &lt;li role="option" aria-setsize="16" <strong>aria-posinset="5"</strong>&gt; apples &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11419)   &lt;li role="option" aria-setsize="16" <strong>aria-posinset="6"</strong>&gt; bananas &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11420)   &lt;li role="option" aria-setsize="16" <strong>aria-posinset="7"</strong>&gt; cantaloupes &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11421)   &lt;li role="option" aria-setsize="16" <strong>aria-posinset="8"</strong>&gt; dates &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11422) &lt;/ul&gt;</pre>
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 11423) 				<p>Authors MUST set the value for <pref>aria-posinset</pref> to an integer greater than or equal to 1, and less than or equal to the size of the set when that size is known. Authors SHOULD use <pref>aria-setsize</pref>.</p>
3817745f8 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-19 13:09:33 -0400 11424) 				<p>When exposing <code>aria-posinset</code> on a <rref>menuitem</rref>, <rref>menuitemcheckbox</rref>, or <rref>menuitemradio</rref>, authors SHOULD set the value of <code>aria-posinset</code> with respect to the total number of items in the <rref>menu</rref>, excluding any separators.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11425) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11452) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11453) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11454) 		<div class="state" id="aria-pressed">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11455) 			<sdef>aria-pressed</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11456) 			<div class="state-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11457) 				<p>Indicates the current "pressed" <a>state</a> of toggle buttons. See related <sref>aria-checked</sref> and <sref>aria-selected</sref>.</p>
eece07ef5 index.html     (James Nurthen       2020-05-06 15:41:34 -0700 11458) 				<p>Toggle buttons require a full press-and-release cycle to change their value. Activating it once changes the value to <code>true</code>, and activating it another time changes the value back to <code>false</code>. A value of <code>mixed</code> means that the values of more than one item controlled by the button do not all share the same value.  If the <a>attribute</a> is not present, the button is not a toggle button.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11459) 				<p>The <sref>aria-pressed</sref> attribute is similar but not identical to the <sref>aria-checked</sref> attribute. Operating systems support <code>pressed</code> on buttons and <code>checked</code> on checkboxes.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11460) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11461) 			<table class="state-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11462) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11463) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11464) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11469) 				<tbody>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11517) 		<div class="property" id="aria-readonly">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11518) 			<pdef>aria-readonly</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11519) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11520) 				<p> Indicates that the <a>element</a> is not editable, but is otherwise <a>operable</a>. See related <sref>aria-disabled</sref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11521) 				<p>This means the user can read but not set the value of the <a>widget</a>. Readonly elements are relevant to the user, and application authors SHOULD NOT restrict navigation to the element or its focusable descendants. Other actions such as copying the value of the element are also supported. This is in contrast to disabled elements, to which applications might not allow user navigation to descendants.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11522) 				<p>Examples include:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11523) 				<ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11524) 					<li>A form element which represents a constant.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11525) 					<li>Row or column headers in a spreadsheet grid.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11526) 					<li>The result of a calculation such as a shopping cart total.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11527) 				</ul>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11528) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11576) 		<div class="property" id="aria-relevant">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11577) 			<pdef>aria-relevant</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11578) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11579) 				<p>Indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified. See related <pref>aria-atomic</pref>.</p>
6502442a1 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-02 11:04:04 -0700 11580) 				<p>The <a>attribute</a> is represented as a space-separated list of the following <span>values</span>: <code>additions</code>, <code>removals</code>, <code>text</code>; or a single catch-all value <code>all</code>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11581) 				<p>This is used to describe <a>semantically</a> meaningful changes, as opposed to merely presentational ones. For example, nodes that are removed from the top of a log are merely removed for purposes of creating room for other entries, and the removal of them does not have meaning. However, in the case of a buddy list, removal of a buddy name indicates that they are no longer online, and this is a meaningful <a>event</a>. In that case <pref>aria-relevant</pref> will be set to <code>all</code>. When the <pref>aria-relevant</pref> attribute is not provided, the default value, <code>additions text</code>, indicates that text modifications and node additions are relevant, but that node removals are irrelevant.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11582) 				<p class="note"><pref>aria-relevant</pref> values of removals or all are to be used sparingly. Assistive technologies only need to be informed of content removal when its removal represents an important change, such as a buddy leaving a chat room.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11583) 				<p class="note">Text removals should only be considered relevant if one of the specified values is 'removals' or 'all'. For example, for a text change from 'foo' to 'bar' in a live region with a default <pref>aria-relevant</pref> value, the text addition ('bar') would be spoken, but the text removal ('foo') would not.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11584) 				<p><pref>aria-relevant</pref> is an optional attribute of live regions. This is a suggestion to <a>assistive technologies</a>, but assistive technologies are not required to present changes of all the relevant types.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11585) 				<p>When <pref>aria-relevant</pref> is not defined, an element's value is inherited from the nearest ancestor with a defined value. Although the value is a <a href="#valuetype_token_list">token list</a>, inherited values are not additive; the value provided on a descendant element completely overrides any inherited value from an ancestor element.</p>
aa02d6143 index.html     (Joanmarie Diggs     2018-10-18 11:04:45 +0200 11586) 				<p>When text changes are denoted as relevant, user agents MUST monitor any descendant node change that affects the <a href="#textalternativecomputation">accessible name and description computation</a> of the live region as if the accessible name were determined from contents (<a href="#namecalculation">nameFrom: contents</a>). For example, a text change would be triggered if the HTML <code>alt</code> attribute of a contained image changed. However, no change would be triggered if there was a text change to a node outside the live region, even if that node was referenced (via <pref>aria-labelledby</pref>) by an element contained in the live region.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11587) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11624) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11625) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">additions</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11626) 						<td class="value-description">Element nodes are added to the accessibility tree within the live region.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11627) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11628) 					<tr>
fbe91ed94 index.html     (James Craig         2020-05-07 16:31:58 -0700 11629) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row"><strong class="default">additions text (default)</strong></th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11630) 						<td class="value-description">Equivalent to the combination of values, "additions text".</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11631) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11635) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11636) 					<tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11638) 						<td class="value-description">Text content, a text alternative, or an element node within the live region is removed from the accessibility tree.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11639) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11640) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11641) 						<th class="value-name" scope="row">text</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11642) 						<td class="value-description">Text content or a text alternative is added to any descendant in the accessibility tree of the live region.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11643) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11644) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11645) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11646) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11647) 		<div class="property" id="aria-required">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11648) 			<pdef>aria-required</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11649) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11650) 				<p>Indicates that user input is required on the <a>element</a> before a form may be submitted.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11651) 				<p>For example, if the user needs to fill in an address field, the author will need to set the field's <pref>aria-required</pref> attribute to <code>true</code>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11652) 				<p class="note">The fact that the element is required is often presented visually (such as a sign or symbol after the <a>widget</a>). Using the <pref>aria-required</pref> <a>attribute</a> allows the author to explicitly convey to <a>assistive technologies</a> that an element is required.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11653) 				<p>Unless an exactly equivalent native attribute is available, host languages SHOULD allow authors to use the <pref>aria-required</pref> attribute on host language form elements that require input or selection by the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11654) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11655) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11693) 						<td class="value-description">User input is not necessary to submit the form.</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11694) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11701) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11702) 		<div class="property" id="aria-roledescription">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11703) 			<pdef>aria-roledescription</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11704) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11705) 				<p>Defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the <a>role</a> of an <a>element</a>.</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11706) 				<p>Some <a>assistive technologies</a>, such as screen readers, present the role of an element as part of the user experience. Such assistive technologies typically localize the name of the role, and they may customize it as well. Users of these assistive technologies depend on the presentation of the role name, such as "region," "button," or "slider," for an understanding of the purpose of the element and, if it is a widget, how to interact with it.</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11707) 				<p>The <code>aria-roledescription</code> property gives authors the ability to override how assistive technologies localize and express the name of a role. Thus inappropriately using <code>aria-roledescription</code> may inhibit users' ability to understand or interact with an element. Authors SHOULD limit use of <code>aria-roledescription</code> to clarifying the purpose of non-interactive container roles like <rref>group</rref> or <rref>region</rref>, or to providing a <em>more specific</em> description of a <rref>widget</rref>.</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11708) 				<p> When using <code>aria-roledescription</code>, authors SHOULD also ensure that:</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11709) 				<ol>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11710) 					<li>The element to which <code>aria-roledescription</code> is applied has a valid <abbr title="Accessible Rich Internet Applications">WAI-ARIA</abbr> role or has an implicit WAI-ARIA role semantic.</li>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11711) 					<li>The value of <code>aria-roledescription</code> is not empty or does not contain only whitespace characters.</li>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11712) 				</ol>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11713) 				<p>User agents MUST NOT expose the <code>aria-roledescription</code> property if any of the following conditions exist:</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11714) 				<ol>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11715) 					<li>The element to which <code>aria-roledescription</code> is applied does not have a valid WAI-ARIA role or does not have an implicit WAI-ARIA role semantic.</li>
bf6697996 index.html     (Scott O'Hara        2020-03-03 19:49:09 -0500 11716) 					<li>The element to which <code>aria-roledescription</code> is applied has an explicit or implicit WAI-ARIA role where <code>aria-roledescription</code> is <a href="#prohibitedattributes">prohibited</a>.</li>
e0b439a7d index.html     (Peter Krautzberger  2019-04-03 17:01:18 +0200 11717) 					<li>The value of <code>aria-roledescription</code> is empty or contains only whitespace characters.</li>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11718) 				</ol>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11719) 				<p><a>Assistive technologies</a> SHOULD use the value of <code>aria-roledescription</code> when presenting the role of an element, but SHOULD NOT change other functionality based on the role of an element that has a value for <code>aria-roledescription</code>. For example, an assistive technology that provides functions for navigating to the next <rref>region</rref> or <rref>button</rref> SHOULD allow those functions to navigate to regions and buttons that have an <code>aria-roledescription</code>.</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11720) 				<p>The following two examples show the use of <code>aria-roledescription</code> to indicate that a non-interactive container is a "slide" in a web-based presentation application.</p>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11721) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;div role="region" aria-roledescription="slide" id="slide42" aria-labelledby="slide42heading"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11722) &lt;h1 id="slide42heading">Quarterly Report&lt;/h1&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11723) &lt;!-- remaining slide contents --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11724) &lt;/div&gt;</pre>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11725) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;section aria-roledescription="slide" id="slide42" aria-labelledby="slide42heading"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11726) &lt;h1 id="slide42heading">Quarterly Report&lt;/h1&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11727) &lt;!-- remaining slide contents --&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11728) &lt;/section&gt;</pre>
39dac9457 aria/aria.html (Matt King           2016-07-15 11:10:22 -0400 11729) 				<p>In the previous examples, a screen reader user may hear "Quarterly Report, slide" rather than the more vague "Quarterly Report, region" or "Quarterly Report, group."</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11730) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11731) 			<table class="property-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11732) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11733) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11734) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11735) 						<th scope="col">Characteristic</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11736) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11737) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11738) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11739) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11740) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11741) 						<th class="property-related-head" scope="row">Related Concepts:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11742) 						<td class="property-related"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11743) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11744) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11745) 						<th class="property-applicability-head" scope="row">Used in Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11746) 						<td class="property-applicability">All elements of the base markup</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11747) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11748) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11749) 						<th class="property-descendants-head" scope="row">Inherits into Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11750) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11751) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11752) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11753) 						<th class="property-value-head" scope="row">Value:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11754) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_string">string</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11755) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11756) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11757) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11758) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11759) 		<div class="property" id="aria-rowcount">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11760) 			<pdef>aria-rowcount</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11761) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11762) 				<p>Defines the total number of rows in a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-rowindex</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11763) 				<p>If all of the rows are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, it is not necessary to set this <a>attribute</a> as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the total number of rows. However, if only a portion of the rows is present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> at a given moment, this attribute is needed to provide an explicit indication of the number of rows in the full table.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11764) 				<p>Authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-rowcount</pref> to an integer equal to the number of rows in the full table. If the total number of rows is unknown, authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-rowcount</pref> to <code>-1</code> to indicate that the value should not be calculated by the user agent.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11765) 				<p>The following example shows a grid with 2000 rows, of which the first row and rows 100 through 102 are displayed to the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11766) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11767) &lt;div role="grid" <strong>aria-rowcount="2000"</strong>&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11768)   &lt;div role="rowgroup"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11769)     &lt;div role="row" aria-rowindex="1"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11770)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;First Name&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11771)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Last Name&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11772)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Company&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11773)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Phone&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11774)     &lt;/div&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11775)   &lt;/div&gt;

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11826) 		<div class="property" id="aria-rowindex">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11827) 			<pdef>aria-rowindex</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11828) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11829) 				<p>Defines an <a>element's</a> row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-rowcount</pref> and <pref>aria-rowspan</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11830) 				<p>If all of the rows are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>, it is not necessary to set this <a>attribute</a> as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the index of each row. However, if only a portion of the rows is present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> at a given moment, this attribute is needed to provide an explicit indication of each row's position with respect to the full table.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11831) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <span>value</span> for <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> to an integer greater than or equal to 1, greater than the <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> value of any previous rows, and less than or equal to the number of rows in the full table. For a cell or gridcell which spans multiple rows, authors MUST set the value of <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> to the start of the span.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11832) 				<p>Authors SHOULD place <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> on each row. Authors MAY also place <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> on all of the children or <a>owned elements</a> of each row.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11833) 				<p>The following example shows a grid with 2000 rows, of which the first row and rows 100 through 102 are displayed to the user.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11834) 				<pre class="example highlight">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11835) &lt;div role="grid" aria-rowcount="2000"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11836)   &lt;div role="rowgroup"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11837)     &lt;div role="row" <strong>aria-rowindex="1"</strong>&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11838)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;First Name&lt;/span&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11839)       &lt;span role="columnheader"&gt;Last Name&lt;/span&gt;

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11926) 		<div class="property" id="aria-rowspan">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11927) 			<pdef>aria-rowspan</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11928) 			<div class="property-description">
e6a9d9847 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2017-10-24 06:54:53 +0200 11929) 				<p>Defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a <rref>table</rref>, <rref>grid</rref>, or <rref>treegrid</rref>. See related <pref>aria-rowindex</pref> and <pref>aria-colspan</pref>.</p>
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11930) 				<p>This <a>attribute</a> is intended for cells and gridcells which are not contained in a native table. When defining the row span of cells or gridcells in a native table, authors SHOULD use the host language's attribute instead of <pref>aria-rowspan</pref>. If <pref>aria-rowspan</pref> is used on an element for which the host language provides an equivalent attribute, <a>user agents</a> MUST ignore the value of <pref>aria-rowspan</pref> and instead expose the value of the host language's attribute to <a>assistive technologies</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11931) 				<p>Authors MUST set the <span>value</span> of <pref>aria-rowspan</pref> to an integer greater than or equal to 0 and less than the value which would cause the cell or gridcell to overlap the next cell or gridcell in the same column. Setting the value to 0 indicates that the cell or gridcell is to span all the remaining rows in the row group.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11932) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11933) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11957) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11961) 		<div class="state" id="aria-selected">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11962) 			<sdef>aria-selected</sdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11963) 			<div class="state-description">
b30557a6c aria/aria.html (Shane McCarron      2015-09-16 13:06:26 -0500 11964) 				<p>Indicates the current "selected" <a>state</a> of various <a>widgets</a>. See related <sref>aria-checked</sref> and <sref>aria-pressed</sref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11965) 				<p>This <a>attribute</a> is used with single-selection and multiple-selection widgets:</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11966) 				<ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11967) 					<li>Single-selection containers where the currently focused item is not selected. The selection normally follows the focus, and is managed by the <a>user agent</a>.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11968) 					<li>Multiple-selection containers. Authors SHOULD ensure that any selectable descendant of a container in which the <pref>aria-multiselectable</pref> attribute is <code>true</code> specifies a value of either <code>true</code> or <code>false</code> for the <sref>aria-selected</sref> attribute.</li>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11969) 				</ol>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11970) 				<p>Any explicit assignment of <sref>aria-selected</sref> takes precedence over the implicit selection based on focus. If no <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> element in the widget is explicitly marked as selected, assistive technologies MAY convey implicit selection which follows the keyboard focus of the <a href="#managingfocus">managed focus</a> widget. If any <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr> element in the widget is explicitly marked as selected, the user agent MUST NOT convey implicit selection for the widget.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 11971) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12022) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12023) 		<div class="property" id="aria-setsize">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12024) 			<pdef>aria-setsize</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12025) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12026) 				<p>Defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems. Not required if all elements in the set are present in the <abbr title="Document Object Model">DOM</abbr>. See related <pref>aria-posinset</pref>.</p>
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12027) 				<p>This <a>property</a> is marked on the members of a set, not the container element that collects the members of the set. To orient the user by saying an element is "item X out of Y," the <a>assistive technologies</a> would use X equal to the <pref>aria-posinset</pref> <a>attribute</a> and Y equal to the <code>aria-setsize</code> attribute.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12028) 				<p>If all items in a set are present in the document structure, it is not necessary to set this property, as the <a>user agent</a> can automatically calculate the set size and position for each item. However, if only a portion of the set is present in the document structure at a given moment (in order to reduce document size), this property is needed to provide an explicit indication of set size.</p>
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12029) 				<p>Authors MUST set the value of <code>aria-setsize</code> to an integer equal to the number of items in the set. If the total number of items is unknown, authors SHOULD set the value of <code>aria-setsize</code> to <code>-1</code>.</p>
3817745f8 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2016-05-19 13:09:33 -0400 12030) 				<p>When exposing <code>aria-setsize</code> on a <rref>menuitem</rref>, <rref>menuitemcheckbox</rref>, or <rref>menuitemradio</rref>, authors SHOULD set the value of <code>aria-setsize</code> based on the total number of items in the <rref>menu</rref>, excluding any separators.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12031) 				<p>The following example shows items 5 through 8 in a set of 16.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12032) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;h2 id="label_fruit"&gt; Available Fruit &lt;/h2&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12033) &lt;ul role="listbox" aria-labelledby="label_fruit"&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12034)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="16"</strong> aria-posinset="5"&gt; apples &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12035)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="16"</strong> aria-posinset="6"&gt; bananas &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12036)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="16"</strong> aria-posinset="7"&gt; cantaloupes &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12037)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="16"</strong> aria-posinset="8"&gt; dates &lt;/li&gt;
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12038) &lt;/ul&gt;</pre>
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12039) 				<p>The following example shows items 5 through 8 in a set whose total size is unknown.</p>
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12040) 				<pre class="example highlight">&lt;h2 id="label_fruit"&gt; Available Fruit &lt;/h2&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12041) &lt;ul role="listbox" aria-labelledby="label_fruit"&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12042)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="-1"</strong> aria-posinset="5"&gt; apples &lt;/li&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12043)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="-1"</strong> aria-posinset="6"&gt; bananas &lt;/li&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12044)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="-1"</strong> aria-posinset="7"&gt; cantaloupes &lt;/li&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12045)   &lt;li role="option" <strong>aria-setsize="-1"</strong> aria-posinset="8"&gt; dates &lt;/li&gt;
fbab917f1 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-31 09:33:14 -0400 12046) &lt;/ul&gt;</pre>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12047) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12048) 			<table class="property-features">

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12072) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12076) 		<div class="property" id="aria-sort">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12077) 			<pdef>aria-sort</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12078) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12079) 				<p>Indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12080) 				<p>Authors SHOULD only apply this <a>property</a> to table headers or grid headers. If the property is not provided, there is no defined sort order. For each table or grid, authors SHOULD apply <pref>aria-sort</pref> to only one header at a time.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12081) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12137) 		<div class="property" id="aria-valuemax">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12138) 			<pdef>aria-valuemax</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12139) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12140) 				<p>Defines the maximum allowed value for a range <a>widget</a>.</p>
18d0f5687 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2017-08-01 14:49:19 -0400 12141) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure the value of <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> is greater than or equal to the value of <pref>aria-valuemin</pref>. If the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> has a known maximum and minimum, the author SHOULD provide properties for <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemin</pref>.</p>
18d0f5687 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2017-08-01 14:49:19 -0400 12142) 				<p class="note">A range widget starts with a given value, which can be increased until reaching the maximum value, defined by this <a>property</a>. Declaring the minimum and maximum <span>values</span> allows assistive technology to convey the size of the range to users.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12143) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12172) 		<div class="property" id="aria-valuemin">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12173) 			<pdef>aria-valuemin</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12174) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12175) 				<p>Defines the minimum allowed value for a range <a>widget</a>.</p>
18d0f5687 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2017-08-01 14:49:19 -0400 12176) 				<p>Authors MUST ensure the value of <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> is less than or equal to the value of <pref>aria-valuemax</pref>. If the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> has a known maximum and minimum, the author SHOULD provide properties for <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemin</pref>.</p>
18d0f5687 aria/aria.html (James Craig         2017-08-01 14:49:19 -0400 12177) 				<p class="note">A range widget starts with a given value, which can be decreased until reaching the minimum value, defined by this <a>property</a>. Declaring the minimum and maximum <span>values</span> allows assistive technology to convey the size of the range to users.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12178) 			</div>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12205) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12206) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12207) 		<div class="property" id="aria-valuenow">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12208) 			<pdef>aria-valuenow</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12209) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12210) 				<p>Defines the current value for a range <a>widget</a>. See related <pref>aria-valuetext</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12211) 				<p>This property is used, for example, on a range widget such as a slider or progress bar.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12212) 				<p>If the current value is not known (for example, an indeterminate progress bar), the author SHOULD NOT set the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> <a>attribute</a>. If the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute is absent, no information is implied about the current value. If the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> has a known maximum and minimum, the author SHOULD provide properties for <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> and <pref>aria-valuemin</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12213) 				<p>The value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> is a decimal number. If the range is a set of numeric values, then <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> is one of those values. For example, if the range is [0, 1], a valid <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> is 0.5. A value outside the range, such as -2.5 or 1.1, is invalid.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12214) 				<p>For <rref>progressbar</rref> elements and <rref>scrollbar</rref> elements, assistive technologies SHOULD render the value to users as a percent, calculated as a position on the range from <pref>aria-valuemin</pref> to <pref>aria-valuemax</pref> if both are defined, otherwise the actual value with a percent indicator. For elements with role <rref>slider</rref> and <rref>spinbutton</rref>, assistive technologies SHOULD render the actual value to users.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12215) 				<p>When the rendered value cannot be accurately represented as a number, authors SHOULD use the <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> attribute in conjunction with <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> to provide a user-friendly representation of the range's current value. For example, a slider may have rendered values of <code>small</code>, <code>medium</code>, and <code>large</code>. In this case, the values of <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> would be one of the strings: <code>small</code>, <code>medium</code>, or <code>large</code>.</p>
860b14aa7 index.html     (Aaron Leventhal     2020-01-09 16:18:15 -0500 12216) 				<p class="note">If <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> is specified, assistive technologies render that instead of the value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12217) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12218) 			<table class="property-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12219) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12220) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12221) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12222) 						<th scope="col">Characteristic</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12223) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12224) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12225) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12226) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12227) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12228) 						<th class="property-related-head" scope="row">Related Concepts:</th>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700 12229) 						<td class="property-related"><code>&lt;range&gt;</code> element <code>value</code> attribute in [[HTML]]</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12230) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12231) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12232) 						<th class="property-applicability-head" scope="row">Used in Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12233) 						<td class="property-applicability">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12234) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12235) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12236) 						<th class="property-descendants-head" scope="row">Inherits into Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12237) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12238) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12239) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12240) 						<th class="property-value-head" scope="row">Value:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12241) 						<td class="property-value"><a href="#valuetype_number">number</a></td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12242) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12243) 				</tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12244) 			</table>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12245) 		</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12246) 		<div class="property" id="aria-valuetext">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12247) 			<pdef>aria-valuetext</pdef>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12248) 			<div class="property-description">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12249) 				<p>Defines the human readable text alternative of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> for a range <a>widget</a>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12250) 				<p>This property is used, for example, on a range widget such as a slider or progress bar.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12251) 				<p>If the <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> attribute is set, authors SHOULD also set the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute, unless that value is unknown (for example, on an indeterminate <rref>progressbar</rref>).</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12252) 				<p>Authors SHOULD only set the <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> attribute when the rendered value cannot be meaningfully represented as a number. For example, a slider may have rendered values of <code>small</code>, <code>medium</code>, and <code>large</code>. In this case, the values of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> could range from 1 through 3, which indicate the position of each value in the value space, but the <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> would be one of the strings: <code>small</code>, <code>medium</code>, or <code>large</code>. If the <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> attribute is absent, the <a>assistive technologies</a> will rely solely on the <pref>aria-valuenow</pref> attribute for the current value.</p>
860b14aa7 index.html     (Aaron Leventhal     2020-01-09 16:18:15 -0500 12253) 				<p>If <pref>aria-valuetext</pref> is specified, assistive technologies SHOULD render that value instead of the value of <pref>aria-valuenow</pref>.</p>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12254) 			</div>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12255) 			<table class="property-features">
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12256) 				<caption>Characteristics:</caption>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12257) 				<thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12258) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12259) 						<th scope="col">Characteristic</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12260) 						<th scope="col">Value</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12261) 					</tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12262) 				</thead>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12263) 				<tbody>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12264) 					<tr>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12265) 						<th class="property-related-head" scope="row">Related Concepts:</th>
9da0a1f9d index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-10-24 17:24:26 -0700 12266) 						<td class="property-related"> </td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12267) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12269) 						<th class="property-applicability-head" scope="row">Used in Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12270) 						<td class="property-applicability">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12271) 					</tr>

478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12273) 						<th class="property-descendants-head" scope="row">Inherits into Roles:</th>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12274) 						<td class="property-descendants">Placeholder</td>
478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12275) 					</tr>
