478a5bf46 aria/aria.html (Joanmarie Diggs     2015-07-29 13:42:31 -0400 12850) </section>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12851) 		<section>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12852) 			<h2>Candidate Recommendation Exit Criteria</h2>
6a22a7443 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:48:32 -0400 12853) 			<p>WAI-ARIA 1.2 defines a technology that can be used in multiple host languages and exposes features to various device platforms. Specific implementation guidance for these languages and platforms is provided in a set of Accessibility API Mappings (AAMs), including at time of publication <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/core-aam-1.2/">Core AAM</a>, <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/accname-aam-1.1/">Accessible Name and Description AAM</a>, <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/html-aam-1.0/">HTML AAM</a>, <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/graphics-aam-1.0/">Graphics AAM</a>, <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/svg-aam-1.0/">SVG AAM</a>, and <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/dpub-aam-1.0/">Digital Publishing AAM</a>. Testing WAI-ARIA relies on the guidance in those auxiliary specifications. For each WAI-ARIA feature, successful test results in <em>any</em> two implementations mapping <em>any</em> of the accessibility APIs referenced in <em>any</em> of the AAMs using <em>any</em> host language will be
6a22a7443 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:48:32 -0400 12854) 				considered sufficient for the purpose of determining implementability and interoperability of WAI-ARIA. It is not an expectation that the AAMs themselves be at Candidate Recommendation or later stage in order to support WAI-ARIA testing.</p>
8ef3db5e7 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:53:38 -0400 12855) 			<p>WAI-ARIA 1.2 builds upon <a href="http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/">WAI-ARIA 1.1</a>, which met its implementation requirements in November 2017. Only features that are new or changed in WAI-ARIA 1.2 need be tested, as the <a href="http://w3c.github.io/test-results/wai-aria/all.html">WAI-ARIA implementation report</a> provides implementatibility and interoperability evidence for the remaining features. Features that will be tested for WAI-ARIA are the new and changed features listed in the <a href="#changelog">change log</a>.</p>
6a22a7443 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:48:32 -0400 12856) 			<p>The Accessible Rich Internet Applications Working Group intends to submit this document for consideration as a W3C<a href="https://www.w3.org/2020/Process-20200915/#rec-pr">Proposed Recommendation</a> as soon as the following conditions are met:</p>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12857) 			<ol>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12858) 				<li>Define <strong>test cases</strong>: Identify a set of unit tests, feature tests, dynamic tests, and any additional tests needed to cover all ARIA normative requirements;</li>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12859) 				<li>Prepare <strong>test files</strong>: Prepare test files consisting of HTML content enhanced with WAI-ARIA, to cover all the test cases;</li>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12860) 				<li>Test <strong>implementations</strong>: Perform these tests on multiple separate combinations of user agent plus operating system plus accessibility API;</li>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12861) 				<li><strong>Evaluate</strong> test results: Examine results in accessibility APIs as defined by the WAI-ARIA User Agent Implementation Guide;</li>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12862) 				<li>Verify <strong>interoperable</strong> results: Find at least two implementations of each normative requirement where the defined behavior for the respective accessibility API is observed. </li>
55347dd44 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:34:00 -0400 12863) 			</ol>
149e86f2f index.html     (James Nurthen       2023-02-17 09:52:57 -0800 12864) 			<p>The <a href="http://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/1.2/CR/">WAI-ARIA 1.2 Implementations</a> page contains further explanation of the terms and expectations above. It also contains up-to-date information about the test suite, test harness, user agents being examined. Proof of implementation for the new features of ARIA 1.2 can be found in the <a href="https://w3c.github.io/test-results/core-aam-1.2/">CORE-AAM 1.2 implementation report</a>. Implementers who wish to include their tools in the test process will find instructions to submit their implementation for consideration.</p>
da4e380f7 index.html     (Michael Cooper      2020-09-30 17:14:12 -0400 12865) 		</section>

ed5f42e09 index.html     (James Nurthen       2019-01-23 10:28:18 -0800 12942) 			<li>06-Dec-2017: When aria-errormessage is not pertinent, authors MUST either ensure the content is not rendered or remove the aria-errormessage attribute or its value. User agents MUST NOT expose <code>aria-errormessage</code> for an object with an <sref>aria-invalid</sref> value of <code>false</code>.</li>
